title: A New Mood Pervades Gary as It Seeks to Cash In on the Promises That Carter Made to Help the Inner Cities
description: GARY, Ind., Feb. 28Gary's City Hall is a drab, twostory brick building that stands in the shadows of a boardedup Holiday Inn on which the city once built its hopes for a downtown economic revival

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Alligators Are Safe Again
description: As various species of birds, fish and animals tremble on the edge of extinction, it is pleasing to realize that one endangered group, this nation's alligators, is doing very well.

title: Carter Seeks Bill To Thwart Intent Of Arab Boycott
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Carter Administration told a Senate subcommittee today that it had reversed the Ford Administration's policy and would support passage of a law barring American companies from taking part in an Arab economic boycott of Israel.

title: City Defeats Hunter Five For Crown
description: A standingroomonly, boisterous crowd of 4,500 saw Rich Silvera and Ron Glover team for 42 points and lead the City College basketball team to a 6966 victory over Hunter College last nigh,t at City's Mahoney Gymnasium. The Beavers victory, in the tournament finale of the City University of New York, gave them the conference crown for the second straight season.

title: SPERRY RAND CHAIRMAN TO ASSIST UNITED FUND
description: J. Paul Lyet, chairman of the Sperry Rand Corporation, has been named general campaign chairman for the United Fund of Greater New York's 1977 fundraising drive, which begins in April.

title: Topics
description: A late dispatch from the Ralph Nader people discloses that you can get your hernia repaired in Kansas City for $200 as against $650 in Manhattan. The Public Citizen report from which these figures are drawn is unambiguously entitled. Why Not the Most? A Physician's Guide to Locating in Cities with the Most Excessive Medicare Fees in the Country and an HEW Guide to Stopping This Waste of a Billion Dollars. We admire the diligence of the Public Citizens and support their call to H.E.W. Secretary Califano for a reform of Medicare. But until that reform transpires. the nation ought not: to miss the rich possibilities here revealed for surgery cum tourism.

title: CARTER SEEKING BILL TO THWART BOYCOTT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Carter Administration told a Senate subcommittee today that it had reversed the Ford Administration's policy and would support passage of a law barring American companies from taking part in an Arab economic boycott of Israel.

title: Report of F.B.I. Breakin To Bring U.S. Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)A top Justice Department official agreed today to investigate whether an informer for the Federal Bureau'of Investigation broke into the home of a member of Congress or spied on her campaign operations for the bureau.

title: Summer Food Program for Poor Revised by Agricultural Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (UPI)Agriculture Secretary Bob Bergland announced today changes in the Government's summer food program that provides meals for Door children.

title: Braves to Seek Injunction On Suspension of Owner
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 28 (AP)Attorneys for the Atlanta Braves notified Commissioner Bowie Kuhn today that they would seek an injunction against Kuhn's suspension of the team owner, Ted Turner.

title: 2 KEY INDICATORS LAG IN NATION'S ECONOMY BECAUSE OF THE COLD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28More evidence that the American economy was hard hit in January by the severe cold weather and drought showed up today in two key Government indicators of business activity.

title: Terrorism Is Drama in Savages
description: Off Off Broadway used to be really off off. It was either an egoistic community theater, or an egotistical avantgarde, slightly behind the times. I am deliberately and unfairly exaggerating. But the point that needs to be made is that today what we call the Off Off Broadway theater, together with the institutional theatersuch as the New York Shakespeare Festival and Circle in the Squarehas become the truly creative element in New York theater. We must always give our regards to Broadway. But more and more, Broadway is being fed from other sources.

title: Lebanese Close to Israel's Border Are Still Fighting Despite Truce
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Feb. 28More than four months after an Arabimposed ceasefire officially ended the Lebanese civil war, heavy fighting continues daily in southern Lebanon between Palestinian commando units and rightwing Christian militias relying on Israeli support.

title: Roy Abernethy, 70, Former American Motors Chief
description: DETROIT, Feb. 28 (AP)Roy Abernethy, former president and chief executive officer of the American Motors Corporation, died today in Tequestra, Fla. He was 70 years old.

title: 11,697 Fans Attend Opener At Roosevelt
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Feb. 28 New York harness racing, in the doldrums from a business standpoint for many months, finally got a shot in the arm tonight as Roosevelt Raceway opened its 150night 1977 season.

title: C.I.A. Money Flowed, but U.S. Aides Insist It Was for Intelligence
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 After more than a week of allegations, denials and clarifications, it is now clear that the Central Intelligence Agency funneled large sums of money to foreign leaders, but officials insist that the payments were intended not as bribery but for intelligence services In one way or another, almost all of the dozen foreign leaders who have been identified in news accounts have issued denials and, in two cases, President Carter has written letters saying the reports were unfounded.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Set for Court Action to Remove Fitzsimmons From Teamsters
description: The Government and the teamsters union were poised for a showdown yesterday as the Labor Department prepared to go to court if necessary to remove the union president, Frank E. Fitzsimmons, as a trustee of the union's major pension fund.

title: Beame Maps PublicPrivate Effort To Clean City Streets and Parks
description: A spring cleanup campaign to repair thousands of potholes and sweep 6.000 miles of city streets, parks and sewer catch basins was announced yesterday by Mayor Beame.

title: Airport in Plains, Ga., Is Offered for Sale
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 25G. Thomas Peterson, the Plains Airport operator who spent much of the last two years flying Jimmy Carter around the United States, is seeking a top job with the Federal Aviation Administration and has added his increasingly busy grass strip to the growing list of real estate for sale in the President's home town.

title: $1 .5 Million Overpayment Charged In State Subsidy to Bus Companies
description: JERSEY CITY, Feb. 28The chairman and the counsel of the Special Bus Subsidy Program Study Commission charged today that New Jersey bus companies were overpaid $1.5 million in state subsidies between July 1, 1975, and June 30, 1976, and returned only $20,000.

title: Despite Hint of Mafia Tie, Lottery Let Promoter Take Vending Role
description: A business promoter was allowed to become one of the principal officers of New York. State's largest lotteryvending company despite a state investigation that found he was suspected of having received financial hacking from organizedcrime figures.

title: Yank Pitching Recruits Yearn, Fear and Wonder
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 28When a former Yankee said, It's great to be young and a Yankee. he wasn't thinking of the many young pitchers who dot the Yankee camp this spring.

title: Archeologist Doubts Hunters Led To Extinction of Early Mammals
description: A Seattle archeologist has challenged the popular view that early human hunters were responsible for the great wave of extinctions that killed off most of the large mammals in North America between 10,000 and 13,000 years ago.

title: A City Looking Down the Well Again
description: Two incidents of the past weekend warn that time running out for the City of New York to take the precise measure of its fiscal crisis and save itself from the disaster of bankruptcy. And it is certainly no time for the parties negotiating the city's next reprieve allow their talks to break down or to play brinkmanship.

title: Sudan Joins EgyptianSyrian Command
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Feb. 28The Sudan today joined the loose political command established in December by Syria and Egypt to coordinate strategy toward Israel.

title: Search Grows for Nevada Unionist; Dispute on Pension Fund Reported
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb 28Al Bramlet, the head of the culinary union in Las Vegas, telephoned his daughter last Thursday afternoon and has not been heard from since. The search for him has gradually intensified until it now has Federal officials avidly though unofficially interested.

title: FISCAL BILL DRAWN TO ASSIST BUFFALO
description: ALBANY, Feb. 28The Legislature will vote this week to give Buffalo, the state's secondlargest city, a new fiscal tool that may allow it to return to the bond market for the first time in three years.

title: Curtain Rod and Mattress Launched Vaulter's Career
description: It began for Dave Day with a bamboo curtain rod. Honest. Right next to the Pennsylvania Railroad tracks that ran through his backyard in Edison, N.J.

title: United Press International MANAGERIAL TEAM: Bill Veeck, left, owner of the Chicago White Sox, chats with Bob Lemon, manager, during team workout in Sarasota, Fla.
Met Plans a Season of 20 Operas, Including Four New Productions
description: The Metropolitan Opera will present 20 productions next season, four of which will be new, 13 will be revivals and only 3 will be held over from this season. Two of the new productions will be borrowed from the San Francisco Opera, Donizetti's La Favorita and Massenet's Thais. The other two are Verdi's Rigoletto and Wagner's Tannhauser.

title: Europe's esignersinU.S.: Soft Sell
description: Now is the time for all good European fashion designers to pay a seasonal visit to their New York friends. Their collections for next fall are being prepared in their workrooms, their spring styles are beginning to sell here, and isn't it a good idea to help things along with a personal appearance or two?

title: U.S. MAY SUE MAINE IN INDIAN LAND CASE
description: PORTLAND, Me., Feb. 28The Federal Government said today that it would sue the State of Maine to recover land for the Passamaquoddy and Penobscot Indian tribes unless an outofcourt settlement was reached by June 1.

title: RESULTS
description: (OTB payoffs subject to 5% tax)

title: Interest Is High In Princeton Vote On Student Posts
description: PRINCETON, Feb. 28Interest is higher than usual in this year's Princeton University student government elections tomorrow: one of the three candidates for chairman, the highest office, is a declared homosexual and gay activist.

title: Waldheim Sees Danger if Mideast Talks Don't Resume
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Feb. 28Secretary General Kurt Waldheim, reporting to the Security Council on his recent Middle East mission, warned today of grave dangers unless agreement is reached on resuming negotiations for a settlement.

title: 6 Killed in San Salvador In Clashes With Troops; State of Siege Declared
description: SAN SALVADOR, Feb. 28 (UPI)Six people were killed today when troops charged a downtown square in which 2,000 supporters of a defeated presidential candidate were barricaded.

title: Northern Telecom Signs Accord With Ericsson
description: Northern Telecom Ltd., Montrealbased manufacturer of telephone equipment, said it had signed a licensing agreement with Socit Francaise des Telephones Ericsson granting it rights to make and market the Canadian company's decorator telephones in France and overseas markets. The Ericsson concern is a subsidiary of ThomsonCSF of Paris. Northern Telecom said it has already sold more than 75,000 of the telephones to France since 1974.

title: AMIN DELAYS AGAIN; FIXES NO NEW DATE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28President Idi Amin of Uganda today postponed for second time a meeting he had scheduled with the more than 200 Americans living in his country.

title: Philippine Democracy, an American Legacy, Has Crumbled
description: MANILAAmericans used to say with a measure of pride that whatever the wrongs of colonialism, the United States left behind in its former possession, the Philippines, a firmly founded democratic system.

title: Closer Check on Drug Advertising Urged as F.T.C. Opens Hearings
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 28Nonprescription drug advertisements should be scrutinized in advance by panels of behavioral scientists if the language used in them to make claims differs from that approved by the Food and Drug Administration for use on package labels, according to Robert Choate, chairman of the Council on Children, Media and Merchandising.

title: Television
description: 10:00 A.M. Riding High (Part II) (7)

title: Companies List Reports Covering Their Sales and Earnings Figures
Article 9  No Title
description: A worker at Bridgeport Brass signaling an overhead loader in shipping area for copper tube used in home and commercial heating systems.

title: Notes on People
description: Shortly before Queen Elizabeth II was due to leave Parliament House in Wellington. New Zealand, an offduty detective yesterday disarmed a man with a loaded air rifle. Bill Hooper, a detective who had taken off a halfhour early so he could watch the British monarch open Parliament, grabbed the man from behind as he pulled the rifle from a gun case. The incident occurred about 63 feet from where the Queen was due to pass after leaving the Parliament building. The man had already been spotted by our surveillance headquarters and the police were quietly moving toward him when Detective Hooper arrested him, said Chief Inspector Roger Cotterill. The rifle was loaded with a pellet and at close range it would be almost lethal. Queen Elizabeth is on a 25th Jubilee tour of Commonwealth capitals in the Pacific.

title: Cuba Extends Fishing Zone And Hints at U.S. Talks
description: HAVANA, Feb. 28 (Reuters)Cuba today extended its fishing waters to 200 miles and, in a clear reference to the United States, declared itself ready to open negotiations with neighboring countries. The United States also extends its fishing waters to 200 miles as of tonight.

title: Reducing the Deadly Flow
description: Congress has mandated that all pollution of waterways halt by 1985. The business community, particularly the last decade, has made impressive progress in meeting this ambitious goal. But inevitably companies have sought exceptions in situations where the plants are old or the pollution minimal or the cleanup costs are enormous. In the ongoing struggle over water pollution control, Variances are the name of the game.

title: Frick Addition Echoes Original, a Holdover From Innocent Times
description: A member of Community Board 3, which covers the Upper East Side, was once told by a psychiatrist that he sent his troubled patients to relax at the Frick Collection. There should not be much surprised to that: Henry Clay Frick's limestone palace of 191314 by Carrere & Hastings is a place of such serenity that it carries most visitors worlds away from New York. The Frick is an institution of such conservatism that it resists change utterly, and when change comes, the museum's administration endeavors to hide it. For example, when an admission charge was instituted last year, the Frick installed not cash registers but a polished wooden box with discreet gold lettering that looked more like a piece of the original design than a 1976 intrusion.

title: Police in Seoul Crack Down After Prayer Service
description: SEOUL, Tuesday, March 1The police today overpowered two middleaged women, each under 5 foot tall, as they emerged from a Protestant prayer service on the national holiday commemorating the independence movement against Japan. The women were driven away in police cars, held down in the rear seats by burly plainclothesmen, who sat on them.

title: Books of The Times
description: Stephen King is one of the hottest novelists currently working the horroroccult genre. His books Carrie and Salem's Lot were best sellers in paperback, having been given a considerable boost by the popularity of the movie of Carrie. Judging from his latest novel, The Shining, he is a writer of fairly engaging and preposterous claptrap. Ranked on a scale of from 0 to Ira Levin and Thomas Tryon, to name two leading practitioners in this vein, he would score, I should say, about a 75. His long suit is an en

title: TV: ABC PrimeTime Specials
description: Tomorrow night ABC is offering another of its primetime lineups devoted exclusively to musicvariety specials. Al. 8, Dorothy Hamill, the figure skater, will glide about with the Carpenters, Beau Bridges and Edward Villella of the New York City Ballet. John Denver will come on at 9, thanking God that he's a country boy, with a little help from Glen Campbell, Roger Miller and Mary Kay Place of Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman. Both Miss Hamill and Mr. Denver are veterans of the ABC specials scene. For the 10 o'clock slot, however, the network has snared someone new: Barry Manilow.

title: Decline Found in Number Of Poor Schoolchildren
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)The number of schoolchildren below the poverty level dropped by 569,000 throughout the country in the first half of this decade, but the South accounted for more than that total and the number actually rose in other areas.

title: Kysor Moves to Reject Bliss &
description: The Kysor Industrial Corporation of Cadillac. Mich., reported that its executive committee would recommend to its board that the offer of Bliss & Laughlin Industries to buy Kysor be rejected. No reason was given for the rejection. Last week Bliss & Laughlin made an offer to buy Kysor for a minimum of $32 million.

title: Penn Wins But So Does Princeton
description: Pennsylvania is hanging in there and the Ivy League basketball battle isn't settled quite yet.

title: CARTER AND TOP AIDES TALK WITH GOVERNORS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 President Carter symbolized a promised new era of Federalstate cooperation today by inviting four dozen governors to the White House for a twoandahalfhour meeting with his Cabinet and top advisers.

title: Frank J. Bowden Is Dead at 68; Nationally Ranked Tennis Star
description: Frank J. Bowden, a nationally ranked tennis player of the 1930's and 40's, died yesterday of a heart attack in Morristown (N. .1.) Memorial Hospital. He was GS years old and resided in Chatham, N. J.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A move by the Securities and Exchange Commission to make the Boeing Company disclose the identities of 18 highlyplaced consultants it had hired was blocked at least temporarily yesterday by a Federal Appeals Court order. The court ruled that the names of the consultants, contained? in a motion filed by the S.E.C., remain under seal.

title: Police Seek Slayer Of a Young Woman Knifed in Her Bed
description: A killer who left a 24yearold woman fatally stabbed in her bed was being sought yesterday by New York City detectives.

title: Soviet Negotiator Returns From Peking
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 28The Soviet Union's chief representative at the border talks with China left Peking today after an evidently unsuccessful threemonth effort to achieve progress in the longdeadlocked negotiations.

title: Three Suits at Heart of Banks
description: Three suitsone alleging fraud by New York City and seven large banks, and two others challenging the constitutionality of the Municipal Assistance Corporationare at the heart of the bank uneasiness over participating in a solation to New York's moratorium debt problem.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: AFTER THE FLOOD: An employee of the Lodi Housing Authority sweeping mud from the back door of a senior citizens housing unit on North Main Street. The floodwaters last week reached about to the top of the mop against

title: Canterbury Glass Arrives for Steuben Show
description: Only three of the 330 passengers aboard the LondontoNew York jet late Sunday knew they were sitting on top of a tonload of treasurestainedglass windows from Canterbury Cathedral.

title: Carter Guidance Reported Sought on Hussein Article
description: WASHINGTON, FEB. 28 (UPI)President Carter's press secretary said today that The Washington Post had asked for White House guidance before disclosing alleged payments by the Central Intelligence Agency to King Hussein of Jordan.

title: People and Business
description: Attorney General Bell Tells Baker To Terminate Service by May 31

title: TUNA MEN FIGHT BAR TO FOREIGN REGISTRY
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 28Representatives of the American tuna fleet will urge Secretary of Commerce Juanita M. Kreps at a meeting in Washington tomorrow to authorize transfer of their vessels to foreign flags to escape what they call utter economic disaster.

title: Edward Bennett Williams Hopes to Aid Jailed Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)At the request of Alexander I. Solzhenitsyn, she trial lawyer Edward Bennett Williams has agreed to help defend an imprisoned Soviet dissident.

title: Armored Truck in Brooklyn Robbed of $70,000
description: Two armed bandits overpowered two guards and the driver of an armored truck in Brooklyn yesterday and escaped with $70,000 in cash and $350,000 in checks the police reported.

title: Music: 2 Rarities by the Pro Arte
description: A couple of Romantic rarities Listz's Maldiction for piano and strings and the Sixth Symphony of Asger Hamerik  turned up Sunday night at an excellent Tully Hall concert by the New York Pro Arte Chamber Orchestra, a 12member string ensemble founded and conducted by Raffael Adler.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: TOE LINE Trisha Brown is a choreographer who does all sorts or interesting dances. Some time ago she climbed the wall at a museumand her field. if you hadn't guessed is modern ?? Today at 12:30 P.M. Miss Brow. and four members of her dance company will give a demonstrationlecture at Pratt Institute's Memorial Hall. She will speak and do at the same time in one number.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: UNION LEADERS QUIT TALK ON FISCAL CRISIS OVER BANKS'ACTION
description: Negotiations on New York City's latest fiscal emergency broke down yesterday afternoon when leaders of the municipal labor unions stormed out of their talks with bankers at City Hall, and Mayor Beame accused the banks of stalling and holding a gun at our heads.

title: Four Days on Subway: A Fresh Look at Lingering Problems
description: What is happening in the subways? A spate of publicity over recent crime has raised public concern, spurring intensified patrolling by the 2,954man transit police force. Budgetdictated service cutsincluding shorter fourcar and fivecar trains in offpeak hourshave aggravated congestion. According to the Transit Authority, each day in the subways brings about a dozen open felony complaints. or crimes against riders with no policemen present. In addition, there may he 50 or more lesser incidentslewdness. petty theft, vandalism. Twothirds of the crime occurs off the trains, on the platforms and plazas.

title: Jersey Fugitive Arrested
description: NEWARK, Feb. 28 (UPI)A convicted rapist who broke out of jail last month was arrested in a restaurant parking area on the New Jersey Turnpike near Woodbridge, N. J. last weekend, according to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The suspect, Raymond Alves, 34 years old, was arrested Saturday on charges of unlawful flight to avoid confinement, a spokesman said. Mr. Alves escaped from the Bergen County Jail Jan. 10. He had been convicted of rape, kidnap and assault last December.

title: Boxer Is Judged Best At Elm City Dog Show
description: NEW HAVEN, Feb. 28Ch. Galanjud's Blue Chip, a boxer owned by Gale and Jud Streicher of Scarsdale, N.Y., and handled by Jane Forsyth of Southbury, Conn., was selected best in show yesterday at the 66th annual event of the Elm City Kennel Club.

title: Sage Foundation to Focus on City Problems]
description: Three prominent social scientists and the deputy chancellor of the New York City Board of Education will join the Russell Sage Foundation in the fall to direct a program with new emphasis on the study of New York City's problems and institutions.

title: Barons, Led by Maruk, Halt Blues in N.H.L., 52
description: ST. LOUIS, Feb. 28 (AP)Dennis Maruk of Cleveland scored off a defenseman's skate in the opening period and later set up a goal by a linemate, leading the Barons to a 52 victory over the St. Louis Blues in a National Hockey League game tonight.

title: Price of Gold Soars
description: BRUSSELS, Feb. 28 (UPI)The price of gold, already at its highest levels in over a year, shot up again today while the dollar eased on most European money markets. The Swiss franc came under renewed pressure.

title: 2 KEY INDICATORS LAG IN NATION'S ECONOMY BECAUSE OF THE COLD
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28More evidence that the American economy was hard hit in January by the severe cold weather and drought showed up today in two key Government indicators of business activity.

title: Paper in Los Angeles Gets Contract and Single Union
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 28 (UPDEmployees of The Los Angeles HeraldExaminer, a Hearst Corporation newspaper that has been nonunion since it was struck 10 years ago, voted last night to he represented by a single union. The vote came as the employees ratified a new threeyear contract with the newspaper.

title: Carey and Liberal Party to Confer On Possible Coalition on Mayoralty
description: Governor Carey is to meet with Liberal Party leaders tomorrow to discuss a possible DemocraticLiberal coalition in the mayoral campaign in New York City.

title: America Is All They Know, But They're Not Quite at Home
description: LOS ANGELES  When someone points out that I'm Asian, said 17yearold Kimi Sumner, I feel odd. think of myself as being totally American. Sometimes it's easy to forget, but people make you remember.

title: Mississippi to Sell Ant Bait Despite Health Peril
description: ABERDEEN. Miss., Feb. 28 (AP)The State of Mississippi plans to sell a mixture used to attack fire ants that includes the insectide Mirex, which has been shown to cause cancer in some animals in laboratory tests.

title: St. Joe Minerals Raises Lead Price 2c a Pound
description: The St. Joe Minerals Corporation has instituted the fourth round of price increases this year for lead. The company said it was raising its price by 2 cents to 31 conts a pound, effective immediately. Other concerns following suit included: NL Industries Inc.: the Bunker Hill Company, a subsidiary of the Gulf Resources and Chemical Corporation and Amax Lead and Zinc Inc.. a subsidiary of Amax Inc.

title: N.L.R.B. SHIFTS PROCEDURE FOR WEIGHING UNION BIAS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)The national Labor Relations Board ruled today that it would no longer consider whether a union discriminated by race or sex before it certified the union as the bargaining agent for a group of employees.

title: Dow Gains 2.99 To Endat 936.42 In Slow Trading
description: Despite adverse economic news, the stock market advanced slightly yesterday in the slowest trading in more than three months.

title: Labor's Controversial Agenda
description: Battle lines are being drawn for the fiercest conflict over revision of the Federal labor laws since Congress passed the TaftHartley Act over President Truman's veto 30 years ago. The decision by the American Federation of Labor and Congross of Industrial Organizations to press for Federal nullification of state right to work laws and for other legal changes aimed at making unions stronger opens a fight that is as much social and political as it is economic.

title: Limit Gains Shown For Futures Prices In Coffee and Cocoa
description: The normally volatile commodity futures markets were even more so yesterday, with limit gains again in coffee and Cocoa, a sharp rise in cotton, strong advances in metals and a convulsive session for grain and soybean traders in Chicago.

title: Robinson Named Head of American Express
description: The American Express Company announced yesterday top management changes after Howard L. Clark decided at the age of 61 to step clown as chairman and chief executive officer April 25.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Five young inmates at the Nassau County Correctional Center in East Meadow. L. I.. have been indicted on charges that they sexually assaulted three other male inmates in the youth tier. According to District Attorney Denis Dillon's office, authorities learned of the incidents, said to have taken place Feb. 12, when one of the young victims told a priest the following morning.

title: Advertising
description: George is going to do what George wants to do, I have a hunch, said Donald E. Creamer, chairman and chief execuive of Creamer/iFSR, as he formally announced the arrival of George Lois as president of the agency. As for George, he talked about synergism a lot.

title: Japanese Will Begin Construction On New Naval Base in Kuwait
description: KUWAIT. Feb. 28 (UPI)A Japanese company will begin construction work on a Kuwaiti naval base under a multimilliondollar agreement signed today.

title: OutofTown New York Residents To Pay a Lower Tuition at City U.
description: New York city's Board of Higher Education voted last night to allow outoftown state residents attending the senior colleges of the City University of New York to pay the same undergraduate tuition charges as students living in the city, effective this fall. Present tuition in the upper division of the fouryear colleges is $462.50 a semester for city residents and $712.50 for those from out of town.

title: Strike Affecting Race Tracks Is Averted
description: A threatened strike that could shut down many of the nation's racetracks was averted at least temporarily last night at headquarters of the American Totalisator Company in Towson, Md. A company spokesman announced the parties in the labor dispute had agreed to a 10day extension of the strike deadline.

title: Polyester Held a Winner Over A crylonitrile in War About SoftDrink Bottles
description: The battle between the use of acrylonitrite and polyester in making plastic softdrink bottles appears, at least temporarily, to have been won by polyester.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Students at the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey lost the first round yesterday in an attempt to block a tuition rise of up to 440 percent. A threejudge Appellate Division panel in Newark refused to issue a temporary restraining order to halt the increases for a New Jersey resident four $1.750 to $3,000 a year and from $3,000 to $4,000 for outofstate residents. In addition, the panel refused to block the school from suspending students who did not pay the increase by March 4.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney reports that the widespread conclusion is that inventories of many goods are at such low levels that a major rebuilding effort will have to he undertaken by the second half of the year. Page 45.

title: Citizens'
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The leaders of 21 major environmental organizations announced today that they would organize a nationwide citizens campaign to rally support for President Carter's decision to cut funding for 19 big Federal water projects.

title: Kingman, Still Unsigned, Works Out With bets
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Feb. 28Dave Kingman joined the New York Mets in their fourth workout of spring training today, but continued his holdout for a longrange, $3 million contract that could iced to a money revolt by other stars of the team.

title: Canada G.N.P. Off 0.6% in Quarter
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 28 (Reuters)Canada's gross national product, adjusted for inflation, fell 0.6 percent in the last three months of 1976. Statistics Canada said today. The agency said that the decline followed a revised gain of 0.5 percent in the third quarter of last year.

title: UNION LEADERS QUIT TALK ON FISCAL CRISIS OVER BANKS'
description: Negotiations on New York City's latest fiscal emergency broke down yesterday afternoon when leaders of the municipal labor unions stormed out of their talks with bankers at City Hall, and Mayor Beame accused the banks of stalling and holding a gun at our heads.

title: PROFIT RISES 562% AT ALLISCHARMERS
description: The Allis  Chalmers Corporation, diversified manufacturer of equipment for industry, achieved record results for the quarter and year ended last Dec. 31, with profit increases of 56.2 percent and 99.7 percent, respectively.

title: Carey Panel to Propose Forming 2 New Public University Systems
description: Governor Carey's commission on postsecondary education intends to recommend today that two new and primarily statefinanced systems of public higher education be established to replace the existing City and State Universities.

title: Caller Demands Ransom
description: LAS VEGAS Nev., Feb. 28 (AP) A local television station reported today that it had received an anonymous telephone call from a man demanding $500,000 ransom for Mr. Bramlet. The police said that they doubted the caller was involved in the case.

title: Suffolk Police Commissioner Scores Scotti Report
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Feb. 28The Suffolk County Police Commissioner, Eugene R. Kelley, a Republican, charged tonight that the criticism of him in last week's report by a special state prosecutor was an attempt by the Democratic Party in the state, beginning with the Governor, to destroy his career.

title: Silversmith Puts a Sheen On the Past
description: There's a medieval quality to Nilda Getty's work. The exhibition of her oxidized sterling and fine silver body jewelry, belts and objects d'art at the Kruger Gallery, 842 Madison Avenue, between 69th and 70th Streets, through March 25, brings to mind the armor that knights errant were as they rode out to rescue the lady fair.

title: Occidental Oil to Seek Recovery in Venezuela
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation announced that it will file suit in the Venezuelan Supreme Court to recover its investment in a nationalized oil concession near Lake Maracaibo.

title: N.B.A. Issues Memo Seeking a Curb on Violence
description: Larry O'Brien, the commissioner of the National Basketball Association, has warned the coaches and players that a continuation of punching and fighting will be met with stern measures by his office, including ejections from the game, fines and suspensions.

title: M.A.C. Bond Prices Fall Sharply I As New York's Troubles Worsen
description: Prices of Municipal Assistance Corporation bonds declined sharply yesterday as New York City's financial difficulties deepened once again. Bonds of the state agency dropped as much as 2 points, partly because the Secretary of the

title: 4 LOCAL BOARDS SUPERSEDED BY ANKER ON ETHNIC DATA
description: Four community school boards in New York City that had refused to collect ethnic data required for state and Federal surveys were superseded yesterday by Chancellor Irving Anker. M the same time, Mr. Anker lifted his earlier supersession orders on Districts 20 and 21 in Brooklyn, which have since complied with orders to collect the data.

title: Rhodesia Plans to Recruit More Into Security Forces
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 28 (UPI)The Government said today that planned to recruit 12,000 men aged 38 to 50 into the Rhodesian security forces and that the use of women cannot be overlooked in the fight against black nationalist guerrillas.

title: Africans Decide to Widen Boycott to Other Countries
description: LOME, Togo, Feb. 28 (Reuters)The African boycott of sports events involving New Zealand will he widened to include any country maintaining sports links with South Africa, the Organization of African Unity Ministerial Council decided at a meeting today.

title: Valley Forge Will Become A U.S. Park on March 31
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 28 (AP) The National Park Service said today that would assume control March 31 of Valley Forge Park, the site where George Washington's Continental Army spent its winter of despair in 177778.

title: NEIGHBORHOODS FIGHT DIVERSION OF U.S. AID
description: A key part of the Beame administration's plan for New York City's fiscal recovery the diversion of $50 million in Federal communitydevelopment funds to help meet normal city expenses is being bitterly opposed by an expanding coalition of neighborhood and antipoverty groups from all over the city.

title: Daniel P. O'Connell Is Dead at 91; OldTime Albany Democratic Boss
description: Daniel P. O'Connell, the strongwilled patriarch of Democratic politics in Albany, died there yesterday of a respiratory ailment.

title: Firestone Tire Is Suing to Recover $625,000 in Political Slush Fund
description: AKRON. Ohio, Feb. 28The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company filed suit here today seeking recovery of more than $625,000 from Robert P. Beasley, who maintained an illegal political slush fund for Firestone from 1970 to 1973. Mr. Beasley. 63 years old, retired last May 31 as vice chairman of Firestone, the world's secondlargest rubber company.

title: Killer Whale Bears 6Foot, 125lb. Calf
description: LOS ANGELES, 28 (AP)Corky the killer whale gave birth today to a 6foot, 125pound calf, believed to be the first time a killer whale has ever been born in captivity during the ten years the mammals have been held, officials said.

title: Money
description: Monday, February 28, 1977

title: Conference Standings
description: (Includes games of Feb. 26.)

title: EDDIE ANDERSON, 71, BENNY'S ROCHESTER; GravelVoiced Comedian Noted for What's That, Boss? Line Played Valet for More Than 30 Years
description: Eddie (Rochester) Anderson, the gravelvoiced comedian who played Jack Benny's valet for more than 30 years, died yesterday at the Motion Picture Country House and Hospital in Los Angeles. He was 71 years old and had been under treatment for a heart ailment since December.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Canadiens Serge Savard, left, and a teammate, Butch Bouchard, receiving pointers from Henri Filion, driver, at Roosevelt Raceway last night.

title: State's Plan for MentalHealth Care Termed Futile by Senator Menza
description: EAST BRUSWICK, Feb. 28Calling the current plan for a comprehensive system of mental health care a paper revolution, State Senator Alexander .J. Menza said today that he believed bills before the Legislature to improve and expand county facilities with state aid would fail and that it would take a long time in this state to get anything going for the mentally ill.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Thelma, 15: I Went to a Lot of Religions
description: Children's Express, a monthly magazine written by youngsters 13 years old and under, has been investigating institutions that house children in trouble. Following are excerpts from the first article in a planned series, to start in a forthcoming issue. The person interviewed, a New Yorker, is identified only as Thelma, 15, to protect her identity.

title: Steel Output, at 2.31 Million Tons, Up 2% to New 1977 Weekly High
description: Steel production for the week ended Feb. 26 was up for the third consecutive week and hit a new weekly 1977 high of 2.31 million tons, the American Iron And Steel Institute reported yesterday. This represented a gain of 2 percent over the week ended Feb. 19 when domestic mills poured 2.26 million tons. The latest production level meant that the industry was utilizing 75.1 percent of its total available capability against 73.6 percent a week earlier.

title: Market Place
description: A few years ago, investing in the stock market was a relatively simple process. A person called his broker, had some advice relayed from the research department and then proceeded to buy or sella stock.

title: House Inquiry Is Asked On Panamanian Loans By Marine Midland Bank
description: Representative George V. Hansen, an Idaho Republican, yesterday asked that the House subcommittee on domestic monetary policy investigate loans by the Marine Midland Bank to Panama, saying they may be a reason why the New York bank appeared at the top of a problem list drawn up by the Federal Reserve Board.

title: Conferees Agree on Budget Figures Close to Carter's
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28A SenateHouse conference acted today to accommodate President Carter's economic stimulus package within the more rigorous budget procedures of the Congress.

title: U.S. MAY SUE MAINE IN INDIAN LAND CASE
description: PORTLAND, Me., Feb. 28The Federal Government said today that it would sue the State of Maine to recover land for the Passamaquoddy and Penobscot Indian tribes unless an outofcourt settlement was reached by June 1.

title: EXGRUMMAN AGENT ALLEGES PRESSURES IN SALES OF F14'S
description: A former sales agent for the Grumman Corporation has charged that two onetime close associates of President Kennedy were taken to a key business meeting in early 1974 to intimidate the agent into selling his contract to represent the planemaker in the sale of F14's to Iran.

title: Amin Delays Meeting Again
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28Field Marshal Amin had originally demanded that the meeting be held today and had said that no American would be allowed to leave the country until it was held. It was then put off until Wednesday with the official explanation that many of the Americans, missionaries working in remote areas, needed more time to get to the meeting, which was originally set in Kampala, the capital, and.then moved to Entebbe air, port.

title: About New York
description: From a distance, through the Times Square foreground of mongrel leisure and merchandized desire, the sight of two new 45story apartment towers standing empty can seem as eerie as Stonehenge. What are they doing there? Did they break loose from the East Side during some midnight convulsion of the fiscal crisis?

title: Argentina Says Carter Interferes
description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 28Argentina's military Government said today that the Carter Administration was interfering in the internal affairs of this country by reducing military aid to show its concern for human rights.

title: Patagonia Interest in Unit Denied
description: The Patagonia Corporation, a bank holding company that owns the Great Western Bank and Trust Company of Phoenix, said yesterday that the Federal Reserve Board has denied its application to permanently retain a 79.5 percent interest in its wholly owned subsidiary, the Pima Savings and Loan Association. Patagonia said that it intended to make another application to the Fed to retain all of its interest in Pima.

title: HIGH COURT TO WEIGH OIL TANKER CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The Supreme Court agreed today to consider whether individual states may regulate the presence of oil tankers in their ports and waterways to prevent oil spills or whether the states must depend instead on the Federal Government to do the regulating.

title: News of Hotel Fire in Moscow Is Minimized by the Authorities
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 28If a fire had swept through New York's largest hotel, the story would have been all over the front pages. Television news shows would have been full of dramatic film: flames leaping out of windows, firemen making daring rescues, survivors telling their tales of escape. The numbers of dead and injured would have been spread through headlines and radio broadcasts until they had become common knowledge.

title: U.S. Drops 115 Imported Items From Their DutyFree Status
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 25 (UPI)P???? dent Curter today signed art exe??? ordur removing 115 imported items form a dutyfree status accorded to cer??? products from developing nations the United States is trying to help.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 1, 1977

title: Dave Anderson
description: HOLTVILLE. Calif., Feb. 28At the Texaco station this Imperial Valley farm town with a 3.686 population, Henry was pumping gas when a traveler asked, Any millionaires live here?

title: Amin Praises U.S. Pilots
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 28President Amin met today with a small group of Americans working for Uganda Airlines as pilots and ground crews and told them that the people of Uganda were their brothers and sisters.

title: Hard Ground That Plows the Farm Workers
description: The brutally cold weather has caused suffering for many Americans. But no group has been hit harder than migrant farm workers and their children, particularly in the southeastern United States. Officials estimate that more than 100,000 migrants in Florida alone have been laid off because of the cold.

title: White House Shuns Continued Hearings On Warnke Choice
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)A debate before the Senate Armed Services. Committee on the appointment of Paul C. Warnke as the disarmament negotiator failed to materialize today when the: Administration declined to send supporting witnesses.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Feb. 28 Consultants from the Fels Center of Government at the Wharton School in Philadelphia will conduct a 10month study of New Jersey's Department of Transportation with an aim toward improving the productivity and efficiency of the agency.

title: Public, Catholic Leagues Agree to First Title Game
description: An alliance has been formed between the Public Schools Athletic League and the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association that will result in a basketball game between the champions of the two leagues.

title: Manufacturers' Inventories and New Orders
description: Manufacturers' Inventories and New Orders

title: School. Custodial Workers Return; They Ask for Civil Service Status
description: School cleaners and handymen returned to work yesterday after a fiveday strike that had produced refuse pileups, the shutdown of 24 schools, and shortened days with reduced heat and no food in New York City's 994 public schools.

title: Top West German Atomic Physicist Linked by Government to Terrorist
description: BONN, Feb. 28One of West Germany's most prominent nuclear physicists had frequent contacts with an internationally sought terrorist over a period of at least six months in 197576, the Government in Bonn has charged.

title: Trial Starts Today for Two Nurses in Michigan Hospital Deaths
description: DETROIT, Feb. 28Two nurses, both citizens of the Philippines, go on trial in Federal court here tomorrow, accused of being the killers who terrified a Veterans Administration hospital at nearby Ann Arbor in the summer of 1975.

title: Whose TradeOffs?
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 The temptation is strong to look for another Jimmy Carter among the state governors who have been meeting here in their annual midwinter conference. But the truth is that even Jimmy Cartersome of his former colleagues would say particularly Jimmy Carter didn't look much like a future President when he used to attend these meetings as the Governor of Georgia.

title: Key Albany Figures Doubt Income Tax Will Be Cut in 77
description: ALBANY. Feb. 28Governor Carey's proposed $100 million cut in the state's personal income tax will almost certainly not survive the legislative bargaining over the 197778 budget, key members of both parties said today.

title: House Panel to Expedite Fishing Limit Exception
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28 (AP)A House subcommittee, rejecting arguments that loopholes could allow violations by Japan, agreed today to expedite agreements permitting that country and three others to fish within the United States new 200mile offshore limit.

title: Nassau Tables Plan For a Shopping Mall On Mitchel Field Site
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Feb. 28The Nassau County Board of Supervisors declined today to approve the selling of leases for a proposed $20 millions hopping center for Mitchel Field. probably killing the proposal for this year.

title: LILLY LEAVES $3 MILLION TO CHILDREN'S FEDERATION
description: Eli Lilly, the late pharmaceutical manufacturer, left 85,223 shares of Eli Lilly & Company common stock, valued at more than $3 million, to the Save the Children Federation, according to David L. Guyer, the federation's executive director.

title: John Dickson Carr Is Dead at 70; A Master of the Mystery Novel
description: John Dickson Carr, author of 120 mystery novels and hundreds of short stories, died of cancer Sunday in Greenville, S.C., where he made his home. He was 70 years old.

title: Road Funds Prove Boon for Mass Transit
description: The Cobbs Creek Expressway in Philadelphia is unlikely ever to carry a car, truck or bus. Nor are vehicles likely to travel segments of Interstate695 and 195 in Boston, 1291 and 186 in Hartford, 195 and I70S in the District of Columbia or I80N in Portland, Ore.

title: JOHN HERR, 71, EXECUTIVE IN REAL ESTATE FINANCE
description: John Herr, a real estate finance executive and former investment banker, died Sunday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in Huntington. L.I. and as board chairman of the Pressprich Corporation, a real estate finance affiliate.

title: Sheepshank and Cornflakes
description: Friends, I know there are graver events begging for attention in 116 world capitals and the White House press office, but what in the name of Dan Beard is going on with the Boy Scouts?

title: G.A.O. Asks New Rules and Panel To Check on Conflicts of Interest
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 28The General Accounting Office, citing hundreds of leases where Federal officials had financial interests in companies they were regulating, today recommended strengthened conflictofinterest rules and a new Government agency to enforce them.

title: Bridge
description: The spirited efforts, unfortunately unavailing, of the 72yearold Countess of Salisbury who ran briskly away from Henry VIII's executioner should point a moral to declarers at the bridge table. When the ax is about to descend, do everything you can to escape it.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 1, 1977

title: Ethiopia, Under Dictatorial Ruler, Taking Violent Path Against Foes
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Feb. 28With Lieut. Col. Mengistu Haile Mariam now its undisputed leader. Ethiopia's secretive council of military rulers has turned from a collective revolutionary body into oneman dictatorship.

title: 1924 Strauss Intermezzo
description: PHILADELPHIA. Feb. 28For all its peculiarities, Richard Strauss's Intermezzo is a delightful work. Although it had its premiere in Dresden in 1924. it had to wait 53 years before receiving its first American stage performances here, last weekend. The opera was given Friday night and last night at the Walnut Street Theater, under the auspices of the Curtis Institute of Music.

title: Taxes and Accounting: Deduction of Storm Losses
description: Taxpayers who sustained the worst of this winter's relentless snowstorms may find a measure of immediate financial relief in the tax law.

title: Four Days on Subway: A Fresh Look at Lingering Problems
description: What is happening in the subways? A spate of publicity over recent crime has raised public concern, spurring intensified patrolling by the 2,954man transit police force. Budgetdictated service cutsincluding shorter fourcar and fivecar trains in offpeak hourshave aggravated congestion. According to the Transit Authority, each day in the subways brings about a dozen open felony complaints. or crimes against riders with no policemen present. In addition, there may be 50 or more lesser incidentslewdness, petty theft, vandalism. Twothirds of the crime occurs off the trains, on the platforms and plazas.

title: $30,000 in Valuables Stolen From Glenn
description: POTOMAC, Md., Feb. 28 (AP)Cherished medals and mementoes from Senator John Glenn's career as an astronaut were among items stolen from his home here Saturday, the Montgomery County police reported today.

title: Ship Contracts Awarded
description: Contracts worth, $402.7 million for construction of eight new guided missile frigates were awarded by the United States Navy to the Bath Iron Works Inc., of Bath, Me., and the Todd Shipyards Corporation. The Bath company received a $150.7 million contract for three vessels. Todd received a $252 million contract for the other five ships. three to he built by its Los Angeles division and two by its Seattle division.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: MEADOWLANDS NAMED FOR ENGINEERING ACHIEVEMENT: The New Jersey Meadowlands, a 488acre sports complex, has been named in the annual competition for the Outstanding Engineering Achievement of 1977.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: While differing viewpoints abound in economic circles on many aspects of current business conditions and the outlook, there is one important area, at least, on which there seems to be a high degree of consensus. It involves

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 1, 1977 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Decolonization Committee10:30 A.M.

title: Use of Foreign Vessels Rejected for Transporting LPG Between U.S. Ports
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 28 (UPI)Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal today rejected proposals of 10 companies to use foreign vessels for delivering liquid propane gas between American ports.

title: Summary of Actions in Various Cases Taken by the U.S. Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2RThe Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: In Iron Mask,
description: Looking something like Pooh Bear with his head stuck in honey jar, the protagonist of 20 Years After the Man in the Iron Mask hangs around limply all evening wearing an iron contraption over his face.

title: PRICES PAID FARMERS FOR PRODUCTS UP 2% FOR MIDFEBRUARY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb 28Prices paid to farmers for their products rose 2 percent in the month ended Feb. 15, lifting the index of prices they receive hack to the point where it stood a year ago, the Agriculture Department reported today. The rise was the third consecutive month of increases.

title: RCA Reduces Energy Used in Color TV Set
description: The RCA Corporation announced a new design change that it said reduces total energy consumption of a 19inch color television model to less than that of a 100watt light bulb. David E. Daly, vice president for product planning and industrial design of the RCA Consumer Electronics division, said power consumption in its new line of XL100 19inch color TV sets averaged some 89 watts while sets introduced 10 years ago consumed 375 watts and sets introduced in 1975, less than 200 watts. Mr. Daly noted that a key component is a single integrated circuit, smaller than a thumbnail that performs virtually all of the active color processing functions.

title: Fleming and Mayer U.S. Indoor Victors
description: MEMPHIS, Feb. 28 (AP)  Peter Fleming and Sandy Mayer, both from New Jersey, scored victories today in the opening round of the $175,000 national indoor tennis championships.

title: Jersey Schoolboy Ties Hurdles Mark
description: PRINCETON. N.J.. Feb. 28Renaldo Nehemieh of Scotch PlainFanwood High School tied his national indoor high school record in the 60yard high hurdles with a 6.9 clocking and Tren ton Central captured the team title at the New Jersey allgroup track meet today at Jadwin Gymnasium.

title: An Aerosol Ban in Force Today in Oregon
description: SPRAY, Ore.. Feb. 28In the next few days, Mike Griffith, who owns a general store here, will return about $100 worth of aerosol spray products to his wholesaler.

title: Uganda Radio Says Americans Are Free to Go
description: LONDON, Tuesday, March 1A Uganda radio broadcast today, monitored here, quoted President Idi Amin as saying that American residents of Uganda were free to go anywhere they like, inside or outside the country.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Computer Innovations Press Internal Auditors
description: Innovations in computers and data processing are badly outstripping the ability of corporate internal auditors to monitor such systems, a Stanford Research Institute study has concluded.

title: ENTRIES
description: ?? in order of post Potions letter ?? OTB ??

title: Commuter Train Collision Kills 22 Near Barcelona
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Feb. 28 (Reuters)Twentytwo people were killed and 85 injured in a headon collision between two suburban commuter trains near here today, police headquarters said.

title: Shell Order to Dravo
description: The Dravo Corporation of Pittsburgh said it had received a multimilliondollar contract from the Shell Chemical Company, a subsidiary of the Shell Oil Company, to design three pollution control incinerator systems. Two of the systems are to he set up at the Shell Chemical's Deer Park, Tex., refinery, while the other will be installed at its Norco, La., refinery. Industry sources estimated the value of the contract at more than $12 million.

title: BELLE BLOOMFIELD, 80; GOLFER DEAD ON COAST
description: Belle Bloomfield Dorfman, who, playing under her maiden name, was a regular participant in the Women's Metropolitan Golf Association tournaments, died Sunday in the University of California at Los Angeles Hospital after suffering a heart attack on a visit there. She was 80 years old and lived at 333 West 56th Street.

title: OPEC Weighs Help to Poor Lands
description: VIENNA, Feb. 28The finance ministers of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries began a twoday meeting here today to discuss aid for poor nations and international monetary ques tions.

title: Toward an Academic Common Market
description: There's gratifying news in higher education. The City University, New York University and Columbia have announced that they plan to allow Ph.D. students in German enrolled In any one of the cooperating institutions take courses at any of the others. The number of students eligible is tiny, but the concept of academic cooperation Is crucial throughout the country. In New York, with its shrinking financial base for higher education, such cooperation may be the only way to keep some institutions from going under.

title: Two ExChemical Bank Officials Will Plead Guilty to Tax Charges
description: Two former Chemical Bank officials have agreed to plead guilty to incometax charges growing out of cashchanging operations for narcotics dealers at two of the bank's branches in the Bronx.

title: Money
description: Tuesday, March 1, 1977

title: BLACK FARMER FIGHTS DEBT TO WHITE JUDGE
description: ALICEVILLE, Ala., March 1 (AP)An Alabama cotton farmer who says that he gave a circuit court judge about $1 million worth of cotton to repay a $3,000 loan is appealing a ruling of a bankruptcy court.

title: Once More to a Fabled Brink
description: Three contentious months have passed since the State Court of Appeals struck down New York City's debt moratorium and still Mayor Beanie and his advisers find themselves thrashing helplessly about to come up with the means to pay off the $1 billion claim before it actually comes due. The financial

title: Hasidim in Brooklyn Assail Ruling
description: The Hasidic Jews in the Williamsburg area of Brooklyn expressed deep disappointment yesterday with the Supreme Court decision on reapportionment lines. but said they would use the courts and their voting strength wherever possible.

title: Bishops in Nicaragua Say Troops Kill Civilians in Fihting Leftists
description: MANAGUA. Nicaragua, March 1Nicaragua's Roman Catholic bishops have accused government forces of resorting to widespread torture, rape and summary executions of civilians in their battle against leftist guerrillas in this impoverkhed Central American republic.

title: New N.F.L. Player Pact Signed
description: Peace, but not quiet, came to the National Football League yesterday.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: Tom Buckley

title: $10 Million Is Asked to Maintain Quality
description: Governor Carey's commission on post:condary education has asked the state to give an additional $10 million next year to the sollior colleges of the City University of New York to avoid further budget cuts that the panel feels, could do permanent damage to the quality and integrity of these colleges.

title: Lebanon Weighs Stationing Of U. N. Force on Border
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. March 1The Government has been consulting with foreign ambassadors on the possibility of stationing United Nations forces near the border with Israel where rightwing Christians and Palestinians have continued to clash.

title: Complaint on Lawyer
description: A lawyer who compared Joanne Chesimard's murder trial to legalized lynching has been named in a complaint being investigated by a legal ethics committee. The lawyer, Lennox Hinds, executive director of the National Conference of Black Lawyers in New York, was informed of the complaint by David M. Foley, who serves on the Middlesex County Bar Association ethics committee. The complaint involved Mr. Hinds's comments at a Jan. 20 news conference at which he called Mrs. Chesimard's trial on charges of slaying a state trooper a kangeroo court and legalized lynching. Mr. Hinds also said that the trial judge, Theodore Appleby of Middlesex County Court, was insensitive to the racial issues in the case. Mrs. Chesimard is black and the slain trooper, Werner Foerster, was white.

title: EthnicReligious Data
description: According to the 1970 Census figures, there were 1,695,288 whites in Queens and 258,006 blacks. Other categories were: Chinese, 12,855; Japanese, 6,100; unclassified whites, 9,399; American Indians, 1,840. There were 153,691. people of Hispanic origin, of whom 33,141 were Puerto Rican.

title: An Assortment of Palatable Pleasures With Odd Parts
description: Queue do Boeuf Forestiere

title: U.S. Seaward Control Extended to 200 Miles Without Major Incident
description: OTIS AIR FORCE BASE, Mass., March 1The United States extended its control of fishing rights to 200 miles out to sea today.

title: The U. N. Today
description: March 2, 1977

title: Csonka, Warfield, Kiick Cases: Is Compensation Due for Them?
description: Do the Giants owe the Miami Dolphins something for Larry Csonka?

title: Books of The Times
description: EARLY IN THIS NOVEL, Jed Tewksbury says of an important episode in his life it does tot seem real. He goes on, Iris like something I might have, read in one of those novels about the South. This describes very well }tow I feel about Robert Penn Warren's new book, A Place, to Come To. It does not seem real. It is like one of those novels about the Southnot,written by a William Faulkner, or even a Thomas Wolfe, but by one of thoie novelists for whom life in the Smith resembles a form of superstition.

title: Trenton Tonics
description: TRENTON, March 1Officials of the Office of Fiscal Affairs, the financial watchdog arm of the Legislature, said today that more than $200 million could he available in the coming fiscal year for new state programs or for oneshot infusions of money into local government budgets.

title: Africans
description: The decision by the Organization of African Unity to expand its sports boycott to South Africa poses a serious threat to future sports relations between the United States and black African nations.

title: Amish Farmers in Indiana Are Facing ToughChoice Between Economic Needs and Religious Principles
description: SHIPSHEWANA, Ind., March 1Hundreds of Amish dairy farmers may he forced In make a tough choice in the next few days between their economic needs and the dictates of their religion.

title: Roosevelt
description: RESULTS

title: News Staff Becomes News in Kansas City
description: KANSAS CITY, hlo. Judging from outward appearances, nothing seems to have changed in the second floor newsroom shared by The Kansas City Star and its morning paper, The Times.

title: The Biebers
description: My brother lsidor is gone now. Phil Bieber writes, hut his adventures enlivened the gambling scene as few have done. Never again will gambling sports be as they were over half a century ago, but memories of those days have remained vivid. I savor them like a child licking stick of candy.

title: U.S. Pair Is 3d After Start of World Skating
description: TOKYO, March 1 (AP)Tai Babilonia and Randy Gardner of the United States placed third in the short program of the pairs competition today, preventing a Soviet sweep of the event at the world figureskating championships.

title: Washington Pleased As Amin Lifts Ban On Americans' Exit
description: WASHINGTON, March 1President Idi Amin of Uganda today dropped his demand that all Americans in Uganda remain in the country until they meet with him, and the Carter Administration looked back with satisfaction over its handling of the case, its first international crisis.

title: All About: Sneakers
description: SNEAKER selection a few years ago rarely troubled anyone. Girls got white sneakers, boys got black, and both usually bought the cheapest in the store. These days, the sneaker seeker is confronted with nearly 40 styles in many stores and you can spend up to $40 on one pair. It's enough to make you want to cancel your tennis lessons.

title: OPEC Official Sees an Accord On Price Split
description: VIENNA, March 1The president of the oil cartel's policysetting ministers conference said today that he thought a compromise to end the current price split within the group might be achieved before July.

title: Carter Gives Mondale A Trip Offer: Uganda
description: WASHINGTON, March 2 (AP)President Carter said jokingly tonight that he is thinking of sending Vice President Mondale to Uganda because of his experience in foreign diplomacy.

title: The Efficiency Experts
description: WASHINGTON, March 1  The pollsters have been out measuring President Carter's popularity against his squeaky margin of victory last November, and they have made the unsurprising discovery that he is much more popular now than when he was elected.

title: Barnes Drops Drama Post
description: Clive Barnes, drama and dance critic of The New York Times, will devote his daily criticism exclusively to the dance. He will also continue as Sunday dance critic of The Times.

title: Market Place
description: It is not often that the board chairman and biggest stockholder in a company is outvoted by his executive committee on a cash offer to.buy the company.

title: WILLIAM A. PATTY SR., 70, A SPECIALIST IN TAX LAW
description: William Allen Patty Sr.. a taxlaw specialist who was a retired vice president, director and general counsel of the National Liberty Corporation, an insurance company, of Valley Forge. Pa., died Saturday in New York Hospital after a long illness. He lived at Pleasant Valley Farm, Lambertville, N.J.. and was 70 years old.

title: Careers
description: At a time when beginning management jobs are hard to find, specialities within specialities are becoming popular. The University of California at Los Angeles has just announced a new threeyear joint degree program leading to a master's in business administration and a master's in public health.

title: Simon Kornblit Marries Ronni Luber in Florida
description: Ronni C. Luber and Simon M. Kornblit both of New York, were married yesterday afternoon in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. Rabbi Joel Goor of Tamarac. Fla., performed the ceremony at the winter home of the bride's parents. Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Chanko of Stamford, Conn.

title: Carter and Mondale See Bukovsky, a Soviet Dissident
description: WASHINGTON. March 1President Carter met with the outspoken Soviet dissident Vladimir N. Bukovsky at the White House today and told him that his Administration's commitment to human rights was permanent and that I don't intend to be timid in my public statements and positions.

title: Merck in Agreement to Buy Calgon
description: Merck & Company announced yesterday an agreement in principle with the Beecham Group for the sale of its Calgon Consumer Products Company subsidiary to Beecham for $82 million.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Child's World
description: Richard Flaste

title: Grass Skirts, on the Rocks
description: To those of us whose youthful visions of Tahiti and the rest of the South Pacific were formed by Jon Hall in films about a readytoerupt volcano that was always called lavalava, the very words Pina Colada were enough to conjure up scenes of palm trees, pretty women, grass skirts, and idleness.

title: Transamerica Building: What Was All the Fuss About?
description: SAN FRANCISCOWhen plans were announced in 1969 for the design of the Transamerica Building, the pyramid that stabs San Francisco's skyline with a point 853 feet in the air, there was an enormous public outcry. It is large and pretentious folly. said Allen Temko, the architectural historian. It insensitive, inappropriate and incongruous, wrote Progressive Architecture magazine. It would be ideal for Las Vegas, complained an angry letter writer to the Transamerican Corporation, which planned the pyramid as its headquarters.

title: New York Senate Acts to Stiffen Penalties for Youthful Offenders
description: ALBANY, March 1In the first legislative response to public concern over rash of attacks on elderly persons by youthful offenders, the New York State Senate today passed a series of bills that would increase sharply the'penalties for such crimes.

title: Exotic, Erotic and Antique
description: Ma Bell's official line may have a staid ring when compared with the more exotic, even erotic telephony offered by the department and specialty stores and phone boutiques around the city.

title: About That Kidney From Russia
description: The recent news that a Brooklyn construction worker got a kidney transplant by way of Moscow puzzled us. The kidney was flown here after being removed from young victim of a Moscow automobile accident. Since the United States boasts many more auto accidents than the Soviet Union, it struck us as odd that any American should have to look to the Russians for used kidney.

title: Best Buys
description: MARCH has arrived not like a lion, not like a lamb but rather like one of those mythical beastspart swine. part bovine, with a lemon clenched in its jaws.

title: U.S. Commission Urges Safeguards for Privacy In Electronic Funds Plan
description: WASHINGTON March 1 (AP)Americans will be able largely to dispense with cash and checks and turn to computer systems for paying bills without fear of invasion of their privacy if Congress enacts some safeguards, a Federal commission reported today.

title: Trial Opens for Filipino Nurses Accused of Poisoning Patients
description: DETROIT, March 1The first of a long list of prospective jurors were questioned today at the start of the trial of two Filipino nurses, accused of poisoning patients at the Veterans Hospital in nearby Ann Arbor. Selection of the 12member jury is expected to be prolonged.

title: Notes on People
description: AT A celebrity benefit concert in Los Angeles Monday night, hundreds of people witnessed an attack on Ray Charles, the blind singer, by a man who jumped onstage and began choking him with microphone cord. Ray Charles will see and the Lord will come tonight, the attacker yelled, before security guards could wrest him away from Mr. Charles.

title: Colleges Are Lagging In Enrollments
description: In an effort to reverse lagging registrationswhich would endanger the university's futurethe City University has begun a wideranging program of inducements to make enrollment morc attractive.

title: ANNA LEHMAN BEALS
description: Anna Lehman Beals, the wife of John D. Beals Jr., a lawyer, died yesterday at Carolton Hospital in Fairfield, Conn. She was 77 years old and lived at 1220 Park Avenue.

title: Personal Health
description: Jane E. Brody

title: The Difference
description: You can spend less than $10 for a pair of sneakers in a discount store, and they might be serviceable if all you're going to do is walk around the bock occasionally or wash the car.

title: T.W.A. Realigns Revolving Credit; Expects $2 Million Saving in 1977
description: Trans World Airlines said yesterday had rearranged its revolving credit agreement to relax certain financial covenants that T.W.A. is required to meet and reduce the current borrowing limit to $200 million from $246 million.

title: U.S. Agency to Audit Pension Fund Headed by Missing Nevada Unionist
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 1Five auditors from the Labor Department's Employment Retirement Income Security Administration are to begin an audit Monday of the pension fund of the International Hotel, Motel, Restaurant Workers and Bartenders Pension Fund in Las Vegas, Nev., confidential sources said today.

title: 5th Ave. Group Loses Town House, but May Win War
description: After weeks of legal maneuvering and years of neighborhood opposition, workmen yesterday began to tear down a turnofthecentury town house that is to give way to a highrise apartment building on Fifth Avenue opposite the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: At $57,500, It's Not a Poor House
description: Is Congress serious about living up to a clear, severe ethics code? The first, perhaps most important answer is scheduled to come today when the House of Representatives votes on a series of proposals, notably one limiting the amount Congressmen may earn outside their salaries.

title: Missf olly, North Capture Top Awards in Yachting
description: A freckled 20yearold woman who says youall as often as she smiles stole the show she was supposed to share.

title: CARTER, BARRING AID TO NEW YORK NOW, OFFERS FUTURE HELP
description: WASHINGTON, March 1President Carter said today that he favored extending a special Federal loan program for New York City for five to six years beyond its June 30, 1978, expiration date. But the President, in impromptu remarks to Defense Department employees at the Pentagon, said there would be no Federal help to solve the city's immediate threat of bankruptcy.

title: OIL COMPANY TO PAY BLACKS $1.75 MILLION
description: LAKE CHARLES, La., March 1 (AP)Cities Service Oil Company agreed today to pay $1.75 million to 374 black employees who had contended that they had been underpaid and been denied promotions because of their race.

title: CanadiensTop Islanders On Shutt's 50th Goa1, 54
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., March 1You have to be virtually perfect to beat the Montreal Canadiens these days. Tonight at Nassau Coliseum, the Islanders were perfectalmost. But a twominute lapse in the second period allowed the Canadiens to score three goals and go on to win, 54.

title: R. THORNTON WILSON DIES; BENEFACTOR OF MUSEUMS
description: R. Thornton Wilson, a leading benefactor of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, died early yesterday at his home at I Sutton Place South. He was 91 years old.

title: TV: Minstrel Man
description: WRITTEN by Richard and Esther Shapiro, Minstrel Man is a twohour drama about the frustrating and frequently violent fate of black entertainers in the last quarter of the 19th century in this country. Starring Glynn Turner and Stanley Clay as showbusiness brothers, Harry and Rennie, the Mobil Showcase's presentation can be seen on CBSTV tonight at 9 o'clock.

title: Bridge:
description: Experts in the 1930's and 1940's used a great deal of wordpower in dealing with a subject that is largely neglected today: valuation. Should one count honor cards as individual entities by point count, as many earl/ authorities recommended, or in combinations, as Ely Culbertson persuaded the  bridge public to do for some two decades?

title: SUBWAY YOUTH CURFEW PROPOSED BY GARELIK
description: Chief Sanford Garelik of the New York transit police suggested yesterday the possibility of a curfew for unescorted subway riders under 15 years old from. midnight to 6 A.M.

title: INTRUDER SHOT TO DEATH AS ROBBERY IS FOILED
description: An intrusion into the home of a Queens couple by two wouldbe robbers ended in a shootout last night that left one of the intruders dead and the other seriously wounded, the police reported. Also wounded were the husband and a friend of the couple's who had foiled the robbers by shooting it out with them.

title: Aussies Top New Zealand By 10 Wickets in Cricket
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, March (Reuters)Australia needed only 30 balls today to score the 28 runs needed to win the second cricket test against New Zealand by 10 wickets. Play started 40 minutes late because of drizzle but once they were at the wicket Alan Turner and Ian Davis, the Australian openers, quickly finished the match.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: CARTER SEEKS CURBS ON MILITARY PENSIONS
description: WASHINGTON, March 1President Carter said today that he expected to name a blue ribbon commission to study ways of curbing the rising and almost uncontrollable costs of military retirement pensions and other manpower costs in the defense establishment.

title: PURIM PLEAS FOCUS ON RIGHTS IN SOVIET
description: Jewish religious leaders pleaded for the rights of Jewish Soviet activists yesterday as they prepared for tomorrow's celebration of the festival of Purim, symbolizing the quest for religious freedom.

title: Jackson Arrives at Yank Camp, But Rivers Creates All the Fuss
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 1People predicted that Reggie Jackson's presence on the Yankees could create problems, and no sooner did the expensive, outspoken, uninhibited star arrive today than the Yankees had trouble.

title: Odd Parts Cooking: Fun From Head to Tail
description: CONFESSION IS NOT ONLY balm for a critic's soul, it acts a hedge against the slings and arrows of readers who would accuse you of shallow memory. Thus, I confess that whenever the odd parts of an animal are the subject at hand, there is an irresistible urge to quote an observation found in the Wise Eneyclopedia of Cookery (1971, William H. Wise & Company, $17.95). It should, in fact, be added to any list of great quotations about food.

title: JEAN BEATTIE HOWARD
description: Jean Beattie Howard, widow of John Antrim Howard, who was a partner in Atterbury Brothers, importers of wood pulp here die dyesterday in Massachusetts General Hospital, Boston, after a heart attack. She lived in Weston, Mass., and. was 84 years old.

title: Meadowlands
description: Special lisled in order of Door

title: A Campus Natural: The Veggie Room
description: MITCHEL BENSON took to eating peanut butter and lima beans on bagels. Andrea Schwartz sold her dormitory meal tickets to buy sunflower seeds, which she roasted in the microwave oven in the basement of her dormitory. The two, both seniors at the University of Wisconsin and both vegetarians typify the cunning and ingenui1y needed to maintain vegetarian diets on the Wisconsin campus at Madison, where special eaters are discouraged from living in the dorms.

title: Labor's Textile Fight: An Echo of the 1930's
description: A skeleton will be at the feast tonight when 1,500 leaders of government, labor and industry gather in Washington ballroom to celebrate the casting of 30 million votes since 1935 in elections held by the National Labor Relations Board to determine whether workers wished to be represented by unions in collective bargaining. A letter from Pres ident Carter hails this milestone in industrial democracy as major contribution to building a system of peaceful labormanagement relations that is the envy of the world.
