title: Cleaning Up The Atlantic
description: IT is time we stopped using the Atlantic Ocean as a septic tank. For more than half a century we have dumped sewage, garbage and Chemical wastes off the New YorkNew'Jersey coast in constantly increasing volume. The result has been the growth of a poisoned sea. Fish kills, beachclosings, red tides and the rapid depletibn of commercial and sport fishing have been a result of this dumping, and iris scheduled to continue for four more years. As chairman of the Bistate Committee on Ocean Pollution, I think it is ??trine for some probing questions and some effective action.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10:30 A.M. (Channel 4) Sunday: Margaret Costanza, assistant to President Carter for Public Liaison.

title: LEGAL MANUAL LISTS RIGHTS OF THE YOUNG
description: The American Civil Liberties Union has issued a handbook that provides an uptodate directory of laws and court actions dealing with young people.

title: Lincoln Center Goes to Class
description: TENNAGERS were dancing the minuetand enjoying itat Mamaroneck High School. Meanwhile their younger siblins were studying mathematics with a composer and analyzing poems under the tutelage of a dancer. Students have learned to expect this kind of happening now that the Lincoln Center Institute has come to Westchester.

title: ART
description: AN Alberto Giacometti exhibition without sculpture might be like a Giotto exhibition without frescoes or a l3ernini display without architecture. And yet the current Giacometti show at the Neuberger Museum at the New York State University College at Purchase includes only a few sculptureswhich are interesting but incidental to the selection and focuses primarily on the Swiss Italian artist's prints and drawings. The question that comes to mind is whether the towering genius of Giacometti is diminished without the kind of work that established his reputation.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: IF YOU are looking over Form 1040 with the feeling that the Internal Revenue Service wants to finance half the Federal budget from your pocket, there is bad news and good news,

title: Correction
description: The publisher of MindReach by Russell Targ and Harold Puthoff was incorrectly given last week. The publisher is Delacorte Press/Eleanor Friede. The book is illustrated.

title: LEVITT URGES CHANGE IN TAXING OF ESTATES
description: ALBANY. March 19  Comptroller Arthur Levitt, citing an estimate by the State Department of Taxation and Finance that $10 million in estate taxes que New York State has gone unpaid, urged today that the power to determine tie amount of tax to be paid by each estate be transferred from the Surrogate Court to the Tax Department.

title: Lost Illusions in a Mortgaged Eden
description: THE lease on our smarteastside if you live there, you know it is always one wordapartment will be up in six months, and my wife and I are permanently moving to our mortgaged home in Connecticut. Our smarteastside friends think we are certifiably insane, and looking back on the two years we have owned our place in Connecticut, there are certain events that make me think they have a point.

title: Alexander D. Calder And Jennifer Mitchell Set Bridal for June 11
description: Mrs. William N. Gillahan of Paducah, Ky., has announced the engagement of her stepdaughter. Jennifer Gillahan Mitchell, to Alexander Dodge Calder, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon S. Calder of Bronxville, N.Y., and Londonderry, Vt.

title: IN AMERICA
description: LOS ALAMITOS. Calif. The last time Fran Masterson saw her husband, Bat. he was a captain in the Air Force. That was more than eight years ago, and only six months after their marriage. A few years later, she received an official notice saying Bat had been promoted to major. Just recently, she got anotherthis one saying he would soon he a lieutenant colonel. The letter from the Air Force said she had every reason to feel proud.

title: BIG PROTESTS STAGED BY BRITISH STUDENTS
description: LONDON, March 19British students are demonstrating this spring over an economic grievance similar to one that led to recent violence in Italy.

title: A New Push for Open Housing
description: CIVILrights advocates are saying that the handwriting is on the wall, and that it's telling the suburbs around New York City and across the rest of the country that they'll soon be coming under renewed pressure to open up lowincome, publicly assisted integrated housing for poor people and minorities.

title: Salvadoran Vote Unrest Raises Fear of Polarization
description: SAN SALVADORThe unrest that followed a hotly disputed presidential election here has been smothered by tough action taken by an armybacked regime.

title: Murder Inquiry Dims Arizona Governor's Future
description: PHOENIX, March 16The political future of Gov. Raul H. Castro of Arizona, one of the nation's highestranking MexicanAmerican political leaders, has been clouded by repercussions of last June's murder of Don Bolles, a Phoenix reporter.

title: Injured Refinery Worker Dies
description: PORT ARTHUR, Tex.. March 18 (UPI) Lawrence Guidry. 56 years old, one of the 26 persons injured in an explosion 01 leaking gas on a refining unit at a Texaco refinery died today. All of the injured were working near the 150foothigh operating tower.

title: Presbyterians in South Name Woman Director
description: ATLANTIC, March 19 (UPI)The Southern branch of the Presbyterian Church, the onemillionmember Presbyterian Church, U.S., has named the Rev. Patricia Ann McClurg, 38 years old, as administrative director, the first woman to hold the top executive post. The position was created last year by the General Assembly to coordinate the church mission board's program.

title: Pelican Puzzle
description: APUZZLE has been presented to local ornithologists with the finding of a dead brown pelican on Cockenoe Island in Long Island Sound off Westport.

title: Miss Merriam To Be a Bride
description: Frances Abercrombie Merriam, an economics student at Fairfield University, and Charles Anthony Marsillio Jr., president of Kitchen Mill Inc. in Fairfield, Conn., kitchen designers, plan to be married in September.

title: Bridgeport Is Sinking
description: BRIDGEPORT isn't just anywhere. It is the first city one encounters traveling east from New  York whose character and atmosphere put it somewherein New England. All about this town there is evidence of its place in the forefront of the industrial flowering of the 19thcentury Northeast. A classical Main Street bank facade; streets, indeed whole neighborhoods, of dignified Victorian row housing; lovely squares and parks. They are all still here, having somehow escaped the wholesale destruction occasioned elsewhere by the urban policies of the 1960's.

title: Influence Is a ManySplintered Thing
description: WHEN Lord Acton formulated his wellknown warning about the dangers of absolute power he obviously did not have Fairfield County and its divided, diluted and decentralized power structure in mind.

title: Sumner N. Blossom; Former Editor Ran Publishing Concern
description: Sumner N. Blossom, a longtime editor and former chief executive officer of the CrowellCollier Publishing Company, now Macmillan Inc., died yesterday at Good Samaritan Hospital in West Islip, L. I. He was 84 years old and lived at 90 Woodsome Road in Babylon. L. I.

title: Carol H. Levin Is Engaged
description: Mrs. Walter C. Goldstein of New York has announced the engagement of her daughter. Carol Hollander Levin, to Wolf D. Niemeyer, son of Edith A. Niemeyer of Hasbrouck Heights, N. J., and Hubert K. Niemeyer of Cologne, West Germany. The future bride is daughter also of Richard H. Levin of Chapel Hill, N. C. She is a graduate of New York University and her fianc is a student at the New York Institute of Technology. A June wedding is planned.

title: Topics
description: It's not a new problem, alas, but bears repetition now that Channel has brought to light another dismaying example of job discrimination against cancer patients. Mrs. Jacqueline Bielberg of Queens applied for a sales job at SaksFifth Avenue last Monday and was told the next morning that she had been hired. But she lost the job after revealing in an interview that she had had a breast removed several months earlier. Once confronted with unfavorable publicity, the department store quickly confessed error and offered again to employ Mrs. Bleiberg. It said she should have been requested to provide a physician's testimony on her ability to do the work. It is proper for employers to show concern for the health of employees, but most improper to disqualify them automatically. We hope that other employers will examine their attitudes toward cancer patients, many of whom can and certainly deserve to begin or to resume their careers. The miracles of medicine are mocked if they are followed by the

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SAO PAULO. Brazil, March 19 (AP)Carlos Pace of Brazil, who had been headed for his best year in Formula One auto racing was killed in the crash of a small plane near his home here last night. He was 32 years old. Two other persons died in the crash. They were Marivaldo Fernandes, the pilot, and. Carlos Roberto de Oliveira. Fernandes, a former racing driver, had helped Pace get his start 15 years ago.

title: School for Smoking?
description: LINDA KRENICKI: 15 years old, sat alone on one slide of the New Canaan High School cafeteria, where the prevailing smell was of chicken and spaghetti. It's pointless to sit over there, she said, nodding toward the other side of the cafeteria, where a faint bluegray cloud of cigarette smoke hovered over 200 students. It's gross, Linda said, the smoke, the smoke, the butts.

title: Her brother's keeper
description: It is a pity that this story was not given to a feminist to tell, for its moral isand it cannot be but a moral talebeware of womanly women. Elisabeth

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: March 25Wheel & Dash Sports Car Club night rally: start at Strike N Spare Lanes, Route 22, Greenbrook, N.J. Registration: 6:45 P.M.. first car off 7:30. Information: Jerry or Julie, phone (201)5722461.

title: Article 13  No Title
description: With assets of $1.3 billion and over 32,000 mortgages, on Fairfield County homes, Mr. Hawley has a lot to say about the economic development of the county, Chief executive officer of the bank since 1956, he has used that power to concentrate on investing in residential mortgages, a policy that helped fuel the suburban boom of the 1960's, and on aiding minorities and developing innercity housing.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: Buying an Authentic

title: Stock Price Range
description: The stock tables appearing in The New York Times today for issues traded on the New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange show the high and low prices for the period since Jan. 1. 1977. The 197677 price ranges published prior to last week covered the period since Jan. 1. 1976.

title: Marijuana Penalty Switched
description: PIERRE, S.D., March 19 (UPI)The South Dakota legislature yesterday reversed its stance from last year and made possession of marijuana a criminal offense. The decriminalization of marijuana, which made possession of less than one ounce punishable by a S20 fine, was part of a criminal code revision passed last. year and scheduled to take effect Oct. 1. But alp legislature altered the revision to make possession a misdemeanor punish: able by a $100 fine and 30 days in jail.

title: Great Above, Cauthen Up, Wins Toboggan by a Neck
description: Management introduced a space walk for children yesterday at Aqueduct, but 16yearold Steve Cauthen didn't need any amusementpark gimmicks to get the feeling of walking on air.

title: Breaking the drug barrier
description: Unfortunately, no drug is completely safe. For example, there is a medication that, when administered in low doses, may cause indigestion and bleeding disorders, and, in higher doses, may result In marked alterations in blood chemistry, stupor, seizures and, on occasion, death. One would hardly expect a medication with such inherent toxicity to be approved for use by laboratory mice, let alone humans.

title: Associated Press
description: OPPOSITION CAMPAIGN WAGON: Indians in Raghpat, north of Delhi, campaigning by buffalo cart against Congress Party of Indira Gandhi. Page

title: Phil SpectorMaster Of the 60's Sound
description: First comes a peal of thunder, followed by the sound of a dozen guitars strumming in unison. A tambourine begins to beat time and the thunder, still rumbling, recedes into a background of raindrop sounds. Three or four pianos enter with a bass figure while an angelic chorus of female voices sighs a refrain. Unmistakably, this is the introduction to a Phil Spector record, Welkin in the Rain. It was a top 20 hit in 1964 for the vocal group the Ronettes, but nowadays most rock fans think of it as a Spector record simply because Phil Spector produced it.

title: Administration Has No Interest In Reviving SST, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON, March 19A $15 million authorization voted by the House Thursday does not signal any reawakening of Carter Administration interest in building an American supersonic airliner, sources at the Department of Transportation said yesterday.

title: $11,000 in Jewels Stolen
description: Jewelry worth $11,000 was reported yesterday missing by Lenore Resnick from her apartment at 500 East 77th Street. She said a gold bracelet worth $10,000 and a necklace valued at $1,000 had been taken from a coat pocket in a closet. The police said there was no sign of forced entry

title: INTERVIEW
description: WHEN Frank Mundus first saw the movie Jaws, his reaction was that it was so. so funny that I rolled around in the aisles screaming. It was a good thing, he says, that he was seeing the film in East Hampton, not far from home in Montauk, because strangers might not have appreciated the reason for his merriment.

title: Bringing up Children the Chinese Way
description: AFEW years ago, Joan Cheu wrote an advice column for a Chineselanguage newspaper in New York, helping Chinese people to adapt to life in the United States. Now Mrs. Cheu thinks Americans may be ready for some advice on bringing up children the Chinese way.

title: White House Photograph
description: CARTER MEETS KISSINGER AT WHITE HOUSE: At a dinner at the White House Friday night were, clockwise from left: Nancy Kissinger, President Carter, Grace Vance, Henry A. Kissinger, Mrs. Carter, Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and Zbigniew Brzezinski, the President's national security adviser. A complete range of foreign policy issues was discussed by Mr. Carter and Mr. Kissinger in their first meeting since Mr. Carter took office. Photograph was released yesterday by the White House.

title: SHOP TALK
description: COUNTLESS people who heard about the Banksville Farmer's Market in Banksville, N.Y., and tried it on the weekend won't set foot in the place again. The market is open Thursday through Sunday, and Thursday is the only time to go. The crates of fresh produce are brought in Thursday morning and the handful of shoppers that show up that day scarcely make a dent in the stacks of greens, piles of fruit and bins of tubers. By Saturday or Sunday the aisles will be choked with people and the produce well picked over7The weekend shopper elbows in only to be faced with rejects.

title: bets Visit Caribbean, Skip Cuba
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 19professional baseball may not have had much luck in landing a team on Cuba, but four teams were in various stages of landing elsewhere in the Caribbean today in a flurry of spring training diplomacy.

title: Nancy Motzkin Bride Of Richard Schulman
description: Nancy Ann. Motzkin. a teacher of English for the fifth grade at the Horace MannBarnard School in Riverdale, the Bronx. was married last evening to Richard James Schulman, a lawyer with the New York firm of Rogers, Hoge & Hills. Rabbi Jonathan Eichhorn performed the ceremony in Temple Emanuel in Kingston. N. Y.

title: Best Seller List
description: Fiction

title: Criminals At Large
description: Set in Miami. STREET 8 by Douglas Fairbairn (Delacorte, $7.95) is largely concerned with the Cuban exiles who have lived and worked there ever since Castro took power in Cuba. But it is the Cuban underworld that interests the author, and he has written a taut, tight novel about the power plays of mobsters who want to take over their territory and run it with absolute authority. The result is a gripping piece of work. But one had expected no less from the author of Shoot, which came out about four years ago.

title: WANTED: Five Homes That Need painting
description: Five local property Owners will have the opportunity to renovate and permanently eliminate exterior painting with the new 1977 Solid Vinyl Siding at special introductory discounts to stimulate local interest in the new colonial exterior paneling manufactured by a subsidiary of Bethlehem Steel Company.

title: LETTERS TO THE WESTCHESTER EDITOR
description: Naivete on Involvement At College Is Seen

title: McCullough, Watson Tied With Stroke Lead
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla., March 19As the howling winds that disrupted yesterday's play subsided, the third round of the Tournament Players golf championship settled down to a threeman competition among Mike McCullough, an anonymous journeyman who has never before led a pro tournament; Tom Watson, fivetime winner, and Mark Hayes, who has won two tournaments in three the tour.

title: BabySitting
description: WATCHING summer homes at the east end of the Island during the lean, nontourist season has long been a way for natives to pick up extra income. In Montauk, where there's been considerable homebuilding in recent years, house watching has become a steadily growing business for John Lycke, a lifelong resident. He's the only one to offer his service on a fulltime basis there, literally making house calls in time of emergency.

title: STAMPS
description: Pottery making, one of the major arts of the Indians of the Southwest who lived in pueblosthe Spanish word for townis featured on a block of four 13cent commemoratives from the United States as it looks back at another aspect of its rich cultural past. The stamps are coming out on April 13 in Santa Fe. N. M.

title: How to pick a camp
description: Summer camp brochures sprout like crocuses at this time of year. Each brochure is enticingbillowing sails. mountain trails, laughing children. Each camp is one of thousands across the country that jostle for eight million youngsters a year.

title: Welfare Cuts: Robin Hood in Reverse
description: IT IS ironic and tragic that just at the time that the Carter Administration is bringing about new hopes for the poor, New York State, with its long history of progressive service to the disadvantaged, has chosen to impose new and harsh sufferinv cm its citizens_

title: Soaring Premiums For Risk Coverage Troubling Suburbs
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 19Many suburban municipalities in the New York metropolitan area have been finding increasingly expensive to buy insurance against lawsuits and other risksjust as doctors and lawyers have been finding their medical malpractice insurance premiums soaring.

title: Purcell: I Like a Good Fight
description: HEMPSTEAD

title: Bonding Without Welding
description: WHEN a piece of wroughtiron furniture or a section of metal railing inside or outside the home breaks most people feel that the only permanent cure is to have it welded professionally. While this may still be advisable, and possibly necessary, in some cases, many repairs of this kind can be easily made at home without special tools or equipmentsimply by using a paste or puttytype epoxy adhesive.

title: FRIENDS TRYING TO HELP PARALYZED STUDENT, 21
description: High school and college friends of a 21yearold student from Bethel, Conn.,j are making concentrated fundraising etforts to help pay medical expenses for an accident that left him paralyzed from the waist down with virtually no chance of walking again.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: BERKELEY, Calif.There's a commercial, that runs on San Francisco Bay Area radio stations touting the dairy products of a company called Berkeley Farms. In it a cow moos and a voice dripping with incredulity asks, Farms in Berkeley? That's the way a lot of people react when informed that there is a business school at the University of California at Berkeley: A business school at Berkeley?

title: The World
description: In Summary

title: Letters
description: Weng's pencil pals

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: MUSIC
description: I SUPPOSE it is inevitable that the cultural life of this area should be shaped and, to a certain exent, dominated by the musical directions of New York City. Nor is this really a complaint. We would be foolish not to take advantage of what lies so enticingly close to home.

title: There Are Still Things Available to Put Taxes On
description: The Governors of all three states in the region are trying in various ways to halt and even reverse what has seemed over the years to be inexorable increases in their levels of taxation.

title: Rain Is Predicted, Not Snow
description: Despite earlier predictions of snow, the National Weather Service has forecast rain for late today and tonight with a high around 40 degrees and a low in theupper 30's. Partly sunny skies with a high in the mid 40's was predicted for tomorrow.

title: Youth and Music in Bergen
description: AT the Tenafly Middle School next Saturday evening, one of the leading youth orchestras in the East will again demonstrate its ability to provide a worthwhile musical experience for an appreciative audience.

title: Bette Davis Winner And Still Champ
description: On television tomorrow evening we'll be watching Bette Davis receive from the American Film Institutehell, can't you see her practically snatching it out of their hands?the annual Life Achievement Award that has thus far been bestowed only upon John Ford, James Cagney, William Wyler and Orson Welles. Heady company, heavyweights all, suitable predecessors for the lady who pumped lead into her lover at the very beginning of The Letter and made you believe that the power wasn't coming from the pistol but from the thrust of her shoulders, the arch of her back, the blaze of her oversize eyes. Suitable predecessors, too, for the wench who was willing to execute any number of Warner Brothers, if need be, in order to earn the right to execute Errol Flynn, whack Humphrey Bogart across the face, spit at that nice Leslie Howard. If you .have a taste for fantasy, you're probably already imagining her, at the ceremonies, clutching the trophy to her breast for a moment before turning aside to hang up her boxing gloves, tuck, away her horsewhip, and file down her fingernails to a gentle, no longer lethal curve. After all, she's won, hasn't she? She's the champ, isn't she? And that's what she wanted from the beginning, right?

title: Where Have BMovies Gone? They've Moved to the Country
description: The Bmovie, or what used to be called the supporting feature in the days of the doublebill, did not die when the major studios cut back on their production schedules in favor of Afilms, the better to compete with television. The Bmovie, like a large part of the rest of America, moved to the country, One of the more interesting phenomena in recent years has been the survival of the lowbudget program picture and its transformation, almost accidentally, into something that might be classified as the regional film.

title: Putting a brain into space
description: Science fiction regularly shows us humanity in trouble. Mutants, monsters, alien intelligences and creeping plant life all figure the possible end of a human world, but they also suggest something more quotidian, less apocalyptic: a change of life, a suspicion that humanity itself has simply been mislaid or thrown away in some recent corridor of history. And in this

title: LETTER FROM COLLEGE OF NEW ROCHELLE
description: THE name College of New Rochelle conjures up several impressions: prestige, high academic standing, small, intimate campus, all women and College of No Romance.

title: Las Vegas Rolls Over Idaho State
description: PROVO, Utah, March 19  College basketball's most spectacular offensewhen it clicksclicked in the second half today for the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. It brought Coach Jerry Tarkanlan and his Rebels the most distinguished victory of their careers, a 10790 rout of Idaho State for the Western Regional championship in the National Collegiate Athletic Association tournament

title: Albany Legislators, With an Eye to Running for Other Offices, Jockey for Best Positions
description: ALBANY, March 19The announcement this week by Warren M. Anderson, the Senate majority leader, that he Is thinking about a race for Governor highlighted a fact of legislative life these daysalmost everyone here

title: The Freedom to Say No
description: THE impending campaign of several Hebrew Christian groups on the Island to convert Jews to Jesus has prompted a strong response from the Suffolk Board of Rabbis. Speaking for the board, Rabbi Morris Shapiro said: We Just expeld enced a Holocaust, and the attempt to convert Jews is another attempt to annihilate them.

title: Atlantic City Casinos Are Not Exactly at Hand
description: From the multimilliondollar hotel investor to the smallbusiness man who has staked his life's savings, to those among the area's 23.9 percent unemployed, Atlantic City is awaiting the first gambling casinos with growing impatience. But exactly when the whir of the roulette wheel and the snap of the cards will finally be heard has yet to be decided.

title: The making of the candidate and the making of the President
description: It is doubtful whether Richard Reeves set out to write a book about Jimmy Carter. His more likely target was the Democratic Convention. But in 1976, a book about the Democratic Convention was necessarily a book about one candidate whose nomination was preordained. There was no contest: no doubt; no mystery other than the identity of the VicePresidential choice. This left the writer, a former

title: Lynn Rosenbluth Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Rosenbluth of Valley Stream, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lynn Ellen Rosenbluth, to Richard E. Saltz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Saltz of Mount Vernon, N. Y.

title: Concert: Lovely
description: The Institute for Advanced Musical Studies of Montreux is moving from its home in Switzerland to Idyllwild, Calif., and decided to publicize the event with a concert about halfway betweennamely, New York. On Friday night the institute, which gives special training and experience to musicschool graduates, presented a program called Music From Montreux in Carnegie Recital Hall. Modest in proportions, it was an absolutely lovely concert, suggesting, one hopes, the ambience of the school.

title: Three R's Are the New Alternative Mode
description: The Paler School in Philadelphia is unusual, but it is also typical of a growing number of places that have turned the idea of the alternative school on its head. Instead of offering open classrooms or other progressive techniques usually associated with the term, these schools have gone in the other directionalmost stepping back in timeand now promote traditional education on an optional basis for those who want it.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: EXPLORING the North Shore on one of the year's first delightfully warm, springlike Sundays, when it seemed as though the ice cap would indeed recede for the summer, we came on Cold Spring Harbor.

title: CARTER TO ASK AN END TO MOST VOTER CURBS IN FEDERAL ELECTIONS
description: WASHINGTON. March 19President Carter will ask Congress next week to approve an amendment to the voting laws that would virtually eliminate all registration requirements and clear more than 45 million additional Americans to participate in the 1980 Presidential and Congressional elections.

title: The Terror in Washington Has Stirred the Debate Anew
description: WASHINGTONThe recent taking of 134 hostages here by a group of Hanafi Muslims has intensified the debate among law enforcement officials and others about the proper method of dealing with such incidents. The debate centers on the question of whether and how the authorities should negotiate for the lives of the hostages.

title: Northside Throws Party for Firemen Returning to People's. Firehouse
description: After holding their firehouse and its shiny red pumper hostage for over 16 months, to protest the shutdown of their local engine company, residents of the Northside community in Brooklyn moved out their mattresses yesterday threw a Welcome back party for the long absent firemen.

title: Deborah L. Gabry Affianced
description: Deborah L. Gabry and William H. Feldman, 1975 magna cum laude graduate of Boston University, will be married in June. Announcement of their engagement has been made by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Sol Gabry. Mr. Feldman's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Jerrold Feldman. Both families live in Brooklyn. Miss Gabry is working for a master's degree at Teachers College, Columbia University. Her fianc attends the National Law Center at George Washington University.

title: The woman's movement:. moving for some time
description: In 1973, Gerda Lerner published Black Women in White America, a pioneering search for the selfdefinitions of black women, invisible in American history. Its contents (letters,

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Dave Kingman/ConnorsNastase/What Football Is Like
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Editors
description: THE AMERICAN CATHOLIC, by Andrew M. Greeley. (Basic Books. $15.) Sociological portrait of American Catholics that confutes the popular stereotypes.

title: Wendy Sue Harrison Bride Of David Hashmall, Student
description: Wendy Sue Harrison, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Harrison of North Woodmere, L.I., and David M. Hashmall, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Frank Hashmall of Roslyn. L.I., were married last evening at the Sephardic Temple in Cedarhurst, L.I., by Rabbi Arnold D. Marans.

title: Bernard Grebanier, 74, Professor Of English at Brooklyn College
description: Bernard Grebanier, professor emeritus in the English Department of Brooklyn College and a highly respected Shakespearean scholar, died Thursday in Whitehall, N. Y. He lived at 215 West 88th Street in Manhattan and  was 74 years old.

title: Catherine T. Kline Is Bride
description: Catherine Theresa Kline. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sherman Kline of Jeffersontown, Ky., was married at noon yesterday to Douglas Gordon Taggart, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leslie Davidson Taggart of Westport, Conn. The Rev. Joseph Hamilton performed the ceremoney in St. Edward's Roman Catholic Church in Jeffersontown.

title: Blumenthal Takes Charge at the U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON  W. Michael Blumenthal has stayed pretty much out of the limelight since he became Secretary of the Treasury two months ago. But within the Carter Administration he has moved strongly to establish his authority as the nation's chief economic and financial officer.

title: Mazda Tries to Get Back in the Race
description: Just four years ago business was humming at the Toyo Kogyo Company, maker of the Mazda automobile. With Its highly publicized revolutionary rotary engine, how could it miss?

title: Students Meet Police
description: ONE January morning, a Scarsdale policeman was on routine patrol when a call came in on the car radio. A pregnant woman had broken her arm in a fall. She needed help getting to a hospital. Pressing down on the accelerator, the policeman flashed on his lights and turned up his siren. Hold on for your life, he shouted to the passenger in the front seat as they sped on Mamaroneck Avenue to the woman's house.

title: Wendy Gottlieb Enzazed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Henry Gottlieb of Freeport, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Wendy Gottlieb, to Dennis Smith, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Smith of West Babylon, L.I.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicateds

title: SHOP TALK
description: ATELIER, an artist's workshop or studio, is the very appropriate name of Dorine Lerner's new dress shop in Millburn. Before she started designing clothes, Mrs. Lerner was a painter, and some of her worksabstract, airy and bursting with pastel colorshang on the walls of her greycarpeted salon. They are much like the clothes she designs.

title: Best Sellers
description: Mass Market Paperbacks

title: Jamaican Journey: Coast Drive from Negril to Ocho Rios
description: It was to be my first Christmas in Jamaica in 25 years. Born in New York, I spent my early youth as a member of the Jamaican middle class. But being very lightskinned, traveling with a white companion, I was for all intents and purposes an American tourist: I looked like one, I dressed like one and I was treated like one.

title: Frank Ryan Takes Over Troubled Yale Athletics
description: NEW HAVEN, March 19Frank Ryan, a computer mathematician and a former pro football quarterback who will become Yale's athletic director on June I, has begun his homework. The assignment looms tall before the Texas emigr as tall as East Rock on top of West Rock. Those are this city's two huge geological phenomenons, which can be seen on a clear day from a seat high in the Yale Bowl.

title: Swarming to Beekeeping
description: ASTEADILY increasing number of Connecticut residents are making a hobby out of minding their own beeswax. Right about now, an estimated 4,000 amateur beekeepers are lifting the covers off their wooden hives, checking to see if their honeybee colonies have survived one of the coldest winters in the state's history.

title: In Summary New York City's Budget Is Next Balancing Act
description: New York City, having passed one major financial hurdle, has turned without respite to the next. Within the next few weeks Mayor Beame must balance his budget for the fiscal year that begins July 1, and he is no closer to eliminating a deficit he estimates as high as $725 million than when he first outlined the budget two months ago.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: A new regional sense of purpose, in North and South alike, is required if the nation is to achieve its full economic potential.

title: His Face Is FamiliarHis Voice, His Laugh
description: ON a cold January morning at White's Pharmacy in East Hampton, you see him as you come through the door. He is standing to the right, in the front, looking through the magazinesa lean man about 40, with very light blue eyes and black hair flecked with gray. You know his face so well; you've seen it many times, but where, and what is his name? You can't think of it, and this time it doesn't matter that much, because as he glances across at you, there is no recognition in his eyes.

title: Buck Shaw Dies at 77
description: Lawrence Timothy (Buck) Shaw, who coached the Philadelphia Eagles to the National Football League championship in 1960 with a 1713 victory over Green Bay, died yesterday of cancer. He was 77 years old. Obituary on Page 40, Main Section.

title: ART
description: AN Alberto Giacometti exhibition without sculpture might be like a Giotto exhibition without frescoes or a Bernini display without architecture. And yet the current Giacometti show at the Neuberger Museum at the New York State University College at Purchase includes only a few sculptureswhich are interesting but incidental to the selection and focuses primarily on the Swiss Italian artist's prints and drawings. The question that comes to mind is whether the towering genius of Giacometti is diminished without the kind of work that established his reputation.

title: Water Stolen in California Valley
description: LIVERMORE, Calif., March 19 (UPI)The police are watching for water thieves in the droughtstricken Livermore Valley. Randy Werner of the water department said about 8.900 gallons were stolen last month from a hydrant on the Chabot Junior College campus.

title: Buck Shaw Dies at 77
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., March 19 (UPI)Lawrence Timothy (Buck) Shaw, the legendary Silver Fox of college and professional football, died today of cancer in University Branch Convalescent Hospital. He was 77 years old.

title: Gladys A. Wechsler, Editor, Is Married to Bruce Septor
description: The marriage of Gladys Alison Wechsler, a fashion editor at Seventeen magazine, to Bruce Barry Septor took place yesterday at the Carlyle Hotel. Criminal Court Judge Jack Rosenberg performed the ceremony.

title: A Fight to Save FM Classical Music
description: HARTFORD

title: Tuition Aid to L.I. School Withheld as State Cites Insufficient Class Time
description: OLD WESTBURY. L.I., March 19A state agency has informed the New York Institute of Technology here that the state is withholding further tuition aid to 1,297 students in the college's accelerated degree programs until alleged deficiencies are remedied.

title: Hotels Heed Alarm on Guests
description: WASHINGTONHotel owners read the papers just as anyone else, and one of the items that caught their eyes recently was the $1,475,000 award to Connie Francis, the singer, who had sued the Howard Johnson Company. The outcome of this claim is of interest to a lot more people than just Miss Francis and a few lawyersit is going to influence the way hotels run their business.

title: With Spring, Downtown Starts to Stir
description: This spring will see a flurry of modest construction projects in Lower Manhattan.

title: Part of Karachi Under Army Rule
description: KARACHI. Pakistan. March 19 (AP)The Government placed onethird of Karachi under military control today and ordered residents of the affected area to stay in their homes after a second day of violence protesting the recent election victory of Prime Minister Zulfikar All Bhutto and his Pakistan People's Party.

title: JOB AGENCY ASSISTS SCHOOL DROPOUTS
description: Robert Delagarde looked at a page of want ads and then looked at the quiz he was taking. How much can a dataprocessing clerk make at the jobs offered by the Nightingale Agency? Which ad offers a job to an experienced baker who can also be a manager? Which jobs will pay your hospital bills when you get sick? What address would you go to get a job as a fork lifter?

title: GARDENING
description: THOSE people who have just begun to discover how much New Jersey's songbirds add to the delights of a garden may want to attract birds the year round by planting some of the berrybearing shrubs, vines or trees that birds enjoy.

title: Isadora Wing flies again
description: There is one hilarious scene in How to Save Your Own Life, when Isadora Wing takes a fling at lesbianism. There is also a nice orgy: It had ten arms, ten legs, two penises, three vaginas and six breastsof assorted sizesnot to mention ten eyes, ten ears and five mouths (that were practically always full). Something was always in eruptionas in a region of volcanos.

title: The Birth Of a Salesman
description: WASHINGTON, March 17Jimmy Carter is turning into the greatest advertising salesman since J. Walter Thompson. He is using the powers of the Presidency and the powers of modern communications to the full, and is clearly answering the question that has been on everybody's mind: He's going to be an activist, interventionist President.

title: Is the General Motors Image Due for Another Overhaul?
description: The General Motors Corporation, accustomed to rolling merrily along, seems to have hit a series of potholes. There's some good news for the automotive giant: Last year's record sales of $47.1 billion and earnings of $2.9 billion are expected to be exceeded in 1977. But there's some notsogood news, too.

title: Laurie Jane Shapse Affianced to Alain Marc Breda
description: Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Bernard Shapse of Froheim Farm, Far Hills, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Laurie Jane Shapse, to Alain Marc Breda, son of Nicole Henderson of Morristown, N. J., and Marc Breda of Paris. The couple will be married July 30 at Froheim Farm.

title: In Lebanon, Echoes of A War That Never Ends
description: BEIRUT, LebanonIn the five months since Syrian troops, acting under the Arab League flag, enforced a truce in Lebanon's civil war, some steps have been taken toward normalcy. But the basic conflicts, which in two years of fighting cost the country 60,000 dead and enormous economic losses, remain unresolved and the prospects for surmounting them have now been made bleaker by last week's assassination of Kamal Jumblat, one of the country's better known politicians.

title: Doberman Registrations Up Sharply
description: Greater numbers of Doberman pinschers are turning up at the 1977 dog shows in line with the startling increase of 28.4 percent in individual American Kennel Club registrations for 1976. Dobermans moved from fourth

title: GARDENING
description: WITH the arrival of spring, the sun's warmth awakens in most gardeners the urge to till the soil. While excessive trampling on soggy, frostheaved lawns and planting areas should be avoided until they have become firm underfoot, many garden chores can be undertaken to give you the jump on the season.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX rose 1 percent February to 177.1 [1967=100], the Commerce Department reported. A sharp rise in food prices2 percentwas mainly responsible.  Personal income last month increased by $17.1 billion, annual rate, to $1,458 billion, compared with an Increase of $1.5 billion in January when cold weather plagued industry. Industrial production recovered in February with a 1 percent increase to 133.2 [1967=100] as the result of warmer weather. This follows a decline of 0.8 percent in January.

title: WalpackA Retreat For Art Students
description: WALPACK

title: Who Shall Live in New Canaan?
description: IF YOU put it on television, nobody would believe it. Perhaps nobody outside New Canaan would watch it, either.

title: Professor's Employment by C.I.A. Draws Cornell Students
description: ITHACA, March 14A Cornell University professor of government, on leave this year at the Central Intelligence Agency, has sparked a protest by graduate students in government here who believe faculty members should not be working for the Central Intelligence Agency in any capacity.

title: JOHN ELLIS KNOWLES, 91, WON MANY GOLF TOURNEYS
description: John Ellis Knowles, who won the United States Senior Golf Association championship six timesthe last in 1954 at the age of 67 died Friday night in Pensacola, Fla., his birthplace. He was 91 years old.

title: AN AMERICAN STUDY ASSAYS CHINA'S CHIEF
description: WASHINGTON, March 19Hua Kuofeng, according to a new study of the Chinese leader, was rarely the pacesetter but never the laggard.

title: Anne Uhlein Is Married
description: Anne Winslow Uhlein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Wyatt Uhlein of New Canaan, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Thomas Albert Lantz, son of Mr. and Mrs. James E. Lantz of Newport, N.R. The Rev. Guthrie Speers Jr. performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church. The bride is a financial analyst with the Foreign Credit Insurance Association. Mr. Lantz is in the marketing and sales division of Milliken & Company, the textile concern.

title: Dispersal of Power Is Due in Part to Reorganization, in Part to the Arrival of a Lot of New Members
description: WASHINGTONOne of the earliest misunderstandings between Congress and the White House occurred when James R. Schlesinger, the President's energy adviser, sought to consult a Senator on the energy proposals being formulated by the new Administration. Mr. Schlesinger selected Adlai E. Stevenson 3d of Illinois, chairman of an energy subcommittee and one of the Senate's acknowledged experts in the field. The selection deeply offended Senator Henry M. Jackson, chairman of the Interior Committee, as well as several other chairmen and leaders who thought that they should also have been consulted.

title: Squeaky Wheel Gets the Nod
description: ASSEMBLYMAN Gordon W. Burrows of Yonkers struck a responsive chord in the hearts and minds of his fellow Westchester Republicans in a brief talk at their annual dinner two months ago. So responsive was it that he is now the Republican candidate for County Executive, Westchester's top government post, with the formidable assignment of unseating Alfred B. DelBello in the November elections.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Theater

title: Michigan Is Upset by 49ers, 7568
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., March 19The University of North Carolina, Charlotte an unknown among basketball schools two years ago, became known giant killer today.

title: Flower Painter to Talk
description: Anne Ophelia Dowden, one of Ameri ca's foremost flower painters will speak next Sunday at 2:30 P.M, at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, She will discuss the difficulties of painting flowers from life, flower composition and the design of illustrated books in the Auditorium of garden, 1000 Washington Avenue. Admission for nonmembers of the garden is $2.

title: Gas Utilities Are Urged to Install EnergySaving Devices in Homes
description: A former assistant administrator of the Federal Energy Administration has strongly urged New York State officials not to depend on homeowners to take voluntary energy conservation measures but to adopt a program under which the state's gas utilities would install insulation, clock thermostats and other energysaving devices in private homes.

title: Disappeared in Chile
description: Earlier this month, the Chilean Government outlawed all political parties on the charge that there was plot among them to overthrow the junta headed by General Pinochet. No substantial evidence to support the charge was adduced, but in Chile these days evidence is something the Government doesn't need.

title: Prisoner on a Porch
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., March 19In the distance, the downtown office buildings rose above the green foliage of this sunny island where Orlando Cepeda once was adored. On the porch of his small white stucco home in the hills above the city, he sat with his back turned to the people who have turned their backs on him. Arrested in 1975 for smuggling 160 pounds of mariJuana valued at $60,000 he was convicted three months ago by a Federal jury, sentenced to five years in prison and fined $10,000, but he is free pending an appeal that is expected to go to court next year.

title: Yanks Breaking Loose With Old Style of Humor
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 19 The Yankee clubhouse, filled the last three weeks with wealthy players, suddenly is filled with rich laughter, too.

title: Desai Expects to Be Prime Minister if Indira Gandhi Loses the Elections
description: SURAT. India, March 19At the age of SI, Morarji R. Desai is once more the most likely to succeed as Prime Minister unless Mrs. Indira Gandhi wins the elections that are coming to a close tomorrow and succeeds herself.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: THE first few mild and sunny days of March have already started many photographers thinking about the variety of fascinating and challenging subjects that are available to them during an outdoor walking tripregardless of whether it is merely an afternoon's walk through a city park, or a more ambitious extended hiking and camping trip through one of nature's more remote forests or wooded areas.

title: Technical School Requires a Minor in the Humanities
description: WORCESTER, Mass.John D. Nyquist, a chemical engineering major at Worcester Polytechnic Institute, is fulfilling a requirement of the college by minoring in philosophy and writing a paper on the life style of hobos.

title: Legislative Hearing Slater for Friday
description: The following public hearing will be held in the New York metropolitan area by a state legislative committee this week:

title: A Summer of Sharing Joys and Sorrows of a Fire Island House
description: Last year my husband and I decided that a group summer house would be the ideal setup for us: Steve loves sports and I love singing songs in unison. After spending several weeks recruiting bunkmates from among our friends and friends of friends, we assembled what seemed like a reasonably compatible grouptwo married couples, two single males, one single female and one West Highland terrier.

title: Inside Soccer at UConn
description: TWENTYSIX colleges will participate next weekend in the nation's largest indoor soccer tournament at the University of Connecticut. There will be 70 games, from dawn to dusk, on basketball

title: Westchester/This Week
description: BALDWIN PLACE  Come Blow Your, Horn, starring Joseph Hunt, Jonathan Marten and Judy Arbaugh. Thursday at 2 P.M. and 8 P.M.. Friday and Saturday at 8 P.M. (through April 9). Mahopac Farm Playhouse, Route 6. $4.40 to $6.50, student, elderly and group discounts available. 6281169.

title: Caught in the Freeze
description: NORTH DAYTON, OhioFor Ruby Jean Sexton, the natural gas crisis in Ohio first meant turning the thermostat back a few decrees.

title: Getting Involved
description: Reports of an invasion of Zaire by rebel Zairians based in Angola have brought an immediate but so far cautious response from the Carter Administration: nearly $2 million in military supplies but no arms or ammunition. Both the swiftness and restraint of last week's action were significant.

description: Ana Pelekh Dispatches Flashy Violin Program

title: Boom in Divorces Found Tapering Off
description: WASHINGTON, March 19 (UPI)The divorce boom that began in the mid1960's is tapering off although the number of divorces continues to rise, the Government says.

title: Elaine Walker Hoffman Wed
description: Elaine Walker Hoffman, daughter of Lucile Thieriot Walker of Syosset, L. L. New York, and of Spring Island Plantation, S. C., and the late ??sha Walker Jr., was married yesterday afternoon to George Farrington Fiske Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Fiske of Sherborn. Mass.

title: Polly Diane Hoe Is Married to Leopoldo Mucci
description: At the Vassar College Chapel in Poughkeepsie, N. Y., yesterday, Polly Diane Hoe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Hoe of Hyde Park, N.Y., was married to Leopoldo Mucci, son of Tina Mucci of Modena, Italy, and the late Dr. Enrico Mucci. The Rev. Hugh Miller, pastor of the United Church of Christ in Poughkeepsie, performed the ceremony.

title: New Legal Game: Sue the Architect
description: NOT too long ago, a woman purchased a new home in New Jersey that had been designed by an architect. On the day she moved in, she went through the house to make sure that everything was working. But when she opened the kitchen stove, she found a snake inside the oven.

description: Tennis doubles is a game of maneuverof feints,,finesse and unexpected advances and retreatsall designed to win points by catching the opposition by surmise.

title: VOTING BY DISTRICTS SAN FRANCISCO ISSUE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Calif., March 18This should be a relatively quiet offyear in politics here. But it isn't.

title: Ann D. Ruffin, E. D. Axton 3d To Wed July 2
description: Dr. and Mrs. William Cain Ruffin Jr. of Gainesville, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Ann Dillard Ruffin, to Edwin Dymond Axton 3d of New York, son of Mr. Axton Jr. of Louisville, Ky., and Mrs. Thomas Edward Saxe of Sarasota, Fla.

title: Oxford Beats Cambridge By 7 Lengths
description: LONDON, March 19From the opening toss of a gold sovereign to the final verdict in the 123d rowing of The Boat Race, Oxford did as expected today.

title: Book Ends
description: Healthy Stiles. We have another road story for you. You know the scenario by now: Author writes book with zingy message that will pep up the drooping American psyche; author makes the talkshowinterview circuit, blanketing the country; author's book becomes best seller, or close to one. Today's reprise of this old favorite stars Naura Hayden, who, being an erstwhile actress, would probably welcome the billing. Miss Hayden's book is called (with an unacknowledged bow to Dr. David Reuben, the gray eminence of the selfhelp game) Everything You've Always Wanted to Know About Energy but Were Too Weak to Ask. The book was published last September, and Miss Hayden hit the road the following month, with stops in most major cities. The message she brought to the anemic folk of Detroit, Chicago, L.A., etc was simple: You Can Be More Energetic! How? Better nutrition is the nub, Miss Hayden says. First, cut out the liquor, coffee, ciggies (as she calls them; she's the kind of writer who says 'cause a lot), sugar and other junk. Second, eat betterhighprotein foods, salad, fruits. Third (the secret ingredient, the sizzle in the steak), drink daily Miss Hayden's magic milkshake, a confection of brewer's yeast, powdered lecithin, skim milk, safflower oil and other things; also take lots of vitamins (Miss Hayden pops 120 assorted capsules every day herself).

title: Easton: A Town With a Lot of Zip
description: EASTON, a tiny ruralresidential town with a population of about 6,000 spread out over an area of roughly 30 miles, has a lot of oldfashioned charm, a lot of pride in its traditions, a lot of air untouched by industry, and a lot of ZIP

title: The Egg Man: A Vanishing Breed
description: ALT John Bryce has to do as he peddles his eggs from house to house is look around to know that he is one of a disappearing breed. Twenty years ago, Mr. Bryce had more than a little competition as he planned a route through Old Bridge, Spottswood, He'matte and East Brunswick. Today, he is virtually alone.

description: Dr. Margaret Egan ,Conner, an as?? of history at. Dickinon College in Carlisle, Pa., plans to be wed in May to John H. Harrigan 3d, who is with the Albany Protective Service.

description: Mrs. Jack Brodsky of New Rochelle, N.Y.. has made known the engagement of her daughter, Shelley Brodsky, to Dr. Brian Acker, son of Dr. and Mrs. Herbert Acker of Queens Village.

title: Modest Monuments to Our Past
description: TO KNOW of Westchester's past is to know of it in terms of people and places; or social history. That is the traditional way. But there are other signposts to the past, and one of the more fascinatingan architectural historyis nearing completion.

description: The State Department of Health is seriously considering placing ceilings on the public reimbursement of the salaries and fringe benefits given to administrators of hospitals in the state.

description: In Summary

title: Fukuda Arrives in Seattle
description: SEATTLE, March 19 (AP)Prime Minister Takeo Tukuda of Japan arrived in Seattle today for a 21hour stay before traveling to Washington for a meeting with President Carter. He was greeted at the airport by about 100 persons, including Gov. Dixy Lee Ray, and then went to a reception in downtown Seattle given by the Japanese consul general.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: NOT very long ago, when gloom about the economy was thickest as the worst Winter weather was spreading its impact over jobs and production, some hardy optimists were saying that the situation was not as bleak as it seemed and that spring, indeed, was coming. They seem to have been correct.

title: Fashion
description: Sundresses on the town

title: TV VIEW
description: The weeklyseries schedule is in chaos. New series that don't show promise in the ratings are being dumped as fast as replacements can be assembled at the studio factories. Between the first of the year and midApril, more than 20 new series will have had national network exposure. Some, such as NBC's Tales of the Unexpected, have already been canceled. Most probably won't get beyond their initial run. A few are getting only abbreviated tryouts. Meanwhile, the viewer is confronted with an unprecedented and bewildering array of generally uninspired new entries.

title: Group Homes for Children Meeting Increased Resistance, Study Finds
description: A leading civic group has warned that mounting local resistance across New York State is confronting the program of communitybased group homes for children in foster carea program being expanded in efforts to get away from large institutions.

title: Bejart: One Must Violate Masterpieces
description: Maurice Bejart, his vaguely Mephistophelian moustache and beard trimmed in imitation of the mature Moliere, relaxed recently in an upstairs dressing room in the Theatre de Champs Elysees, in  Paris, and talked about himself, dance, theater and life. It was the final day of a highly successful Paris run of his latest everythinggoes spectacle, Le Moliere Imaginaire. A danced, acted, mimed and sung historicoliterary melange based on the life of France's great playwrightactor, with a special score by the Italian composer Nino Rota, it delighted, irritated or enraged, according

title: Rubbings Translate Into Art
description: THE ancient art of brass rubbings, familiar to the historically minded and readers of English mystery stories, has been exported to New Jersey by an energetic mother of five children.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Associated Press United Press International MAN DIES AFTER HOLDING HOSTAGES: Smoke pouring from window of apartment in Orlando, Fla., yesterday where a man identified as Algie Simmons died after shooting and injuring two persons and then holding five hostages for 10 hours. The fire started after tear gas was fired into the building, but police said he had probably shot himself. Above: Margolia Anderson with two youngsters who were among the hostages, none of whom was seriously hurt. A lovers quarrel was suspected as a possible cause of the incident.

title: President Carter On the Airwaves Echoes of F.D.R.
description: I n one of his first public addresses, the President went on a national radio hookup and talked with the American people about the concerns most on their minds. By all accounts, he did a masterly job, winning both the critics praise and an audience of perhaps 60 million Americans. But, then, those who had been following his political career were not surprised. As Governor, he had used radio to reach the people in his battles with the State Legislature and, sometimes, to get around a hostile press. Indeed, he used the medium so naturally and effectively to communicate with the citizenry that some commentators started calling him the radio

title: Big Western Ski Areas Now Adopt Snowmaking
description: INCLINE VILLAGE, Nev.Snowmaking machines, introduced on postagestampsized area in New York's southern Catskills 25 years ago, have finally come of age as a national skiresort institution It's even being accepted by owners of giant, high elevation centers in the West.

title: A Beach for the Handicapped
description: SOMETIME this summer, handicapped people may be able to roll their wheelchairs across the sand of Jones Beach State Park to the edge of the ocean and perhaps bathe in the surf for the first time.

title: Nancy Crosby Is Fiancee of Hugh Hutchison, Lawyer
description: Helen Rees Crosby of Riverdale, the Bronx, and Laurence Eugene Crosby of Norwalk, Conn.. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Porter Crosby, to Hugh Joseph Hutchison, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clifford N. Hutchison of Stratford, Conn. A July 30 wedding is planned.

title: Anglers Turn Census Takers
description: WHEN the fishing season for bass opens in June, more than 1,000 volunteer anglers in all parts of New York State will record data about every fish they catcheven those they throw backin 16 selected ponds, lakes and reservoirs, including several in and near Westchester County, as part of a fouryear study of the black bass.

title: Arizona State Captures Women's Swim Crown
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., March 19 (AP)North Carolina's Bonny Brown set an American record in the 100yard individual medley, but Arizona State, with atriple individual winner, Melissa Belote, gained the team title tonight in the national women's swimming and diving championships.

title: Hilary Higgins Bride in Boston Of T. J. Parker

Higgins 2d of Sewickley, Pa to Thomas Jefferson Parker, son of. Capt. Jefferson D. Parker, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Parker of McLean, Va., and Chatham, Mass.

title: DINING OUT
description: LA VIGNA Is a small, fairly new restaurant on a quiet stretch of Glen Cove Road just north of Route 25A that seems to have caught the public's fancy. As we left at 10:30 on a Saturday evening, people were still arriving and virtually every table was filled.

title: What Litigation Costs the Schools
description: THE young man being interviewed leaned back and gazed thoughtfully through the window. He couldn't have been more than 35 years old, and it was difficult to believe that he was Superintendent of one of Westchester County's largest school districts, responsible for the education of thousands of students.

title: MUSIC
description: ISUPPOSE it is inevitable that the cultural life of this area should be shaped and, to a certain exent, dominated by the musical airections of New York City. Nor is this really a complaint. We would be foolish not to take advantage of what lies so enticingly close to home.

title: Faye Patch Married to David Johnson
description: The marriage of Faye Belden Patch to David L. Johnson took place yesterday in Palm reach. Fla., at the bome of Mr. and Mrs. Robert A. Schmid, stepfather and mother of the bride. Manley Caldwell Jr., a lawyer and notary public, performed the ceremony in the presence of the immediate families and a few close friends..

title: Late Goals Thwart Hawks in 22 Game
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., March 19When the alarm clock rang for the Islanders tonight, they were down, two goals to none, to the Chicago Black Hawks with less than five minutes to play.

title: COURT ASKS FOR HEARINGS ON BAN OF PLASTIC BOTTLE
description: WASHINGTON, March 19 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia ordered the Food and Drug Administration yesterday to hold public hearings before May 18 on its proposed ban of plastic beverage bottles containing acrylonitrile.

title: The Soaps Face Real Life
description: ELEEN FULTON and Victoria Wyndham were punched at Bloomingale's. Larry Bryggman was attacked by a woman in front of a supermarket in Mamaroneck. Don Hastings was complimented on his bedside manner on a Waccabuc golf course. And Helen Wagner was hugged and kissed by a shopper in the Mount Kisco A & P.

title: Pilot Blamed in Fatal Crash
description: WASHINGTON, March 19 (AP)Faulty judgment by the pilot was the probable cause of an Alaska Airlines jetliner crash at Ketchikan last April] 5, the National Transportation Safety Board says. One passenger died and 31 persons were injured when the Boeing 727 overran the runway, plunged into a ravine and caught Wire. The safety board report said that the performance of Richard I. Burke, 55 years old, an Alaska Airlines pilot for 16 years, was below that expected of an experienced, qualified airline captain.

title: SLAYING BRINGS GRIEF TO STUYVESANT TOWN
description: . The slaying late Friday afternoon of an elderly retired lawyer in the vestibule of his Stuyvesant Town apartment building was much on the minds of residents of the mammouth housing complex yesterday, but most seemed grimly resigned to the violence.

description: Susan Babcock, news editor of Classical Music Weekly magazine in London, and Jaynes G. Glicker, assistant director of IMPADS a London public relations and marketing concern, will be married in June in Ithaca, N. Y.

title: Survey Finds High Court Decision Fails to Spur Convictions on Smut
description: Neither the number of prosecutions nor the likelihood of convictions on obscenity. related charges has increased since the United States Supreme Court redefined the test for obscene material nearly four years ago, according to a survey just completed by members of the New York University Law Review.

title: ROSALYNN'S AGENDA IN THE WHITE HOUSE
description: She has no mandate, no prescribed powers, and only a limited budget for staff. Yet just two months after moving into the White House, Rosalynn Carter. 49, is convinced that she can make a difference. As she puts it: I just know when Jimmy was Governor there were so many things I could do that I worried about my priorities. You know, if I was doing the most important thing. I feel the same way about this. There's no end to what can do in the White House.

title: Design
description: This house will not win any Most Functional House of the Year Award, said Dick Frank about the frame structure recently completed for him and his wife, Suzanne, near Cornwall, Conn., but his comment carried with it no element of complaint. The house, designed by Peter Eisenman, was not intended to satisfy the Franks functional needs, or anyone else's. It was designed as a dream of pure structure, in the words of the Italian architecture historian Manfredo Tafuri, and as such it pays almost no attention to traditional architectural concerns. The house is an object made up of beams,

title: A Recent Court Case Reminded Them That Nothing Is on Paper
description: For centuries an exporter of constitutional principles, Britain has remained, idiosyncratically, without a written constitution of its own. Recently, the British have begun to wonder whether the traditional advantages of living without such a document have begun to be outweighed by the modern disadvantages.

title: Article 7  No Title

title: INTERVIEW
description: THE words practical and practically crop up frequently when J. Edward Meyer discusses the contributions he plans to make to the State Board of Regents, the agency that supervises the state's educational system from kindergarten to graduate school.

title: Lily Tomlin Brings Her Gallery of Zanies to Broadway
description: I t's so easy, in comedy, to ridicule the characters you do, Lily Tomlin asserts. Too easy. And low. What do my characters have in common? I think, a humanity. A human vulnerability. A dignity, even when they're in ridiculous situations. If maintain that feeling, then there's nothing I can't try. And everything gets filed, for the archives, she adds, pointing to her temples, sounding satirically nasal, like her bestknown character Ernestine, the powermad phone operator (If your phone goes dead, try two Dixie cups with a string. We don't care, we don't have to! We're the phone company!'). In her New York hotel suite, she's explained that she's considering a film about lady wrestlers and has spent several days in a California gym, watching them train; and while she may not do the movie, a new character may come from what she observedwho tell?

title: David Robbins Fiance Of Linda R. Fieldman
description: Harriet Levine Fieldman of Baldwin Harbor, has announced the engagement of her daughter, Linda Rachel Fieldman, to David Edward Robbins, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert C. Robbins of Westbury, L.I.

description: This Week:

title: Help from the Outside
description: THEY'RE all young, all poor and all scared. The speaker, a 49yearold advertising executive from Westport, was describing the prison inmates and former inmates who take part in an experimental counseling service that isbeing run by a group of volunteers in a churchrelated program in Bridgeport.

title: The Fixer
description: EAST BERLIN. The beige Mercedes sedan slid out of the night that obscured the Eastern sector of divided Berlin and nosed through the floodlit Invalidenstrasse border checkpointpast the tank barriers, the barbed wire, the redandwhite striped customs poles, stopping at length before the guard post at the exit to the Western sector. An East German police guard checked the East German license plate IU 27 73and peered inside the car.

title: POLITICS
description: THE SPLIT in his homecounty organization will affect, in as yet unknown ways, the gubernatorial hopes of Jersey City's Mayor Paul T. Jordan. Whatever the future holds, the split has already provided an avenue into town for his rivals.

title: Deep South's Slew Hester: A Canny Tennis Maverick
description: He likes to play the good old boy. There is the smile and the outstretched hand. Cigars, long and mild. Bourbon, red sour mash. Sometimes he even plays secretary at his office, answering the phone with only one word, Hey!

title: Dyer Team Triumphs At Sebring
description: SEBRING, Fla., March 19 (AP)George Dyer and Brad Frisselle made up 25 miles tonight en route to the lead when favored Peter Gregg lost the left front wheel of his turbocharged car, then went on to victory in the 12hour Sebring sports car race.

title: The Monsignor And The Bishop
description: SOUTHERN New Jersey is the stepchild of the Garden State. At least many residents feel that it is so regarded by others. Perhaps this is because of a false feeling of inferiority, since its flatlands are so often behind the times. As late as the 1960's there were crossburnings in some of its Neanderthal areas.

title: Jane B. Newman Fiancee Of Andrew Steven Kessler
description: Jane Beth Newman and Andrew Steven Kessler, graduates of the American University in Washington, plan to be married in May.

title: Hearing Set on Welfare Changes
description: WASHINGTON, March 19 (AP)Residents of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands who wish to suggest changes in the Federal welfare system were invited yesterday to send written proposals to the district office of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare in San Juan before Wednesday. On that day, a hearing on the proposals will be conducted by a department district director at the Federal Buildine in San Juan.

title: Rodgers Takes Road Race
description: HOLYOKE, Mass., March 19 (AP)Bill Rodgers of the Greater Boston Track Club beat nearly 500 other runners today and captured the St. Patrick's Day Road Race for the second straight year. Rodgers covered the 8.4 miles in 40 minutes 22 seconds. Randy Thomas, a recent University of Massachusetts graduate, was second. Third was Frank Shorter.

title: Fiedler Goes Full Tilt At 82 And Still Enjoys It
description: The fact that Arthur Fiedler is leading the Boston Pops in a Carnegie Hall concert on Tuesday might seem not very noteworthy. Indeed, what else is new? Fiedler does that all the time.

title: How Americans Run Afoul Of Foreign Laws &
description: American tourists who give away blue jeans in Moscow . .. or distribute religious tracts in the Middle East . . . or try to take antique rings out of Turkey without export licenses . . . or bathe nude in Bali. What they have in common: The unfriendly attention of local police.

title: Getting away with murder
description: Quiet is a menacing word. It suggests stealth, and stealth presumes fear.

title: On the Track of Railroad Upgrading
description: RIDERS ON AMTRAK and commuter trains who bump and lurch their way through Greenwich, Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven were pleased, yet skeptical, about new promises made in Washington a few days ago that the longdelayed upgrading of the rail line would start soon after April 1.

title: Happiness In South Orange
description: THE spacious living room of the house in South Orange filled up quickly one recent evening, with the first guests sitting, on couches and later ones on folding chairs and, finally, the floor and stairs. The doorbell chimed repeatedly, and laughter rose above the sound of chatter until the meeting was called to order.

title: AMERICAN TEAM IN LAOS SEEKING DATA ON MISSING
description: VIENTIANE, Laos. March 19 (AP)A foiled States Presidential commission arrived here today to continue its quest for information on Americans missing in the Indochina war. An official newspaper said that any such accounting was linked to a Laotian request for American economic aid.

title: DINING OUT
description: MORE often than not, the name restaurants in New Jersey turn out to be disappointing. They rest on laurels earned years ago and subsist on a clientele that either does not know anything about food or simply does not care.

description: Tomorrow night, as it has every Monday night for nine weeks, the tall gaunt eminence of John Kenneth Galbraith will lumber across untold numbers of British television screens for a full 55 minutes. This time the man who can make corporate Goliaths writhe will tell a love story:

title: Terrorist Takes Drug Overdose
description: LAKE BUTLER, Fla., March 19 (UFORolando Otero, a terrorist bomber, was in cirtical condition last night after a drug overdose that occurred as he was being transfered by plane from the Okaloose County jail to the Lake Butler Reception and Medical Center. He was sentenced to 40 years in prison Thursday in state court for bombings in Miami.

title: For the Saccharin Ban
description: STONY BROOK, N.Y.If society is to make progress in preventing cancer, then the Food and Drug Administration should be commended, not condemned, for banning saccharin.

title: Advice for Housemates
description: If you are interested in joining a group house, the best place to look is in the classified section of The Village Voice under Summer Shares. New York Magazine, The New York Times and many of the weekly community newspapers also carry listings. Groups with vacancies often post notices on the bulletin boards of universities and colleges in the New York City area. .

description: BRAZZAVILLE, Congo, March 19President Mallen Ngouahi has been killed by a suicide commando whose leader escaped and is now on the run, the Brazzaville radio announced today.

title: Can Raggedy Ann Compete With Disney?
description: For the first time in nearly 40 years there is a real challenge to the Walt Disney Studio's domination of familyoriented animated features. The name of the contender is Raggedy Ann and Andy and the name of the animation wizard behind it is Richard Williams, a 43yearold Oscarwinner with a busy studio of his own in London's Soho Sauare.

description: Robin Ann Katz, who is studying for a master's degree in guidance and counseling at Hunter College, plans to h^ married in June to Charles Martin Elkin, who is in his second year at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine of Yeshiva University.

description: Then I stretched out my vision and sank my eye into the wide goblet of the sea, so that every mote and tear should come to the surface.

title: Lebanese Rightists Placed on Alert
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. March 19Lebanese rightwing Christian militia forces were placed on alert today and their leaders went to see President Elias Sarkis with a formal request for the immediate punishment of Druse militants who killed at least 100 Christian villagers, in revenge for the assassination Wednesday of Kamal Jumblat, the Druse leader.

title: Playing Doubles on the Carter Team
description: WASHINGTONSince Rosalynn and Jimmy Carter have worked as a team for years, it should not be mu^h of surprise that a number of husband and wife teams are receiving appointments in this Administration. They are known in Washington as the Carter couples.

title: Grounding an Airport?
description: THIS IS A TALE of two Connecticut cities divided by an airport. The controversy is a modest one compared to some border conflicts that exist elsewhere in the world. And there is no formidable wall such as the one that separates East Germans from West Germans in Berlin. But there is an airport, and for 30 years it has been a source of bitter dispute between Bridgeport and neighboring Stratford.

title: On the Bench and in the Limelight
description: ALTHOUGH they each hold one of the most coveted posts in government, District Court judges are among the more obscure Federal officeholders. Their political connections are often cloudy and they rarely make news once they ascend to the Federal bench.

title: Michigan Family Planning Clinic Cleared to Aid Minors .Secretly
description: CINCINNATI, March 19 (AP)A county health board in Michigan has been given temporary permission to continue giving contraceptives to minors without telling their parents, pending a review by a Federal appeals court.

title: ART VIEW
description: When Eva Hesse died in 1970, at the age of 34, she was widely recognized as one of the significant younger artists of the 1960's. Her work, although deliberately 'difficult and often hermetic, had been frequently exhibited in galleries and museums during her lifetime. It was also much discussed in the art press. It was championed by people well connected in the art world, and it enjoyed the esteem of many artists on whose opinions and support Miss Hesse herself placed a high value. In this respect, if in few others, she was lucky. At the time of her death, her career could be counted an unmistakable success.

title: Invasion of Exiles
description: KINSHASA, ZaireThe name of the country is now Zaire and the name of the province where a reported invasion has taken place is Shaba, but the events there last week were a historical continuation of the chaos, fighting and dissolution of the early 1960's when the country was called the Republic of the Congo and the name of the province became a clich: the mineral rich, breakaway Province of Katanga.

title: Pact Reached With Teamster Locals
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 19 (UPI)A Federal mediator says that a tentative contract agreement reached late last night could end the I3day strike against nine major cement hauling concerns that serve the Northeast. The agreement with 14 teamsters union locals representing the 1,300 striking drivers was reached after a 14hour bargaining session.

title: Marie Scharfe Sets Marriage to a Cleric
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles L. Scharfe Jr. of Babylon, LI., and Surry, N.H., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Marie Charlotte Scharfe, to the Rev. James N. Jerge of Dunkirk, N.Y., son of Shirley M. Keller of Panama City, Fla., and the late Earl H. Jerge.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Richard Foreman's Ontological Hysteric Theater's location is almost as vague as title. Even after getting down Broadway Prince Street there is nothing to identify the building. Once inside, there is no indication as to what floor the theater is on. True, there is a woman lying on the staircase reading a book. But perhaps she simply likes reading that way.

title: OUTLOOK IS OMINOUS FOR CALLAGHAN PARTY
description: LONDON, March 19Ominous signs for the Labor Party Government multiplied today as Prime Minister James Callaghan and his Cabinet searched for a formula that would enable them to win a vote of confidence next Wednesday and cling to power.
