description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)The State Department said today that the decisions by the Palestine National Council it its Cairo meeting had given no indication of any shift on the key question of Israel's right to exist

title: A.L.N. Claims Responsibility For 2 Bombings in New York City
description: A Puerto Rican nationalist group yesterday claimed responsibility for two bombings in New York City just after midnight Sunday, calling them actions against the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the American Bank Note Company as symbols of Yanki [sic] repression and exploitation.

title: Let's Pay for Congressional Campaigns
description: Public financing of Congressional elections begins look like an idea whose time has come. The financing last year's Presidential election largely out of public rather than private funds showed that the general principle is sound and workable. Now, Speaker O'Neill and Senate Majority Leader Byrd, both of whom have opposed the concept in the past, have endorsed extending it to Congress and predict its adoption. Their support significant. They are leaders of their respective branches of Congress because, among other reasons, they are good at reading the sentiments of their colleagues.

title: Brother
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 21African diplomats used the opening of a Security Council debate on South Africa today to give a warm welcome to Andrew Young, the United States delegate, and to hail the emerging evidence of what they view as a more agreeable policy under the Carter Administration.

title: Success Is That Sustains Her
description: She is Maya Plisetskaya, Prima Ballerina Assoluta of the world. That, quite simply, is how her millions of admirers on six continents think of her.

title: Memorial Services
description: STEDELIEva. Beloved mother of Katherine Goold. Memorial service will be on March 27, 1:30 P.M., at the Ethical Culture Society, 2 W. 6410 St., N.Y.C.

title: CAREY SEES AID CUTS FOR. SCHOOLS FAILING
description: ALBANY, March 21Governor Carey Conceded publicly today that a major portion of his plan to cut aid to local schools had no chance of passage by the Legislature and he indicated that new sources of revenue might be tapped to balance the new state budget,  which must be ready for adoption next week.

title: IN CELEBRATION OF ETHNIC ROOTS: Youngsters from P.S. 123 in Brooklyn dressed in costume during celebration of Italian Culture Week
description: The New York Times/Jack Manning

title: India Reclaims Its Freedom
description: The news from India is an inspiration to all democracies. A people repressed by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi through 18 months of emergency seized a moment of freedom to turn on her Government and party, even though they were subject to the threat further suppression. An impoverished people rejected the siren song of authoritarians everywhere that bread must be bought at the price of freedom. This historic election will reverberate through many lands: even some Americans had begun to despair of the fate of democracy before the seemingly inevitable march of tyranny.

title: Dow Off 7.48 on Economic News; Oil and Glamour Issues Weakest
description: Disappointing economic news sent stock prices lower yesterday, with weakness in the oil and glamour issues particularly evident.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney reports that the United States has an opportunity to take courageous actions that could help stem the potentially dangerous tide of protectionism. Page 63.

title: Soviet Drive on Dissenters Began Before Carter's Stand,
description: MOSCOW, March 20Although the Carter Administration has come under fire here for advocacy of human rights, the evidence is that the Soviet leadership was beginning a crackdown on dissidents even before Mr. Carter moved into the White House.

title: People in Sports
description: When Ken Norton squares off against Duane Bobick in their heavyweight fight at Madison Square Garden on May 11, the 31yearold Californian wants one of the two judges to be from his home state.

title: Especially for This FallA Sense of Ease and Softness
description: Spring's new clothes have hardly had time to be sullied by the city's soot. Summer's swimsuits and sundresses are on the way to the stores if they have not already appeared on the racks. And fashion designers everywhere are deep into their fall collections.

title: An Opportunity for U.S. to Act to Stem Protectionist Tide
description: At a time when the United States and scores of other Western trading nations continue to meet regularly in Geneva seeking new agreements to reduce tariffs and expand world trade, it is ironic that this country and others

title: CAUTION URGED IN EASING REGULATION OF AIRLINES
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)The chairman of the Civil Aeronautics Board told Congress today there were risks and uncertainties in legislation to deregulate the airline industry and urged that a slower approach be taken.

title: Yields on Treasury Bills Rise
description: Yields rose on Treasury bills in the weekly auction yesterday in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of Post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Jersey City officials were ordered yesterday to remove 2,600 storage drums filled with hazardous chemical wastes and other dangerous materials from a cityowned pier on the Hudson River. The 55gallon drums contain variety of chemicals, including a number of known cancercausing agents, according to the state deputy inspector, Ronald J. Buchanan, but their exact contents are not known.

title: Proposed Saccharin Ban Backed By the F.D.A. at Hearing in House
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The legislative battle over the proposed ban on saccharin opened in Congress today with Food and Drug Administration officials stoutly defending their decision and insisting that the artificial sweetener did pose a public health problem.

title: Title Fight Advanced
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 21 (Reuters)A fight for the vacant World Boxing Association junior welterweight title will be held April 16 in Maracay, Venezuela, three days earlier than originally announced. Antonio Cervantes of Colombia will meet Carlos Gimenez of Argentina for the title stripped from Wilfredo Benitez of Puerto Rico for failing to defend before a W.B.A. deadline.

title: Future of LTV inDefense Output May Hinge on Selling U.S. 6 Jets
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The future of the LTV Corporation as a major defense contractor is on the line. It may come down to whether the company can persuade Congress to buy another six Navy attack planes, at a cost of $24.4 million.

title: Neighbors Assail Elgin's Switch to Homosexual Films
description: The Elgin Theater, long a haven for film buffs and residents of the Chelsea neighborhood was taken over yesterday by a new management that immediately switched to a policy of showing allmale homosexual films.

title: STIRTON OMAN SR.
description: NASHVILLE, March 21 (AP)wStirton Oman Sr., who was a contractor on the Alaska pipeline and the widening of the Panama Canal, died Friday night of an apparent heart attack while vacationing in the Bahamas. He was 74 years old.

title: House Assassination Panel Cuts Budget by Over Half for Year
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI) Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. said today that the House Assassination Committee had scaled down its budget estimate forthe rest of this year from the original $6.5 million to $2.5 million.

title: TROPICANA PROFITS UP 35% IN QUARTER
description: Tropicana Products Inc. the big Florida processor and distributor of citrus products, reported yesterday that profits for the quarter ended Feb. 28 were up 35 percent and for the six months, by 30 percent.

title: Vance Hopes Soviet Still Wants Progress On Weapons Accord
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that he hoped Leonid 1. Brezhnev's harsh criticism of the Carter Administration's human rights policies would not damage the chances for arms control progress when he went to Moscow late in the week.

title: ZAIRE AGAIN APPEALS FOR U. S. ASSISTANCE
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (Reuters)Zaire has asked the United States for additional aid in its battle against several thousand Katangans who have crossed into the country from Angola, the State Department said today.

title: Court Orders a School Custodian in Queens to Turn Over His Personal and Bank Records to Grand Jury
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Queens ruled yesterday that a school custodian must produce personal and bank records for a grand jury in connection with an investigation by Queens District Attorney John J. Santucci.

title: Alvin Austin, 83, Former Chairman Of U.S. Father's Day Committee
description: Alvin Austin, former chairman of the National Father's Day Committee, died Friday at his home in Palm Beach. He was 83 years old.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PLANE AND FANCY There's something brandnew at Columbia University starting todayat least new to the public. What is described as a rare, encyclopedic exhibition of indoor miniature aircraft goes on display in the rotunda of Low Memorial Library, near Broadway and 116th Street. The small planes are not the handiwork of amateurs but intricate, fragile models constructed by members of the Columbia Indoor Miniature Aircraft Society, part of the Washingtonbased, 65,000member Academy of Model Aeronautics, which is an arm of the Federation Aeronautique Internationale.

title: Excerpts From Brezhnev's Speech at Labor Congress
description: MOSCOW, March 21 (Reuters)Following, in translation by Tass, the Soviet press agency, are excerpts from an address today by Leonid I. Brezhnev, head of the Soviet Communist Party.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 22, 1977

title: India Returns To Democracy
description: NEW DELHI. March 21India has deisively proved al the polls that it is ndeed the world's must populous democracy and its citizens were jubilant today as they proudly reclaimed that disputed

title: May, Gilmore Star in Resurgence of N.B.A. Team
description: Strange things are happening in Chicago. Ed Badger, the Bulls rookie coach, who almost lost his job a few months ago, is a candidate for coach of the year. Artis Gilmore is no longer being called lackadaisical and a big

title: Defense Weaknesses and U.S. Plan for Korea Pullout Spur Japanese Debate on Military Requirements
description: ASAHIGAWA, JapanIt is a long time and distance from the sweltering jungles of Burma to the icy fields of northern Japan. But the journey between these two extremes, made by Seiichi Ochi and other Japanese soldiers, symbolizes the changes that have turned Japan's once allconquering Imperial Armed Forces into the present modest SelfDefense Forces.

title: Order Against Bias In 2 Building Unions Overturned by Court
description: A court order to increase the number of blacks and Puerto Ricans in two construction unions in New York City was overturned yesterday by a Federal appeals court that warned against overzealous enforcement of a civilrights law.

title: Ault and the Blue Jays Clout Mets, 51
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 21Like many diplomats, the New York Mets continued today to find the international scene complex and adventuresome: After two straight defeats in the Dominican Republic, they resumed spring training on the mainland this afternoon and promptly were beaten by Canada's newest baseball team, the Toronto Blue Jays.

title: Cubs Rate Plus on Murcer, But Minus on Pitching Staff
description: SCOTTSDALE. Ariz., March 21An old friend of Bobby Murcer from the New York Yankee days was predicting a successful new career for him with the Chicago Cubs, with whom he signed a fiveyear contract after having been traded by the San Francisco Giants for Bill Madlock. Murcer, he said, will get to play right field in daylight in warm summer weather and bat cleanup in a hitters park at Wrigley Field.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: India And France
description: It's dangerous for a nonnative to venture an opinion on the politics of such unique and volatile nations as India and France, but perhaps the following generalities on their recent elections may be permissible:

title: Save the Redwoods
description: When Congress established the Redwood National Park in northern California in 1968, it was conceded by conservationists that the 58,000acre parkthe best political compromise obtainable at the timewas far from ecologically ideal. During the past eight years, a major part of the park has unfortunately proved to be extremely vulnerable to severe damage caused by logging activities on private lands beyond its boundaries.

title: France II Begins Trials As America's Cup Entry
description: HYERES, France, March 21 (Reuters) France II, a challenger for this year's America's Cup yacht race, began sea trials off this Mediterranean port today.

title: TV: Fire Next Door
description: Television goes to the Bronx again, tonight at 8, in a CBS Reports documentary entitled The Fire Next Door. As Bill Moyers, the reporter/editor for this harrowing trip, says: The South Bronx has all the superlatives: highest crime, poorest people, greatest unemployment, worst blight, and the world's record for arson. The borough's population of 1.5 million is equal to that of Houston or Washington or San Diego. And in the last 10 years, more than 30,000 buildings have been set on fire and abandoned.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: AIKEN, S. C.If you want a splendid handmade knife, whether for slicing roast, skinning a deer, opening an oyster or filleting a fish, George Herron of Aiken will make it for you.

title: Advertising
description: Over the weekend The New York Post added its advertising voice to those of the other city dailies that have instituted major circulation promotions since the beginning of the year.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, March 21David J. Bardin, State Commissioner of Environment Protection, protested today to the federal Environmental Protection Agency against a proposal by Pennsylvania that he said would substantially increase sulfur dioxide air pollution by Philadelnhia.

title: Renee Richards Defeats Miss Fox in First Round
description: SAN ANTONIO, March 21 (AP)Dr. Renee Richards defeated Rayni Fox, 62. 64, today in the first round of the opening $20,000 event on the new Lionel Cup women's tennis circuit.

title: STEEL OUTPUT FOR WEEK GAINS 5% TO A 1977 HIGH
description: For the sixth consecutive week, domestic steel production posted a gain, rising, to a 1977 high of 2.49 million tons in the week ended March 19. The American Iron and Steel Institute, which released the weekly figures yesterday, said this was a gain of 5 percent over the preceding week when production was 2.37 mil, lion tons.

title: LONDON STOCKS SINK AS CALLAGHAN FACES VOTE OF CONFIDENCE
description: LONDON, March 21The London stock market plunged sharply today as the Labor Government raced a vote of confidence scheduled for Wednesday in the House of Commons.

title: Year of Jobless Pay Is Backed by House
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)The House passed today and sent to the Senate a bill allowing jobless Americans in areas of high unemployment to continue to draw up to a year of unemployment compensation benefits.

title: CHRISTIAN DEMOCRATS WIN CITY COUNCIL IN FRANKFURT
description: BONN. March 21While French voters were electing Socialists and Communists to city councils all over the country yesterday, West German voters in Frankfurt and Wiesbaden elected conservative majorities to their city councils after decades of Socialist domination.

title: BOND PRICES SHOW MODERATE ADVANCE
description: Credit markets rose moderately in price yesterday as Treasury securities dealers prepared to bid this afternoon for $2.5 billion of twoyear notes. After noting the mildly optimistic atmosphere, some predicted that the new notes would

title: Castro Denies Involvement
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, March 21 (AP)President Fidel Castro of Cuba said today that not a single Cuban was involved in the invasion of southern Zaire on March 10 by forces identified as exiled Katangan secessionists.

title: Knight's Slayer Gets Life Term
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 21 (AP)Salvatore Soli, 38 years old, was sentenced to a life term today for the 1975 slaying of John S. Knight 3d. Common Pleas Court Judge Robert Williams Jr. added a fiveto10year term for burglary and robbery convictions in the Knight case. Mr. Knight, an editor at The Philadelphia Daily News, was the grandson of John S. Knight, founder of the Knight newspaper group.

title: Breitel Is Upbraided by Ohrenstein For Remark on Court Bill's Defeat
description: ALBANY, March 21The State Senate minority leader, in unusually harsh language, charged today that the ire of the chief judge, Charles D. Breitel, at the Senate's defeat of part of a court reorganization package stemmed from a desire to block Judge Jacob D. Fuchsberg from being, elected to the chief judge's post.

title: Around the Nation
description: BALTIMORE,.March 21 (AP)A Federal'grand jury hasindicted 21 persons alleged to be the upper echelon of a multithilliondollar heroin operation that funneled drugs from Mexico to the East and Middle West.

title: Connecticut Teachers Walk Out At Four State Technical Colleges
description: NORWALK, Conn., March 21Teachers at Connecticut's four state technical colleges struck this morning and set up picket lines in Norwalk, Hartford, Norwich and Waterbury. The State Attorney General's office promptly moved in court to outlaw the walkout.

title: CHARLES S. SMITH
description: Charles S. Smith, a retired vice president of the Berwind Coal Sales Company of Philadelphia, died Sunday at St. Francis Hospital, Roslyn, L.I. He was 72 years old. He leaves his wife, the former Hazel Harte, two daughters, Gail P. Nick and Carole A. Stein; 11 grandchildren and one greatgrandchild.

title: FORD PANEL URGES MAJOR POLICY SHIFT ON NUCLEAR POWER
description: WASHINGTON, March 21A panel of 21 scientists and economists today recommended major changes in the nuclear policy of the United States, including an indefinite postponement of plutonium reprocessing and the end of the crash program to build a commercial breeder reactor.

title: Companies Issue Sales and Earnings Reports
CORRECTION
description: The site of the 32d Ball of the Year for Boys Towns of Italy was inadvertently omitted from the Future Events column on Sunday. The ball will be at the WaldorfAstoria on March 31.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 5.3311 UNTIL 5.30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 3.3900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300: NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: FRUEHAUF SHARES TRADED EXDIVIDEND BY MISTAKE
description: The 51,500 shares of the Fruehauf Corporation that traded on the New York Stock Exchange between March 8 and March 11 were sold exdividend by mistake, the exchange confirmed yesterday. Stock is normally sold exdividend a few days preceding the record date, the date by which stockholders must own their shares in order to receive the dividend. During those days, the stock price is reduced to reflect the amount of the dividend.

title: C.D.THIERIOT IS DEAD; PUBLISHER ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 21Charles deYoung Thieriot, for 22 years editor and publisher at The San Francisco Chronicle, died today of cancer at Stanford Hospital in Palo Alto. He was 62 years old.

title: BRAZZAVILLE GOVERNMENT EASES SECURITY MEASURES
description: BRAZZAVILLE, Congo, March 21 (UPI) An interim military Government eased security measures today but continued the search for the two surviving gunmen who on Friday killed President Marien Ngouabi, the French Embassy here said.

title: Presti, a Horse Broker, Pleads Guilty in Tax Case
description: Bob Presti, horse broker who has been feuding with the racing establishment, pleaded guilty yesterday to the charge of wilfully filing a false incometax return for 1971. Sentencing was set for April 11 by Judge H. Curtis Meanor of United States District Court in Newark.

title: Actions by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Martin Says Rift Resolved After a Meeting With Rivers
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, March 21Fresh from the latest round of peace talks with Mickey Rivers, Billy Martin volunteered today for diplomatic service in the Middle East.

title: Namath Gets Extension to Parley With Rams
description: With twists and turns that would make a coach envious, the maneuvering behind the scenes in the Joe NamathJetsRams deal halted yesterday for halftime breather.

title: Carter Considers Asking 5Cent Rise In Tax on Gasoline
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Carter Administration is considering asking Congress to raise the Federal gasoline tax by 5 or 6 cents a gallon to finance multibilliondollar research program to develop new sources of energy, Representative James C. Wright Jr. said today.

title: HUNTS MAKING. OFFER FOR SUNSHINE MINING
description: Nelson Bunker Hunt and his brother. W. Herbert Hunt, heirs of the lateTexas oil billionaire H. L. Hunt, announced yesterday that they planned to take over the controlling interest of the Sunshine Mining Company, the nation's largest silver mine.

title: Pickpockets Are Thriving Because of Police Cuts
description: Several young men lounging near window in Nedick's at 34th Street and Broadway one recent afternoon attracted no attention from hundreds of passersby. But Detectives Kenneth Kleinlein and Raymond Diaz from the pickpocket and confidence squad noticed them.

title: Ole Doc Carter
description: President Carter's attempts to be just one of the folks led to a curious moment in that town meeting in Clinton, Mass., the other night. At one point a woman got up to complain about the high cost of living, and everybody focused on the President to hear what he proposed to do about it.

title: 3 U .S . Concerns Want Full Price for Prudhoe Bay Oil
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The three big companies that expect to produce crude oil at Prudhoe Bay, Alaska urged the Government today to allow them to realize the full market price for their oil to give them a maximum incentive to develop additional reserves and production.

title: Short Interest on Big Board Rises
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that short interest rose 513,790 shares in the month ended March 15 to 26,775,119 shares. The short interest for the yearearlier level totaled 25,536,763 shares.

title: OHIO AIMS TO AVERT NEW GAS SHORTAGES
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, March 21The state won a small commitment today from its principal natural gas supplier that could help it avert a repetition of the economic crippling it suffered for several weeks this past winter because of the unavailability of natural gas.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Monday, March 21, 1977

title: Bridge:
description: PASADENA, Calif., March 21The first evening of Vanderbilt knockout team play at the American Contract Bridge League's Spring Nationals here last night proved upsetting for many topranked stars.

title: 'Music' of Planets Is Created at Yale To Prove Theory
description: NEW HAVENThe small group of people in Professor Willie Ruff's apartment listened intently. A tape recorder began to roll. Sound filled the rooma cacophony of tweedling, wailing. thumping and droning.

title: Dr. Karl Pickard at 66; Expert on. Group Health And a Founder of H.I.P
description: Dr. Karl Pickard, a founder in 1946 of the Health Insurance Plan of Greater New York and the Central Medical Group in Brooklyn, died Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital after a short illness. He lived at Grade Terrace and was 66 years old.

title: Bergland Asks Farm Income Rise; Milk Price May Go Up 6c a Gallon;
description: WASHINGTON March 21  The Secretary of Agriculture, Bob Bergland, said today that he was recommending a new fouryear farm bill that would provide substantial increases in income guarantees for farmers and had proposed higher milk price supports.

title: Cuban Refugees Look Homeward
description: MIAMI, March 21When Cuba decides to open its doors wider to American tors, who now can trairel there legally, it might have to cope with tens of thousands of visiting Cuban refugees.

title: A PUERTO RICAN AIDE ASKS MIGRANT AUDIT
description: BRIDGETON, March 21A representative of the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico testified today that he would like an audit of pay records of Puerto Rican farm workers in New Jersey.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: For a second time, there were no bids yesterday as New York City tried to sell a 168acre ,former children's center it no, longer needs in Westchester County for $2.75 million. The property, the former Hillcrest Center for Children in Bedford Hills, had been marked down from $:).5 million, which also was passed up when it first went on the auction block last December.

title: $100,000 in Fireworks Confiscated at Garage; Brooklyn Man Arrested
description: The police confiscated 392 cases of powerful fireworks at the garage of private home in Brooklyn yesterday afternoon and arrested a 24yearold man on charges of possessing the blackmarket devices, which are classified legally as explosives.

title: senate Panel Completes 1 ax Bill, With Rebate and Bigger Deduction
description: WASHINGTON, March 21?? finance Committee approved today the ax elements of President Carter's ecoornic stimulus program, including a $50 ax rebate for most Americans for 1976, change in the standard deduction benefiting lower and middleincome persons, nd business tax credits aimed at spur reation of jobs.

title: Mother and Girl, 3, Slain in Bronx
description: A 25yearold mother and her 3yearold daughter were slashed to death yesterday in their tworoom tenement apartment in the South Bronx, the police said. A second daughter, 5, was reported in critical condition at Jacobi Hospital.

title: Senators Back Consumer Activist, By 14 to 2, for Agriculture Post
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)The Senate Agriculture Committee voted 14 to 2 today to approve President Carter's nomination of a consumer activist, Carol Foreman, as an Assistant Secretary of Agriculture for Food and Consumer services.

title: Big A Proves Too Tough for 2 Marylanders
description: Maryland's losses turned into New York's losers yesterday when horses unable to run at strikeclosed Pimlico were unable to run with the horses at Acutaduct.

title: FRANCIS P. WHITEHAIR DIES; EXNAVY UNDER SECRETARY
description: ATLANTA, March 21 (AP)Francis P. Whitehair, a power in Florida politics and a former Under Secretary of the Navy, died yesterday at Emory University Medical Center in Atlanta. He had recently undergone lung surgery. The hospital said he died of heart failure. He was 76 years old.

title: Two Employees of Con Ed Are Arrested in Fraud Over Resetting of Meters
description: Two Consolidated Edison employees who allegedly were paid $48,000 in the last four years for turning back the meters on 10 Bronx supermarketscosting the utility about $450,000were arrested yesterday and charged with grand larceny.

title: Juliana M arkova in Piano Recital
description: Tn view of her considerable gifts, Juliana Markova's recital Sunday evening at Alice Tully Hall was surprisingly unexciting. A native of Bulgaria with much European concert experience, she is a young pianist with an apparently growing American reputation; in fact, Miss Markova appeared under the auspices of nothing less than Lincoln Center's Great Performers series.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: BREZHNEV CRITICIZES U.S. STAND ON RIGHTS; WARNS ON RELATIONS
description: MOSCOW, March 21Leonid I. Brezhnev accused the United States today of using the issue of human rights to interfere in Soviet internal affairs, and he said it was unthinkable that SovietUnited States relations could develop normally on such a basis.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: CORRECTION
description: The site of the 32d Ball of the Year for Boys Towns of Italy was Inadvertently omitted from the Future Events column on Sunday. The ball will be at the WaldorfAstoria on March 31.

title: ake Away This Murdherin
description: The long and unbecoming silence of American political figures about the money that Americans have been sending to terrorist elements of the Irish Republican Army was broken last week. Senators Kennedy and Moynihan, House Speaker O'Neill and New York's Governor Careyall notable for their Irish extractioncalled on Americans to renounce any action that promotes the current violence [in Northern Ireland] or provides support or encouragement for organizations engaged in violence. Their St. Patrick's eve statement was particularly welcome after a set of contradictory signals about Northern Ireland emanating from the White House.

title: Barons 7, Maple Leafs 2
description: TORONTO, March 21 (AP)Al MacAdam and Dennis Maruk scored two goals apiece to lead the Cleveland Barons to a 72 N.H.L. victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs tonight.

title: Flash! Thieves Steal Whole City!
description: BROCKTON, Mass.It's unwise to leave anything that isn't doublelocked, bolted down or guarded outside our little yellow house here in Brockton.

title: Song Lyrics By Marburg Show Style
description: A lyric writer's songs are his autobiography, said E. Y. Harburg at the Lyrics and Lyricists series at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. Sunday evening. And so Mr. Earburg, who whote the lyrics to Over the Rainbow, April in Paris and the Broadway musical Finian's Rainbow, plus a multitude of other songs, strolled through his life and times with songs that reflected events of the last halfcentury and his relationship to them.

title: Market Place
description: If the Victor Comptometer Corporation is merged into Walter Kidde & Company as scheduled this summer, shareholders of Victor will have choice of cash or a new Kidde convertible preferred share.

title: People and Business
description: Robert L. Stone, chairman, president and chief executive of the Hertz Corporation since 1972, is no longer in the driver's seat at the auto rental company. His resignation, accepted by the board, was announced yesterday by Hertz. which added that Mr. Stone, who is 55 years old, was contemplating a new association which will be announced shortly.

title: Yesterday's Preseason Baseball
description: AT COCOA, FLA.

title: Carter Lunches With Farmers
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)President Carter lunched on sandwiches and bean soup with five farmers today in what the White House termed an attempt to get grass roots views on rural problems.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Canadiens. Cut Bruins
description: BOSTON, March 21 (AP)Montreal's relentless offense ganged up on the Boston goalie, Gilles Gilbert, for three firstperiod goals tonight, and the Canadiens skated on to a 51 victory over the Bruins in the National Hockey League.

title: Report by Scientists Finds E.P.A. Is Lacking Guidance and Expertise
description: WASHINGTON, March 21  A piecemeal, often conflicting legislative mandate as well as a dearth of scientific expertise at policymaking levels are frustrating the Environmental Protection Agency's efforts to safeguard the environment, according to a report released today by the National Academy of Sciences.

title: Oil Tanker Explodes. in Atlantic, Killing Captain and 9 Crewmen
description: CAMP LEJEUNE, N.C., March 21 (AP) An explosion set off by a welder's torch split a Panamanian oil tanker yesterday killing the captain and nine crew members, survivors said. Twentyseven crewmen were rescued today and 12 were missing. Search operations continued at the site. 120 miles southeast of here. The 10 dead were counted among the missing since no bodies had been found.

title: BREZHNEV CRITICIZES U.S. STAND ON RIGHTS; WARNS ON RELATIONS
description: MOSCOW, March 21Leonid I. Brezhnev accused the United States today of using the issue of human rights to interfere in Soviet internal affairs, and he said it was unthinkable that SovietUnited States relations could develop normally )n such a basis.

title: Action Pleases White House
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The White House said today that India's sixth national election was a noteworthy event and welcomed Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's decision to end the state of emergency.

title: MS. GANDHI RESIGNS AS PREMIER AFTER HER PARTY LOSES MAJORITY, RIVALS GIVE A PLEDGE OF LIBERTIES
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, March 22The Congress Party, which has governed India in all its 30 years of independence, lost is majority in the lower chamber of Parliament this morning to the opposition ??lliance.

title: Students in Bergen Help Monitor Unit Pricing Law
description: PARAMUSHere's another one without the unit price, said Jodi Ennis the other day pointing to a fourpound box of Rinso on a supermarket shelf.

title: FRANKLIN WOODRUFF
description: WASHINGTON, March 21  Franklin Woodruff, a former Cape May, N.J., housing commissioner and retired industrial specialist for the United States Maritime Commission here, died yesterday in Burdette Tomlin Hospital in Cape May. He was 81 years old.

title: Mideast Oil Output 12% Above 75 Level
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, March 21 (AP)The Middle East produced an average of 21.63 million barrels of crude oil a day last year, 12.3 percent more than in 1975, the Middle East Economic Survey reported today.

title: Phone Company Is One of 3 Buyers Of a Vacant Midtown Skyscraper
description: The New York Telephone Company and two organizations providing retirement and insurance benefit plans to educational institutions have agreed to buy the 6cyscraper at 1166 Avenue of the Americas, which has been vacant since it was put up in 1974.

title: Spigner Bowls 300
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., March 21 (AP) Bill Spigner of Hamden, Conn., bowled a 30p game today in the $100,000 United States open tournament. Sprigner averaged 237 in eight games.

title: Korea Dissidents
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tuesday, March 22 (Reuters)The South Korean Supreme Court today upheld sentences of five years in prison imposed on former President Yun Po Sun and on Kim Dae Jung, the opposition presidential candidate in 1971, under a presidential emergency decree.

title: Coaches Get Free Pitch for Top Recruit
description: Coaches of six of the country's leading college basketball programs spent last Sunday in a building on Astoria Boulevard in Queens, far from the sites of the National Collegiate tournament. Their mission? To recruit the player who might put them in the tournament next yearWayne McKoy.

title: Maryland Voted No. 1
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., March 21 (AP)Maryland edged Cornell for first place yesterday in the first Division poll by members of the United States Intercollegiate Lacrosse Coaches Association. The Terps, who have won their first two starts, received 174 points to 172 for Cornell despite getting only three firstplace votes to six for the national champions. Rounding out the top five in the coaches poll were Johns Hopkins, Virginia and Rutgers.

title: India Returns To Democracy
description: NEW DELHI, March 21India has decisively proved at the polls that it is indeed the world's most populous democracy, and its citizens were jubilant today as they proudly reclaimed that disputed title. An illiterate New Delhi man who earns a dollar News day sweeping driveways Analysis spoke for  millions of his countrymen as he declared with a whoop of delight: The mother and the son! We didn't like them, and so got rid of them. God bless India!

title: Full Full
description: WASHINGTONSeventyfour year ago, the British philosopher Georg Edward Moore wrote of the difficul ties and disagreements that arise ovet the subject of ethics. The problems, he wrote, are mainly due to a very simple cause: namely, the attempt to answer questions without first discovering precisely what question it is which you desire to answer.

title: The Nev York Times/Thin Mara Zabala
description: WASHINGTON. March 21  Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda of Japan and President Carter had a mild disagreement about Washington's cherry blossoms when they Met on the White House lawn this morning. Then they repaired inside where Mr. Fukuda vigorously defended Japan's export practices.

title: A WASHINGTON WELCOME: Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda and President Carter and his wife, Rosalynn, sharing light moment during welcoming ceremonies for Japanese leader at the White House yesterday. Article is on page
description: WASHINGTON. March 21  Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda of Japan and President Carter had a mild disagreement about Washington's cherry blossoms when they Met on the White House lawn this morning. Then they repaired inside where Mr. Fukuda vigorously defended Japan's export practices.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: A Survey Indicates New York City Could Help 3 Industries Cut Costs
description: A privately sponsored study to help New York City's shrinking economy has pinpointed three industriesoffice machines, electronic components and ornamental metal workthat it says could he carried on here more cheaply than in their traditional manufacturing center.

title: Israeli Experts See No Change by P.L.O. Despite Milder Tone
description: JERUSALEM, March 21Foreign Ministry analysts in Israel said today that the weeklong meeting in Cairo of the Palestine National Council that ended yesterday had resulted in some softening in the antiIsraeli language of the Pales tinians, but they added that the meeting had done nothing to alter a basic commitment to the destruction of the state of Israel.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: By The Assoanted Press

title: TORONTO GUNMAN GIVES UP, FREES HOSTAGES AT BANK
description: TORONTO, March 21 (AP)A gunman who took over a downtown bank and said that he wanted to be flown to his pal, President Idi Amin of Uganda, surrendered his last hostages and gave himself up late tonight after holding the police at bay for almost 12 hours.

title: Carter Said to Pick A Career Diplomat As Envoy to Israel
description: WASHINGTON, March 21President Carter has selected Samuel W. Lewis, career Foreign Service officer, as American Ambassador to Israel, Administration officials said today.

title: A Decision Due on Track
description: A decision is expected tomorrow as to whether the main track will be settled enough to hold the sevenFurlong Bay Shore on Saturday. If not, the 3yearolds, many of whom are Kentucky Derby hopefuls, will race on the winterized inner circle over six furlongs (the inner track's design does not permit Sevenfurlong races).

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Smith/Greenland Gets Johnnie Walker Red
description: Because its work last year on behalf of Somerset Importers Johnnie Walker Black Label Scotch and Tanqueray Gin led to 12 percent and 10 percent sales gains, respectively, Smith/Greenland has been rewarded with the assignment of the big oneJohnnie Walker Red Label, with budget of $6 million.

title: Adams Reopens Issue Of Airbags for Autos
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (UPI)Transportation Secretary Brock Adams overruled his predecessor today and reopened the possibility that the Government might require airbags or similar safety devices on passenger cars.

title: TireGrading Plan Of U.S. Is Allowed By Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)The Supreme Court gave the goahead today to a consumerinformation program tire manufacturers say will cost $150 million a year. The Justices let stand the decisions of lower Federal courts that a tirequality grading system planned by the Department of Transportation is valid.

title: Kissinger Is Joining Committee at Chase
description: Henry A. Kissinger will join the Chase Manhattan Bank first as vice chairman of its international advisory committee and later as the panel's chairman.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: ALCOA IS INCREASING PRICES 49% TO 5.8% ON 40% OF OUTPUT
description: The Aluminum Company of America, the world's largest aluminum producer, announced yesterday price increases averaging 5.8 percent on its ingot products, effective Friday. The company said that its unalloyed primary aluminum ingot would go up by 3 cents to 51 cents a pound.

title: Boheme
description: The Metropolitan Opera Company's production of La Boheme, televised live from the stage by the Public Broadcasting Service last Tuesday, proved a boon to public  television stations around the country in their fundraising efforts. According to PBS, the appeals for membership pledges during the intermissions of the opera resulted in one of the most substantial responses from viewers in publictelevision's history.

title: Jersey Assembly Votes GunCrime Penalty
description: TRENTON, March 21.Persons convicted of using a gun or any Other dangerous weapon in the commission of a serious crime will be required to serve a mandatory minimum prison term before being eligible for parole under the terms of bill passed today by the Assembly and sent to Governor Byrne.

title: Down in a Basement Bargain Loans by Feminists
description: The quarters are in a Greenwich Village basement and, like a lot of places in the Village, they manage to look cozy and homelike. But here at 23 Cornelia Street, women are carrying on serious financial business at the New fork Feminist Credit Union.

title: Zaire Says invaders Retreat
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, March 21 (Reuters) Zaire has inflicted heavy losses on forces invading from Angola while suffering light casualties itself, the Zaire armed forces commander said today.

title: British Football
description: By The Associated Press

title: Mrs. Gandhi's Friends and Foes in U.S. Share a Reaction: Surprise
description: When the news of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's defeat and the losses \of her riling Congress Party reached him yesterday, Prof. Anand Mohan, like a great many Indians living in the United States, reacted with disbelief.

title: ABRAHAM PROSTKOFF
description: Dr. Abraham Prostkoff, an obstetrician and gynecologist associated with Maimonides Medical Center, Brooklyn, and Brooklyn Cumberland Medical Center, died last Thursday in Memorial Hospital after a long illness. He lived at 5823 18th Avenue, Brooklyn, and was 70 years old.

title: Kidnappers Free Wealthy Italian
description: BORNAGO, Italy, March 20 (UPI)Kidnappers released a northern Italian industrialist, Carlo Colombo, last night after 34 days of captivity for a ransom the police estimated at $1.2 million.

title: Mrs. Naismith, 97, Widow Of Basketball's Inventor
description: SENECA, Kan., March 21 (AP)Florence Mae Naismith, widow of Dr. James A. Naismith, inventor of basketball, died last Friday in a nursing home. She was 97 years old.

title: HENRY HARDWICK FAXON, MASSACHUSETTS SURGEON
description: Henry Hardwick Faxon, a MassachUsetts surgeon and professor, died yester7 day after a long illness in a Walthart, Mass., nursing home. Dr. Faxon, who was a resident of Brookline, Mass., was 78 years old.

title: Injured Skier Improves
description: SACRAMENTO, March 21 (AP)Sheila McKinney, a skier, was reported regaining consciousness today after being removed from intensive care for injuries suffered in a World Cup race, March 12, at Heavenly Valley. Officials at Sacramento Medical Center said Miss McKinney, 18 years old, was moved to a regular nursing ward last night. As she showed signs of regaining consciousness, attendants revised their description of her condition from serious to fair.

title: Gold Bullion and Soybeans Climb, Pulling Other Futures Prices Up
description: Prices of gold bullion and soybeans, which have become bellwether commodities recently, shot upward again yesterday and pulled a number of other industrial and agricultural raw materials with them.

title: Notes on People
description: The 1977 Teacher of the Year Myrra Leonore Lee of La Mesa,'Calif. Mrs. Lee, who teaches history, is scheduled to be honored today in a White House ceremony and to be introduced by President Carter. She was chosen for the honor from some 40,000 teachers in 47 states and the Virgin Islands in the annual awards program sponsored by the Council of Chief State School Officers, Encyclopedia Britannica and the Ladies Home Journal. Mrs. Lee said that her own schooling was not very positive and that she decided she should be teacher only after college and a job with the Veterans Administration. Now, she said yesterday, I am afraid the TV set is our greatest challenge to teachers. Any child who spends an average of six hours glued to a TV set is sure to find school boring. TV watching develops passivity. Parents must encourage active participation in the home and school and less TV watching.

title: 5 Farmers to Lunch With Carter
description: WASHINGTON, March 20 (AP)Five farmers from five states will have lunch tomorrow with President Carter in honor of American Agriculture Day. The farmers are Jose Hinjose of Edcouch, Tex., Homer Foster of Moville, Iowa, Tom Davis of Coulee City, Wash., W. Robert Hawrigan of Fairfield, Vt., and James R. Frazier of Bucksport, S.C.

title: Photo Portraits Now Included In National Gallery Collection
description: WASHINGTON, March 21Martin Van Buren finally made It to fhe National Portrait Gallery's Hall of Presidents here, but only because Congress recently permitted photographs of eminent Americans, in addition to paintings and sculptures of them, to be collected by the gallery, a part of the Smithsonian Institution.

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 22, 1977

title: Corporation Affairs
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Securities and Exchange Commission charged today that the H.K. Porter Company misstated its intentions when in September 1975 it declared that purchase of Missouri Portland Cement Company common stock was simply for investment and that it had no present intention to acquire control.

title: MARY LYON
description: Mary Lyon, retired editor of Craft Horizons magazine and a member of the American Crafts Council, died Friday in Roosevelt Hospital. She was 86 years old.

title: Order Against Bias In 2 Building Unions Overturned by Court
description: ?? If blacks and Puerto Ricans In two contruction unions in New York City was overturned yesterday by a Federal apreals court that warned against overlealous enforcement of a civilrights a w.

title: Music
description: NEW HAVENThe small group of people in Professor Willie Ruff's apartment listened intently. A tape recorder began to roll. Sound filled the rooma cacophony of tweedling, wailing, thumping and droning.

title: Threat of a 3d Bomb A Frightening Hoax
description: Explosions like the two in New York City Sunday night always prompt flurry of bomb scares, so there was nothing unusual when someone called The Daily News yesterday afternoon and said another bomb would go off at the American Bank Note Company plant in the Bronx, where one device exploded Sunday night.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, MARCH 21, 1977

title: ARIZONANS CRITICIZE BIG WATER PROJECT
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The management and support of the $1.6 billion Central Arizona Project is replete with conflicts of interest that reach as high as the office of Senator Barry Goldwater, a selfstyled citizenlobbyist charged today before President Carter's water project review panel.

title: Woman Files Suit Over Searches By U.S. Customs Using Faulty List
description: A 26yearold woman who said she had been forced to strip several times and undergo embarrassing and humiliating searches by customs agents because her name was inadvertently included in computer list of drugsmuggling suspects filed suit yesterday against the United States Government seeking $90,000 in damages.

title: Theater Crowd Finds Fords in Its Feature
description: Who's that? somebody said on West 44th Street last night when minimotorcade glided to a stop in front of the Shubert Theater and police officers began bustling the way they do when a Very Important Person is around.

title: Only 3 N.H.L. Clubs Without Shot at Cup as Season Wanes
description: The National Hockey League's regularseason schedule, a marathon of 80 games for each team, is in its final two weeks, but the racers are still hurrying in a pack toward the finish. Of the league's 18 teams, threeWash

title: Hearing on Cleveland Bills
description: A Federal judge has announced that he will set a hearing date soon for final arguments on payment of some $17 million by the City of Cleveland to the Cleveland Electric Illuminating Company for due bills. Judge Robert B. Krupansky of the :United States Court for the Northern District of Ohio, Eastern Division, heard preliminary arguments on Friday.

title: The Peril Behind Going to Cuba
description: The new in island is Cuba, at least in sports. Bowie Kuhn wants a majorleague allstar team to play baseball there next spring or possibly after the upcoming season. Don King, the boxing promoter, wants Muhammad All defend the world heavyweight title there. Pel6 and the New York Cosmos have been invited to play soccer there. And two weeks a team of South Dakota college basketball players are scheduled to compete there. All in the noble name of the United States eventually resuming diplomatic rela

title: About New York
description: There is harmonica music from the watchman's radio sounding through the empty building that was oncebusy Dclafield Hospital, and downstairs 80yearold Dr. Anna Goldfeder will not give up her five decades with the mice and mysteries of cancer research.

title: Westchester Bars Trial of Two Over Radar Detectors
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., March 21The Westchester County District Attorneys office today refused to prosecute two truck drivers arrested for having radardetection devices in their vehicles, contending that the statute used b ythe state police in such cases was inadequate.

title: World News Briefs
description: HONOLULU, March 21 (UPI) A White House commission that visited Hanoi and Vientiane returned to the United States today and telephoned President Carter that it had accomplished its mission to seek information about servicemen missing in Indochina.

title: Jersey Assembly Votes GunCrime Penalty
description: TRENTON, March 21Persons convicted of using a gun or any other dangerous weapon in the commission of a serious crime will be required to serve a mandatory minimum prison term before being eligible for parole under the terms of bill passed today by the Assembly and sent to Governor Byrne.

title: France's Rightists Trade Accusations Over Losses to Left
description: PARIS, March 21The nation's two major nonleft parties quarreled openly today over how to block the surge toward national power of the united leftist opposition.

title: VISCOUNT COBHAM
description: LONDON, March 21 (AP)Viscount Cobham, the Governor General of New Zealand from 1957 to 1962 and a cricket enthusiast who once said his idea of heaven was batting to his own bowling, died yesterday, He was 67. Born Charles John Lyttelton, he succeeded his father as the 10th viscount in 1949.

title: U.N. Council Seat for Japan Urged
description: WASHINGTON, March 21 (AP)President Carter tonight renewed a United States proposal that Japan be given a permanent seat on the United Nations Security Council.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, March 21, 1977

title: College Results
description: MEN'S HOCKEY

title: Opera: Boito's Nlefistofele
description: Mefistofele, Boito's version of the Faust story, has always had its adherents, but until 1969 it had never been thought of as popular or as a great crowdpleaser. In that year, the New York City Opera, with Tito Capobianco's imaginative production and the late Norman TreigLe's brilliant impersonation of the title role, turned it into a smash hit. The company let the production lapse four years ago.

title: Callaghan Fights to Retain Power
description: LONDON. March 21Prime Minister James Callaghan met today with leaders of two minor parties, seeking a deal thatwould prolong the life of his beleaguered Labor Government.

title: Phyllis Jackson, 69, Agent For Many Major Writers At Two Talent Companies
description: Phyllis Jackson, a literary agent for many wellknown writers, died Sunday at her home at 333 East 57th Street. She was 69 years old and was the widow of Alan R. Jackson, a novelist and former associate editor of The Saturday Evening Post.

title: In Memoriam
description: SILZMargaret. In loving memory. RAYMOND, LUCIEN, ADELE BERNSTEINEthel K. For you are the rarest soul I over knew. My thoughts seek you as the waves seek the shore, and when I think of you, I am at rest.

title: Skiing
description: AT ARE, SWEDEN

title: Stenmark Strengthens Bid for Slalom Honors
description: ARE, Sweden, March 21 (UPI)Ingemar Stenmark of Sweden won a World Cup giant slalom today with a combined tworun time of 2 minutes 46 seconds. He was more than two seconds ahead of Klaus Heidegger of Austria who was runnerup in 2:48:20.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold prices Monday. London: morning fixing 1151.40. up $1.35: afternoon fining S152.03, up S1.95. Paris: afternoon fixing $151.08. up $1.52. Frankfurt close $151.45, up $1.10. Zurich: $132.00 bid up, $2.00; $152.75 asked.

title: Dance, Solaris
description: Probably on the same principle as nothing succeeds like success, nothing is quite so pretentious as pretentiousness. At the Roundabout Theater last night, a Parisbased group called the Solaris DanceTheater gave the American premiere of a fullevening work called Cuer. It comes with some fairly formidable European credentials but very soon expends them.

title: FITZSIMMONS SCORED ON TEAMSTER FRAUD
description: Frank E. Fitzsimmons, prbsident of the International Brotherhood of. Teamsters, was accused by a Senate investigating committee yesterday of encouraging his son Donald In a nationwide scheme to defraud union welfare funds of millions of dollars in excessive commissions and fees.

title: Gold Highest in 18 Months
description: LONDON, March 21 (AP)  The price of gold closed in London today at $152.10 an ounce, its highest level in more than 18 months. The dollar showed a mixed performance in Europe.

title: Three Ruiz Works at the Kitchen
description: Three new compositions by Pierre Ruiz were performed at the Kitchen on Sunday, and although they were shortthe entire concert lasted a little more than an hourthey were a varied lot. All of them were semistatic, using repeating motifs and gradually unfolding, modular development. But the first piece was for viola and cello, the second was for eight voices, and Mr. Ruiz performed the third piece on tuned glasses as accompaniment to a dancer.

title: H. L. Blumgart, PhysicianinChief At Beth Israel Hospital in Boston
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 21  Dr. Herrman L. Blumgart, a former professor at Harvard Medical School and physicianinchief at Boston's Beth Israel Hospital from 1946 until he retired in 1962, died today at Stillman Infirmary at Harvard University. He was 81 years old and made his home in Cambridge.

title: Concert: The St. John
description: The Oratorio Society's performance of Bach's St. John Passion Sunday night in Carnegie Hall was dedicated to the memory of Benjamin Britten. This Passion made an appropriate choice, both because the work was favorite of the late composer's and because the society had engaged his longtime colleague, Peter Pears, to sing the Evangelist. The role is particularly associated with the tenor although he had never sung it before in New York.

title: Bill Reflects the Outcry Over Gang Assaults
description: ALBANY, March 21A bill mandating prison terms for crimes of violence against people over 62 years of age was passed by the State Assembly today with only five dissenting votes.

title: 6 Coal Companies And 2 Aides Fined In PriceFixing Plot
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., March 21 (AP)Six anthracite coal companies and two cornpahy officials were fined in Federal court today on charges of taking part in pricefixing conspiracy.

title: Sex Discrepancy in OldAge Funds Is Unanimously Upheld by Justices
description: WASHINGTON, March 21The Supreme Court unanimously upheld today the constitutionality of a former section of the Social Security Act under which millions of retired men are treated less favorably than women in determining their old age insurance benefits.

title: A Housewives
description: ABERGAVENNY, WalesThe postman calls only once a week and the milkman on alternate days at some cottages fringing this town in South Wales. When Conn and Marie Price moved here five years ago, they enjoyed the isolation, but shortly after the birth of their daughter Samantha in 1973, Marie Price noticed that she was forgetting how to talk.

title: Susannah Leslie Levine Wed to William Jones Jr.
description: Susannah Leslie Levine and William Purcell Jones Jr., both engineers with TRW Inc., defense and space concern in Redondo Beach, Calif., were married yesterday evening at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Stanley H. Levine of Stamford, Conn. Mr. Jones is the son of Mr. and Mrs. William P. Jones of Vienna. Va.

title: 2 MARIJUANA STUDIES DIFFER ON FINDINGS
description: Six years ago, a group of British doctors suggested that the regular smoking of marijuana could irreversibly shrink the brain.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Moon Church in Court Battle Over Youths
description: SAN FRANCISCO,March 21In a case that is expected to set prycedent, a Stt perior Court judge here is expected to rule soon on whether the follower's of the Rev. Sun Myung Moon, the South Korean evangelist, are incompetent because of brainwashing and should be put into the temporary custody of their parents.

title: Tennis
description: AT CARLSBAD, N.M.

title: Big and Little Stars Glitter Alike at the Women's Games
description: Turning Madison Square Garden into New York's biggest playground, more than 11,000 screeching youngsters cheered home their heroines yesterday in the finals of the third Colgate Women's Games.

title: L.I. Man Charged In Stabbing Death Of Father of Two
description: MINEOLA, LI.. March 21A 7,4yearold man was charged today with the stabbing death of the father of Iwo children who was killed early yesterday when he went to the aid of a friend.

title: For Many Nonprofitable Hospitals 1976 Was a Profitable Year
description: TRENTON, March 21 (UPI)New Jersey's nonprofit hospitals are anticipating S17 million in surpluses for 1976, although many of them say they are losing money, says the State Commissioner of Health.

title: Head of A. B. Dick Co. Resigns To Become Air Force Secretary
description: CHICAGO, March 21 (AP)John C. Stetson, president of A.B. Dick Company. resigned today to become Secretary of the Air Force, the company announced.

title: Major Quake Strikes Southern Iran Town
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Tuesday, March 22 (UPI)A major earthquake struck southern Iran early today, causing heavy damage in the Persian Gulf port of Bandar Abbas, about 450 miles south of Teheran, a relief official in Bandar Abbas said.

title: MRS. GANDHI'S PARTY IS DEFEATED AFTER 30YEAR RULE
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, March 22The Congress Party, which has governed India in all its 30 years of independence, lost its majority in the lower chamber of Parliament this morning to the opposition alliance.

title: Taxes &
description: When the Government provides funds for neglected or delinquent children, does the money actually go to help such youngsters or to line someone's pocket?

title: Peruvian Novelist Turns Film Maker and Tangles With the Army
description: LIMA, .PeruAt 40 years of age, Mario Vargas Llosa, the Peruvian novelist, appears to have reached the summit of the Latin American cultural world.

title: Westchester Bars Trial of Two Over Radar Detectors
description: Westchester County District Attorney's office today refused to prosecute two truck drivers arrested for having radardetection devices in their vehicles, contending that the statute used b ythe state police in such cases was inadequate.

title: Recital: Villa Eats Up Keyboard
description: Joseph Villa, in his Alice Tully Hall piano recital last night, started and ended with Liszt. In between he took look at Schumann (Carnaval), Scriabin (Sonata No. 4) and Rachmaninoff (five short pieces). The Liszt was the Cantique d'Amour, which is the last of the Harmonies podtiques et religieuses, and the Hungarian Rhapsody No. 9.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 22, 1977

title: Drought Forcing Farmers to Quit
description: SEAGRAVES, Tex., March 19Gaines County is one big sandbox this spring. Sand drifts five feet high stopped trains here yesterday and dust grounded airplanes the day before. The wind blew up so much dust and sand on Thursday that farmers joked about seeing prairie dogs digging holes 10 feet in the air.

title: Bill Reflects the Outcry Over Gang Assaults
description: ALBANY, March 21A bill mandating prison terms for crimes of violence against people over 62 years of age was passed by the State Assembly today with only five dissenting votes.

title: Bribery Charged to Honolulu Mayor; He Attributes Indictment to Politics
description: HONOLULU, March 21Mayor Frank F. Fasi of Honolulu was indicted today by the Oahu grand jury on iwo bribery counts in connection with payments allegedly made for his help in a $50 million condominium project.

title: Books of The Times
description: The late Lord Kinrosshe died last June, shortly after finishing this book was no Gibbon, as we see whenever he stops to quote Gibbon on, say, the fall of Constantinople. A prose that has been marching along in a brisk and conscientious manner, with due attention to the care and feeding of facts, is suddenly interrupted by the heavy artillery, a rhetorical cannonade, not to mention organ music. Thus, when Gib

title: Podgorny Welcomed In Tanzania on Tour Aboard Soviet's SST
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania. March 22 (Reuters)President Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union arrive( in Tanzania today on the first stage of what appeared to be a diplomatic offensive in southern Africa.

title: A Second Nadjari Indictment Against Goldman Is Dismissed
description: An indictment that Maurice H. Nadjari obtained in 1975 against Irving Goldman the former head of the Shubert Foundation who served as the New York City Cultural Affairs Commissionerwas dismissed yeterday by a State Supreme Court justice, who said that the former special state anticorruption prosecutor had exceeded his jurisdiction.

title: Nicaraguans Accused of Profiteering on Help the U. S. Sent After Quake
description: MANAGUA, NicaraguaThe United States Agency for International Development has opened an investigation into charges that Nicaraguan Government officials have profited from American funds assigned for the reconstruction of the capital city of Managua.

title: You Don't Have To Be Jewish To Love Matzoh
description: Passover, the Jewish spring festival of deliverance, begins this year on April 3. Observed for an entire week, the holiday is celebrated mainly on the first two nights, when families gather around the Seder tables to eat, drink wine and to listen to the story of the exodus of the ancient Jews from bondage in Egypt.

title: Busting the Kaleidoscope
description: PARISThe political kaleidoscope is starting to be so shaken up these days that one wonders whether any pattern can assert itself to replacewith some sense of continuitywhat went before.

title: Coast Race's Purse Grows
description: SAN MATEO. Calif., March 22 (AP) The purse for the April 24 Golden State Derby, one of quarter horse racing's major events, reached a record $250,000 today when three horses became supplemental nominees. The 3yearolds added to the field for the 440yard event at Bay Meadows were Etta Chick, Mr. Jetson and The Bulldogger. It cost owners $14,750 apiece to make their horses supplemental nominees.

title: Michael Korda is the editor in chief of Simon &
Wine Talk
description: STORIES about the good California wineries can be frustrating. Why read about some excellent new wines when it is impossible or almost impossible to buy them? So enthusiastic are the Californians about their own wines that they buy them all up as soon as they become available. In effect, they make secondclass citizens of East Coast wine enthusiasts.

title: NATO Military Aide Urges Allies to Raise Their Arms Budgets
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The North Atlantic Alliance can deter Soviet aggression now, but it must spend 2 to 3 percent more on its insurance premium to protect its way of life and lives in the near future, according to the chairman of the alliance's Military Committee.

title: RISE OF $1 BILLION IN DAIRY COSTS SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Secretary of Agriculture Bob Bergland formally announced today an increase in milkprice supports that could add about a billion dollars a year to the costs of taxpayers and consumers of dairy products.

title: Last Superagencies Created by Lindsay Face Dismantling
description: A New York City Council committee yesterday approved legislation to restructure the last of the city's superagencies created a decade ago by the John V. Lindsay administration to streamline city government.

title: Lag in Ticket Sales Brings Delay In JeffersonJackson Day Dinner
description: The Democratic State Committee yesterday postponed its JeffersonJackson Day dinner scheduled for Friday because of the difficulty of selling the  $100 tickets and getting Vice President Mondale as the featured speaker. The dinner is designed to raise funds to help erase part of  on $185,000 debt left over  Politics from the 1973 campaign that led to Governor Byrne's election. The Democrats hoped to sell 1,000 tickets, but only about 300 were sold, all by the state committee. The Governor and his Aides sold none.

title: Q&A
description: Q Quite often I run across recipes for chicken that instruct the cook to truss the chicken. Am I mistaken that this means to clean the chicken?

title: War Hero's Widow Wins Battle for G.I. Benefits
description: DETROIT. March 22.A Medal of Honor winner shot to death as he apparently tried to rob a store here in 1971 was mentally incompetent at the time, the result of Army exploitation, a veterans affairs board has ruled.

title: Carter's Mother Gets Bid For Relief Pitching Role
description: ATLANTA, March 22 (AP)The Atlanta Braves have asked President Carter to throw out the first ball at their home opener April 15, but he may have a relief pitcherwhether he likes it or not.

title: Notes on People
description: INFLATION put me back to work, said  Orval E. Faubus, a former governor of Arkansas whb, 20 years ago, led the resistance to the racial integration of Central High School in Little Rock. Mr. Faubus, who is 67 years old, is working as a teller in the First National Bank of Huntsville, a town of about 2,000 population in northwestern Arkansas. The former governor, who took the teller's job last week, said his state retirement benefits, computed on 10 of the 12 years he spent as governor, amounted to just over $600 monthly. He hopes to work until August, when his book concerning the first four years of his administration goes on the market. The book's release will correspond with the 20th anniversary of the desegregat!on crisis at Central High.

title: A Second Nadjari Indictment Against Goldman Is Dismissed
description: An indictment that Maurice H. Nadjari obtained in 1975 against Irving Goldman the former head of the Shubert Foundation who served as the New York City Cultural Affairs Commissionerwas dismissed yeterday by a State Supreme Court justice, who said that the former special state anticorruption prosecutor had exceeded his jurisdiction.

title: Brzezinski, Quoted on Israeli Borders, Issues Denial
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Zbigniew Brzezinski, President Carter's adviser on national security, was quoted tonight as having told Israeli diplomats that in final Middle East settlement Israel might bei able to retain frontiers as far as 32 miles into the Sinai desert beyond the 1967 borders.

title: The New York Times/Paul Nosefros
description: Heavy rain flooded streets and highways in New York City and its suburbs yesterday, snarling evening traffic for several hours.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: IT IS ALMOST theater. The curtains part, the lights go up, the chandelier comes down on rope. Some 500 people are staring at the chandelier, but every few seconds one of them will wink, nod, or perhaps just twitch. Edward Lee Cave, who is sitting in what looks like a pulpit, does not miss any of it. The people who wink, nod and twitch are bidding, and Mr.. Cave will almost hear their eyeballs click. He is an elegant auctioneer and senior vice president in what is the most elegant auction house in America: Sotheby Parke Barnet. It where the rich sell off their household goods.

title: Beanie Aides Say Staff Reductions Open More Jobs in Election Year
description: Many of the 7,400 city workers who Mayor Beame had predicted would resign or retire in the coming fiscal year have already left the public payroll, mayoral officials conceded yesterday.

title: DeathPenalty Plan for Croatians Dropped
description: Federal prosecutors disclosed yesterday that they did not plan to seek the death penalty for four Croatian nationalists scheduled to go on trial today in the hijacking of a Trans World Airlines 727 jet last Sept. 10.

title: CARTER PROPOSES END. OF ELECTORAL COLLEGE IN PRESIDENTIAL VOTES
description: WASHINGTON, March22President Carter strongly urged Congress today to propose a Constitutional amendment that would abolish the indirect system of electors and electoral votes by which American Presidents have been chosen since 1789, and substitute election by a simple majority of the popular vote.

title: Torn and Miss Page To Open in Strindberg
description: Geraldine Page and Rip Torn will star in a bill of two August Strindberg plays, starting Friday at the Publip Cheater's Newman Theater. Mr. Torn and Miss Page will appear together in Creditors, while Miss Page will also perform, with Amy Wright and Judith L'Heureux, in The Stronger.

title: Governor Signs A Bill to Attract Movie Industry
description: WEST ORANGE, March 22Governor Byrne signed a bill today aimed at attracting the movie industry back to New Jersey, where it began.

title: Average Rate Climbs to 6.02% On $2.5 Billion Treasury Notes
description: The Treasury Department sold $2.5 billion of twoyear notes yesterday at an average rate of 6.02 percent, slightly higher than the rates the Government incurred in January and February. The rate was well above the 5.37 percent the Government was happy to accept in December, when Credit the borrowing cost was the Markets lowest since these securities began to be sold on a regular basis in 1972. Although the 6.02 percent rate was a little higher than some Government securities dealers had expected late Monday, it was in line with their estimates by early yesterday afternoon.

title: Pain Is Schmit's EverPresent Companion As Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.All 76,000 seats at Giants Stadium were empty that day when Bob Schmit scored his big victory and so, all alone on the upper deck, Bob Schmit clapped for himself

title: CARTER ENCOURAGED BY SOVIET ON ARMS; ADAMANT ON RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 22President Carter told members of Congress today that he was not discouraged by Leonid I. Brezhnev's warning that criticism of human rights conditions in the Soviet Union could jeopardize relations between the two countries.

title: SUPPORT FOR SOUTH KOREAN DISSIDENTS: Demonstrators singing We Shall Overcome
description: Associated Press

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 23, 1977

title: Economy Fare Elegant (Tasty, Too); Chicken Is Marvelous, Meat Loaf Delectable And Lamb Stew Sublime
description: RICH man, poor man, fin bec or glutton, who would not save Pennies at food Markets and rejoice in his cunning?. To sure, truffles arid cockscomb: and plover's eggs offer undeniable delights. Foie gras, caviar and nightingale's tongues all have their placeif not in the kitchen at least in the literature. The mouth can salivate at the thought of a grouse ragout enriched with the aromas of La Tche and RomaneConti.

title: S.E.C. Studies Kaiser
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating the Kaiser Industries Corporation for having paid $1.3 million in special bonuses over a 16year period ended in 1971 to selected employees of Kaiser and three partially owned Kaiser companies, Kaiser announced yesterday in Oakland, Calif.

title: State of Industrial Relations: Appraisal From High Levels
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.Never had so many Secretaries of Labor, Democratic and Republican, been gathered under one roof. The Massachusetts Institute of Technology had invited all the holders of that office since the Kennedy Administration to come in The celebration of the 40th anLabor of the institute's Labor Industrial Relations Section Scene and the 25th anniversary of its Alfred P. Sloan School of Management. The Secretaries specific assignment was to outline their unfinished agenda for American industrial relations. To keep the appraisal from getting too ingrown, the Cabinetlevel perspective was balanced by an independent assessment of the state of collective bargaining, labor law and the economy as seen by a panel of highranking. corporate and union officials.

title: Thinking Small
description: In his bravest political action since becoming President, Jimmy Carter, stuck a knife into one of the most sacred of Congressional sacred cows  and aroused corresponding Senatorial fury  in trying to eliminate 19 major waterresource projects for the excellent reason that they now appear unsupportable on economic, environmental and/or safety grounds.

title: EPA HEAD TO RECALL 135,000 75 CADILLACS
description: WASHINGTON, March 22The new administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, Douglas M. Costle, announced at his first news conference today that he was ordering the recall of 135,000 1975 model Cadillacs for violatinn of standards for clean air.

title: Bulls 102, Lakers 86
description: CHICAGO, March 22 (AP)Wilbur Holland poured in 24 points and Artis Gilmour added 19 tonight to lead the streaking Chicago Bulls to a 10286 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Albany Senate Bids Regents Delay Certification of Moon's Seminary
description: ALBANY, March 22The New York State Senate asked the Board of Regents today to delay a request from the Unification Church of God, an, organization headed by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon, that its seminary he certified as a degreegranting institution of higher education.

title: Federated Stores Shows Gains for Final Quarter; Sears Net Also Climbs
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest retailer, reported yesterday ft. 30.4 percent increase in net income for its fourth fiscal quarter ended Jan. 31.

title: Making the Vote and Voting More Popular
description: For a nation founded on every man's inalienable rights, America has been a long time turning universal suffrage into a reality. The abolition of property qualifications for voting was a feature of the Jacksonian Revolution. The Civil War was fought and the Fifteenth Amendment adopted to extend the franchise to blacks, but it took another century before that promise was fully redeemed. Meanwhile, the suffragettes had to wage a halfcentury crusade to get the vote for women, and yet another Constitutional amendment was needed to extend the suffrage to persons aged 18 to 21.

title: Text of Mrs. Gandhi's Resignation Address
description: NEW DELHI, March 22 (AP)FoIlowing is the text of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's statement on her resignation after the defeat of her Congress Party:

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NATURE'S PALETTE Today through Sunday, one of the city's most splendidly quartered museums will glow with fresh colors, as thousands of flowering plants closely harmonize the art masterpieces of the Frick Collection, 1 East 70th Street, at Fifth Avenue. Dominated by rare orchids, which last spring drew a record turnout at the museum, the transplanted blooms are again, on loan from the New York Botanical Garden.

title: Lance and Blumenthal Uncertain On Plan to End Spending Projects
description: WASHINGTON, March 22Two top officials of the Carter Administration endorsed today the principle of socalled sunset legislation, which would force an automatic end to most Government spending programs unless Congress specifically reviewed and renewed each program periodically.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A new bidder emerged yesterday for the Richmond Corporation, an insurance holding company of Richmond. The offer of $357 million in securities came from the American General Insurance Company of Houston.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Ailey Season to Open With Gala on May 4
description: A gala performance featuring a world premiere and two New York premieres will open the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater's spring season, which will run from May 4 to 22 at the City Center.

title: Fukuda Presses Case for APlant
description: WASHINGTON, March 22President Carter and Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda of Japan agreed today that nuclear arms should be eliminated from the world, but they disagreed on the way nuclear energy should be generated for peaceful uses.
