description: In his talks with the Soviet Union on a new strategicarms accord. Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance will explore a field whose complexities have multiplied since negotiations began on the first agreement on strategicarms limitation in 1969.

title: Legislation to Encourage Business Is Sought
description: New York City's Industrial and Commercial Board, which grants tax exemptions to encourage local businesses to expand or build new facilities, recommended legislation yesterday to put industries here on a more competitive basis with those in New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: James J. Winston Marries Floreida Bush, a Teacher
description: Floreida Bush and James J. Winston of New York and Amagansett, L. L, were married yesterday by Rabbi Howard Posner of Temple EmanuEl, in his study in New York. The bride is a daughter of Rose H. Bush of the Bronx.

title: Asteroid Adonis, Lost for 41 Years, Shows Up in Photo
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP)The lost asteroid Adonis has been rediscovered after 41 years, emerging from the darkness of space just in time for spring.

title: Liberty Valance, Ham and Cornbread
description: ATLANTA, March 25In other years, the final four teams in the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament were almost predestined. Always there was the University of California, Los Angeles, and usually one of the Big Ten schools, a playground from the East and another from a wheat field. But not this year. North Carolina is here with its Olympic gold medal coach, Dean Smith, and two Olympic gold medal players, Phil Ford and Walter Davis. But the other three are strangers. In tomorrow's semifinals, Al McGuire State will play the University of North Cornbread at Charlotte. Then North Carolina will play the University of Nevada, Liberty Valance. They are even strangers to one another. None of the four has ever played any of the others. Not ever. And these four teams have played a total of 3,864 games. Those are odds that a Las Vegas gambler would cherish. Or a Las Vegas coach.

title: Knicks' Lineup
description: AT GARDEN, 8 P.M.

title: Miss Palmer Leads on 68130
description: RANCHO SANTA FE, Calif., March 25 (AP)  Sandra Palmer took the secondround lead of the $150,000 Kathryn Crosby golf tournament today with a fourunderpar 68 for a 36hole total of 138 and a twoshot lead over Sandra Post. Hollis Stacy and the firstday leader, Jan Stephenson.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, March 25Chief Justice Richard J. Hughes of the New Jersey Supreme Court urged today that the county courts be merged into the Superior Court system, with the state assuming full financing of a fully unified court system.

title: For Osaka, Mediocre Remedies Are No Longer Adequate
description: OSAKA, JapanThe fourth century Emperor, Nintoku, looking out over the village of Osaka, saw so few whisps of smoke from home fires that he realized how difficult times had become and suspended tax collections for three years. If Osaka's Mayor, Yasushi Oshima, could see through the haze today he might reach a similar conclusion, although such a radical step as suspending taxes is a relic of the past.

title: ANNE W. WHEATON, 68, AN EISENHOWER AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, March 25Mrs, Anne Williams Wheaton, the first woman to serve as an associate press secretary to a President, died Wednesday in Dallas. She was 84 years old.

title: BEATING IN ROBBERY IS FATAL TO MAN, 84
description: An 84yearold Brooklyn man who was severely beaten in an alleged robbery three weeks ago died yesterday, 13 days after his aged wife succumbed to injuries that the police said had been inflicted in another assault by the same assailant. Two boys are accused of the attacks.

title: Books of The Times
description: Vladimir Voinovich is a formerly successful Russian writer in his mid40's now in official disfavor because of a penchant for speaking and writing his mind. Expelled from the Writers Union and unable to make a living as a writer, he nonetheless continues to reside precariously in the Soviet Union. Mr. Voinovich considers himself essentially apolitical, as he said in an interview published in Index on Censorship, yet he is subject to petty harassments; most recently his phone was cut off, a move that denied him contact with fellow Soviet writers now living in exile. Undaunted, he wrote a funny open letter to the Minister of Communication accusing the functionary who had cut his telephone service of sowing doubt abroad as to his country's sincerity in desiring relaxation of international tensions. After all, he said, not even the notorious George Meany has managed to disconnect a single telephone.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Allen Ward, Newspaper Editor In Pennsylvania, Dead at 57
description: Allen Ward, a newspaperman and the owner and editor of the weekly New Hope Gazette in Pennsylvania, died of cancer Thursday at the Hunterdon Medical Center in Flemington, N.J. He was 57 years old and lived in New Hope.

title: Nibbling Away at the Upper East Side
description: The proposed Metropolitan Museum Historic District, a beautiful and embattled section of Manhattan's Upper East Side, was recently the subject of designation hearings by the Landmarks Preservation Commission. The neighborhood along Fifth Avenue from 78th to 86th Streets and along the side streets to Madison Avenue, including parts of Madison, is an area of great style, quality and elegance. The common denominator of these mansions, brownstones and apartment houses goes beyond their solid stone and fine detail to a singular amenity of scale and cohesive character.

title: Rangers Set Back By Capitals, 7 to 2
description: LANDOVER, Md., March 25  The Rangers' nemesis in the Capital Centre, that pesky Washington club, dealt the New Yorkers a critical blow tonight in defeating them, 72. Scoring five goals in the middle session and enjoying twogoal efforts by Ace Bailey and Bill Collins, the Capitals made easy work of their desperate visitors.

title: Born to the Role, DepressionEra Child Helps Nation's Poor
description: SANTA FE, N.M.Dr. Graciela Olivares, the new head of the Community Services Administration, the Federal antipoverty program, is no stranger to poverty.

title: Gold Rises $1.25 in London To a High for 18 Months; Dollar Mixed in Europe
description: LONDON, March 25 (AP)The price of gold rose $1.25 in London today, closing at an 18month high. The dollar had a mixed day in Europe in slow trading.

title: Dentist Defying Maine's Ban on Advertising
description: STANDISH, Me., March 25A local dentist is advertising in the Portland newspapers in violation of state law in an attempt to fight a move to allow dental technicians to make false teeth.

title: U. S. C. Takes 5 More Titles In Swimming
description: CLEVELAND, March 25The National Collegiate swimming championships turned into a benefit tonight for the University of Southern California. The Trojans, assured of their fourth straight team title, won five of the six finals on this, the second night of the threeday meet at Cleveland State University.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Union City woman is facing a sixmonth jail sentence for billing other people for $5.000 in longdistance telephone calls. The woman, Conchita R. Alvarez, 23 Years old, made the calls from telephone booths to places all over the country and told the operators to charge them to various homes and businesses in Hudson County, according to the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company.

title: 74,000 New York City Employees Granted a $94 CostofLiving Bonus
description: Amid highly vocal bickering over the nature of New York City's laborproductivity program, the Emergency Financial Control Board yesterday approved costofliving bonuses of $94.50 for each of 74,000 nonuniformed employees working for the agencies under Mayor Beame.

title: Ballet: New Bejart Pli Selon Pli
description: The Ballet of the 20th Century presented the local premiere of Maurice Bjart's Pli Selon Pli (Fold by Fold) Thursday night at the Uris Theater. The ballet is not scheduled to be given again during the current season.

title: U.S. Will Allow Citizens to Spend Dollars in Cub a
description: WASHINGTON, March 25The Carter Administration took another step today in the direction of normal relations with Cuba by lifting the ban on the spending of dollars by. United States visitors to that country.

title: Two Are Convicted of Rape
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., March 25 (UPI) Two college students have been convicted of raping an Army Wac in a motel near Fort Dix. The students, James M. Ferguson, 21 years old, and Bernard M. Holmes, 22, both of Asbury Park, were held on $20,000 bail each following their convictions yesterday. They face sentencing next month. Authorities said the two men broke into a room where the Wac was staying with an Army private and forced her to engage in various sex acts.

title: PODGORNY AND NYERERE DISCUSS AFRICAN ISSUES
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, March 25 (Reuters)President Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union and President Julius K. Nyerere of Tanzania, in their last round of talks here today, discussed the issue of replacement of white minority control in southern Africa by black majority rule.

title: Califano Is Besieged by Questions About His Cook and Security Aide
description: WASHINGTON, March 25A small incident at the White House today indicated that those who live under the symbol of no frills in government may occasionally trip over the symbol.

title: Mrs. Steingut a Silent Force in Albany Politics
description: ALBANY, March 25  Madeline Steingut is the Speaker's wife. To most people who meet her, that is selfcontaned and selfexplanatory. She is the gracious woman by Stanley Steingut's side at legislatve receptions. She volunteers at the hospital. People comment frequently on her charm, her good humor, her intelligence.

title: U.S. Inquiry Reported on Charges Of Bribes at Woolworth's Kinney
description: A Justice Department investigation has begun into alleged supplier kickbacks to company executives of the Kinney Shoe Corporation, a subsidiary of the F. W. Woolworth Company and one of the nation's largest retail shoe chains, reliable sources said yesterday.

title: Summaries of Finals
description: (First six places decided in championship final, next six places in consolation final.)

title: Soybean Futures Sharply Higher
description: Soybean futures moved sharply higher on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday after three consecutive days of decline.

title: Prison Cows Go Up for Auction, Ending an Experiment in Connecticut
description: ENFIELD, Conn., March 25Under a windwhipped tent at the prison farm in the open northern hills of Connecticut, 400 dairy cows went on the auction block today, marking the end of a 46yearold experiment at the institution.

title: BETHLEHEM STEEL EXPECTS A DEFICIT FOR FIRST QUARTER
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's second largest steelmaker, announced yesterday that it expected to show a loss in its firstquarter operations.

title: 58 IN SENATE SEND LETTER OF SUPPORT TO CARTER ON RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 25Fiftyeight Senatois today endorsed President Carter's stand on human rights, just hours before Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance left for Moscow for three days of talks with Leonid I. Brezhnev, probably including a debate on the issue of human rights.

title: L.S.U. Women in Final
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March 25 (AP)Louisiana State upset Immaculata, 7468, tonight and gained a berth in the championship game of the Associated of Intercollegiate Athletics for Women basketball tournament against Delta State's defending champions, who beat Tennessee, 6258, in its semifinal to improve its record to 313.

title: Bucks 112, Nuggets 108
description: MILWAUKEE, March 25 (AP)Two baskets by Bobby Dandridge and two Denver turnovers In the final two minutes helped Milwaukee salvage a 112108 victory over the Nuggets tonight.

title: Personal Investing
description: New York City officially joined some deepdyed bluechip company this week when Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin disclosed that three big municipal pension funds had begun indexing about 20'percent of their, common stock holdings to the Standard & Poor's 500 stock average.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP)Water flow of streams and rivers in drought areas of the Middle West and the West reversed a twoweek increase and began declining this week, the United States Geological Survey reported today.

title: W.R. White Dead; ExChief of Baylor A Baptist Minister
description: W. R. White, a Baptist minister and former chancellor of Baylor University in Waco, Tex., died Thursday at Hillcrest Hospital in Waco. He was 84 years old.

title: Southern California Sets Strictest Sulfur Controls
description: LOS ANGELESCalifornia, which has often led the nation both in creating pollution and in cleaning it up, has again taken the initiative. Over the next few months utilities in the smogladen Southern California basin will begin burning oil containing only 0.25 percent sulfur under the strictest air controls in the United States.

title: Heaven and Earth a Play of Life
description: Almost inevitably, plays about death become plays about life. In Michael Cristofer's The Shadow Box, it is those who survive as well as those who are dying who have to come to terms with questions of mortality. In A Sorrow Beyond Dreams, Peter Handke, facing his mother's suicide, tries to comprehend the meaning  or the meaninglessnessof her existence.

title: Mrs. King, Miss Hamm Gain
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., March 25 (AP) Billie Jean King needed just 55 minutes to defeat Marcie Louie, 62, 62, today in the semifinal round of a $20,000 women's tennis tournament. Mrs. King, playing in her first singles tournament in seven months, will meet Mary Hamm of San Antonio in the final.

title: ATLANTIC CITY HIRES A MASTER PLANNER
description: ATLANTIC CITY, March 25Atlantic City hired a Washington consulting firm today for $500,000 to draft a casinooriented master plan for development of the resort.

title: SCHLESINGER AGAINST PLUTONIUM FUEL USE IN NUCLEAR REACTORS
description: WASHINGTON, March 25James R. Schlesinger told a group of citizens today that the Administration was opposed to the development of plutonium fuel systems for nuclear power reactors but would go along with the construction of additional conventional uranium reactors.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Concert: Alice
description: It has been said of David Del Tredici that he has a gift for inhabiting the knifeedge world between sanity and insanity. One illustration is that the 40yearold American has been devoting himself for some time to compositions based on Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.

title: Fidrych Knee Improved
description: LAKELAND, Fla., March 25 AP)Mark (The Bird) Fidrych, the Detroit Tigers' star pitcher and 1976 American League rookitoftheyear, will be idled indefinitely, but his sprained left knee has improved, the team reported today.

title: F.C.C.'s Limits on Pay Cable TV Ruled Unconstitutional by Court
description: WASHINGTON, March 25In a decision of major importance to the television industry, the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia ruled today that the Government's existing regulation of pay cable television was unconstitutional and improper.

title: Oilers 4, Stingers 3
description: CINCINNATI, March 25 (AP)Rusty Patenaude score di overtime and gave the Edminton Oilers a 43 victory over the Cincinnati Stingers tonight in the W.H.A. Patenaude, a right wing, scored on a drop pass from Glen Sather, the Oilers' playercoach, at 6:10 of the overtime.

title: FamilyCare Home Fire Kills 4 Mentally Retarded Adults
description: DEXTER, N.Y., March 25 (UPI)Four mentally retarded persons died early today when fire destroyed a familycare home in this village near the Canadian border. One of the victims was an 18yearold woman who apparently became frightened and turned back from her rescuers.

title: Deaths
description: ALPERTFannie, beloved wife of file lale ?? ?? of ?? ?? Ken?? Co?? and me ?? ?? Sleinberg grandmother and greatgrandmother. Services Monday, ?? 23, 9:45 A.M., at The Riverslue, ?? St. and Amsterdam Ave.

title: JENE ALLEN SAVAGE
description: Jene Allen Savage, the widow of Alfred Savage, former controller of The Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died Wednesday at her home in Fort Smith, Ark. She was 64 years old. She leaves two sons, Allen and Gary; a daughter, Kay Surd; a brother, Bruce,

title: A Language Bank Aids Elmhurst Hospital
description: At no cost to the taxpayer, a medical service has been developed at Elmhurst General Hospital in Queens that is unparalleled in the state and probably in the county. It is a language bank.

title: Philippine Dancers Portray Warm and Sunny Life
description: Even the somber rites of burial for a fallen warrior could not lessen the essentially happy and joyous mood of Bayanihan, the Philippine Dance Company that opened a brief stay at the Felt Forum Thursday night. The tone of life in these islands is warm and sunny and their dances show it. Flowing, lilting rhythms succeed one another in a procession of brightly colored dance vignettes.

title: A Little Usury Is a Useful Thing
description: Since 1880, the New York State usury law has set the maximum interest rate at 6 percent. (Loans to corporations are not affected). In recent years, 6 percent has been so far below the rate at which anyone was willing to lend money that specific exemptions have been enacted. One of these, in effect since 1968, permits lenders to charge 8 percent interest on mortgage loans, primarily for one and twofamily homes. This exemption expires on April 30. Unless the Legislature takes corrective action, a large part of the mortgage money supply for new homes and rehabilitation will be choked off.

title: Corrected List of Doctors Getting Medicaid Fees Due in Two Weeks
description: WASHINGTON, March 25 (AP)It may take two weeks before the Social Security Administration issues a corrected list of physicians who received more than $100.000 in Medicare payments in 1975.

title: Improved Bubble Memories
description: Specialists at Bell Telephone Laboratories have patented an inexpensive method of moving the bubbles carrying bits of information in magnetic bubble memory systems. Page 29.

title: Showdown of College Fives Opens Today
description: ATLANTA, March 25Three Olympic basketball players, the coach of the United States team that won the gold medal in the 1976 Olympics and a player named Cornbread are among the cast of characters who will play out tomorrow's semifinal round of the 39th annual championship of the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: Memorial Services
description: STEDELIEva, beloved mother of Katherine Gould. Memorial service will be on March 17, 1:30 P.M., at the Ethical Culturel Society, 2 W. 64th St., N. Y. C.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Federal authorities have asked Columbia University to submit a revised security plan for the small atomic reactor that the university hopes to have in operation by summer.

title: M.A.C. BOND EXCHANGE OFF TO ROUSING START
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation, commencing the exchange offer that forms a key element of New York City's plan to redeem its $1 billion moratorium! debt, found itself deluged yesterday with investors willing to exchange $211 million worth of shortterm city notes for M.A.C. bonds.

title: Telephone Rate Rise Is Refused
description: AUGUSTA, Me., March 25 (AP)It's an old story: the telephone company asks for a rate increase and the public utilities commission acts. This time the customers are smiling and the company is not.

title: CHIRAC TAKES OVER AS MAYOR OF PARIS
description: PARIS, March 25  Former Prime Minister Jacques Chirac was formally elected Mayor of Paris today by the City Council, filling an office revived after an interim of 105 years.

title: Mayor Seeks Passage of Original Proposal on Limiting Pornography
description: Mayor Beame has called a special meeting of the Board of Estimate for Monday to make another attempt to pass the City Planning Commission's original antipornography zoning proposal.

title: Strike Halts Most Public Transit Runs in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 25 (AP)The 400,000 daily riders of Philadelphia buses, trolleys, subways and elevated trains shifted to other modes of travel today after an unexpected strike halted most public transit service in the nation's fourth largest city.

title: TheftResistant Nuclear Fuel Operation Tested
description: A breeder nuclearfuel recycling system, in which the fuel remained so radioactive that terrorists could not have stolen it, operated in Idaho almost unnoticed for more than four years in the 1960's, according to two officials of the Electric Power Research Institute.

title: Ford's Annual Report Points Up Problems
description: DETROIT, March 25The annual reports issued by major American businesses are usually glowing accounts. The Ford Motor Company report issued today departs from that formatat least on one page headlined, Not everything went right.

title: Barons 4, Canucks 4
description: RICHFIELD, Ohio, March 25 (AP)Bob Girard scored a shorthanded goal in the third period that gave the Cleveland Barons a 44 tie with the Vancouver Canucks tonight.

title: Pistons 107, Warriors 94
description: DETROIT, March 25 (AP)M. L. Carr and Al Eberhard scored 8 points each in a sevenminute secondquarter span tonight as the Detroit Pistons defeated the Golden State Warriors, 10794, and snapped a fourgame streak.

title: Jazz 100, Kings 96
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 25 (AP)Pete Maravich pumped in 44 points and Otto Moore scored 8 of his 11 points in overtime tonight to lead the New Orleans Jazzz to a 10096 triumph over the Kansas City Kings.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Hunter Yields 2 Homers, Yet Satisfied
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., March 25Catfish Hunter got six innings of work out of his ailing right shoulder today in his third outing of the spring and said he was satisfied with the results.

title: Delacroix the Draftsman
description: ONE OF the biases we have perpetuated concerning the art of Eugene Delacroix is that he was a great colorist and less than a great draftsman. That he was one of the greatest colorists of the 19th century cannot be denied but that he was not an accomplished draftsman should be challenged. Although Delacroix's line does not yield the elegant fineness nor prepossessing authority of Ingres, with whom Delacroix has too often been compared, he nonetheless revealed a particular mastery and genius at drawing and printmaking.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: ITEAR open the officiallooking letter. It is a subpoena to appear for jury duty. I have rarely been subpoenaed anywhere. My initial apprehension gradually gives way to a feeling of anticipation as I begin to look forward to what is, after all, a new experience.

title: Jessica Cowles Affianced
description: Mr. and Mrs. Charles John Cowles of Cheshire, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Jessica Lynn Cowles, to Jeffrey Johnston English, son of Betsey H. English of Cheshire and William S. English of Waterbury, Conn.

title: DINING OUT
description: WHATEVER it was that brought visitors to New Jersey's seashore resorts in the past, it was rarely the quality of their restaurants. Hot dog stands, mediocre fish places and carbon copies of the Italian restaurants back in the city were about what to expect.

title: A New Vessel Of Cunard Line Will Serve Port
description: The pomp and circumstance attending the debut of a new passenger liner in the port tend to overshadow the deeper meaning of the addition of a new shin to local vessel rosters.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: At what point did the contemporary world, enlightened as it is, come to regard sex as poison, deadly no matter what the dosage? The question crossed my mind, fleetingly, as I came away from Albert Innaurato's short, thoroughly unpleasant, undeniably powerful The Transfiguration or Benno Blimpie, now part of a double bill called Monsters at the Astor Place Theater. If I didn't pursue it at the time, I suppose it was because it was so easy to answer: Benno is such a disturbing playI felt though I'd been mauled in the playhouse, and by expertsbecause we have at last been willing to face up to the nature of the sensual beast inside us, to acknowledge candidly that beast's indiscriminate taste for sodomy, child molestation, homosexual attack, castration, fetishism in fanciest forms, what have you. If our experiences when dealing with sex in the theater have grown more troubling (the audience with which I saw Benno did not relax its attention for a moment, but it attempted to relieve its unease by shifting about in its seats to a most remarkable degree), it is because the theater itself has grown more honest.

title: Cathy Ann Martin Is Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Martin of Garden City, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Cathy Ann Martin, to Vincent John Young, son of Mr. and Mrs. Adam Young of New York and Westhampton, L.I. A fall wedding is planned.

title: Vance's Mission To Moscow
description: WASHINGTON, March 26The Carter Administration is now having its first personal contact with the leaders of the Soviet Union, and ever since the last world war these first meetings between new American officials and the Soviet chieftains have been highly significant.

title: A New Monthly Newsletter Offers Clerics Advice on Earthly Matters
description: Acting on the assumption that the clergy is largely unschooled in practical matters, a twoman team in New York has begun publishing a monthly newsletter that promises to offer the cleric everything they didn't tell you in seminary about running a church.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: OIL tankers and airplanes don't have a lot in common, but when they get into accidents they hurt more than just the people on board. Therefore, says Representative Norman F. Lent, Republican of Baldwin, says sea traffic control should be made to have more in common with air traffic control to protect the interests of people who live near areas where such traffic passes.

title: Bad rap for dope
description: There is a growing concern that much of the socalled drug problem may be a misconception which derives its effective energy from the mechanism known as displacement: the unconscious transfer of affect from its real object to substitute objects. To center so much interest on drugs, drug users and the prevention of drug use is to mislocate the issues, and those who worry most about drugs are often really concerned about something else. The real issue is often not the chemical substances but blacks, or hippies, or the establishment, or, as appears to be the case in this book, sex.

title: GARDENING
description: THERE has been an enthusiastic response to the report made a few weeks ago on naturalistic landscaping, a concept that embraces conservation principles and discourages artificial development of home grounds. The object is low upkeep with use of native plants or replacement of duds with more attractive species.

title: VANCE IS IN MOSCOW TO AFFIRM DETENTE AND SEEK ARMS CUTS
description: MOSCOW, March 26Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance arrived today on a crucial mission to underscore support for dtente and to persuade Leonid I. Brezhnev to negotiate deep cuts in nuclear forces and thus break the deadlock in the Geneva talks on a second strategic arms limitation treaty.

title: Texas Corrals the MovieMaking Crowd
description: DALLASTexas and the moviemaklag industry have been introduced to each others and they are hitting it off just fine. Many films made In the Lone Star state seem to be Grated family shows, although there are others as well.

title: CAREY MOYES TO BAR HOSPITAL PROJECTS
description: The New York State Department of Health intends to block just about every kind of hospital improvement and modernization project here until the city's voluntary and municipal hospitals agree to reduce their number of beds.

title: Uneasy Moscow Is Still Intent On the Basics Of Detente
description: MOSCOWAs disparate as Soviet and American societies are, they share an evangelical streak. Each holds its political values with a moral certainty; each sees humane virtue in the spread of its system's basic precepts. As a component of foreign policy, the sense righteousness grows and wanes depending on the circumstance and the moment of history, but it remains important in both sides visions of the world, and especially so now, on the eve of Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance's highlevel talks in Moscow.

title: Opening the Sap Tap
description: THERE IS a very special fragrance and excitement in the air these days at the New anaan Nature Center. And with good reason; it's maple syrup time again.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: MT.A. and N.T.S.B. and D.O.T. and F.R.A. have all left Westchester rail commuters in a murky alphabet soup when it comes to finding out who's responsible for safety on the railroads and how those spooky derailments and nearmiss accidents of recent times can be avoided in the future.

title: A Guide to Lawnsmanship For the Suburbs
description: In my first summer as homeowner, I managed to commit at least one breach of lawn etiquette a week. Lawn etiquette is the very nub of suburban existence. To ignore it is to invite the direst of sanctionsshunning of your garage sale, for instance. Let me recall, painfully, the major taboos I violated in my quest for the Great American Carpet of Green:

title: Freestyle Wrestling
description: AT TOLEDO, OHIO

title: N. C. A. A. Swim Summaries
description: AT CLEVELAND

title: Seattle Slew, 15. Easily Wins $139,000 Flamingo Stakes
description: MIAMI, March 26Undefeated Seattle Slew, the newest wonder horse of racing, rolled to his fifth straight victory today when he won the $139,000 Flamingo Stales by four lengths and took a commanding position on the road to the Kentucky Derby.

title: Marquette and North Carolina Triumph, Gain N.C.A.A. Final
description: ATLANTA, March 26  Marquette University's Jerome Whitehead wrestled the ball free to make a winning shot at the final buzzer today and give the Warriors a thrilling 5149 victory over the University of North Carolina at Charlotte in the semifinals of the National Collegiate Athletic Association championship.

title: An Overseas Lesson From Colgate
description: Most managers of multinational companies last year must have felt like Sisyphus, the mythical character who was condemned to roll a large stone up a hill, only to have it slip away Just before reaching the top.

title: Linda Louise Larrabee Is Engaged to Robert Burke.
description: Mr. and Mrs. James F. Larrabee Jr. of Avon, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Linda Louise Larrabee, to Robert D. Burke, son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin F. Burke of Del Ray Beach, Fla.

title: Three New Staff Members in Close Orbit Around Carter Tell of Jobs and Eccentricities
description: WASHINGTON, March 18If indeed the White House is Olympus, then perhaps it could be said that Midge Costanza has climbed into the clouds of the upper slope. Meanwhile, Orin Kramer and Bruce Kirschenbaum have made it over the timber line.

title: Design
description: Patterned area rugs are back in fashion, the best of them woven of brightcolored yarns in designs inspired by folk art. The folk motifs are showing up both in handmade rugs. from places like Tunisia and Tibet, and in machineloomed American versions.

title: The Region
description: The New Jersey Supreme Court, the state's highest, has refined its controversial 1975 decision calling for the end to zoning rules that result in racial or economic segregation in housing. The action represents a setback for opponents of exclusionary zoning in the metropolitan region.

title: World News Briefs
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 26 (AP)The Roman Catholic Church, in one of its most critical statements on Chile's military Government, has asked authorities to help find hundreds of Chileans reported missing after arrest.

title: For young readers
description: How does the idea of a mouse on a bicycle using a huge, oldfashioned bathtub as a racecourse strike you? It strikes me, with one nagging reservation, as fine, now that I've finished Mr. Drury's book.

title: Bonnett Gets Pole Position
description: NORTH WILKESBORO, N.C., March 26 (AP)Neil Bonnett won the pole position today in final qualifying for tomorrow's Gwyn Staley 400 NASCAR race. His twoday average speed was 107.537 miles per hour.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: WASHINGTON  Jack W. Carlson, the new chief economist of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States, portrays himself as a conservative with a difference, even as a man for all political seasons: I've met a payroll and carried a few precincts. Thus he summarizes prior roles as a builder, investor and consultant plus a fling at elective politics.

title: Mindy B. Nelkin Fiancee of Robert Schwartz
description: Mr. and Mrs. Myron C. Nelkin of Old Westbury, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mindy Beth Nelkin, to Robert Elliot Schwartz of Oak Park, Ill., son of Robert L. Schwartz of Elk Grove. Ill., and Diane A. Schwartz of Evanston, Ill.

title: Deborah Ambrosini Affianced
description: Mrs. Armando J. Ambrosini of Snyder, N. Y., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Deborah Hope Ambrosini, to Nicholas C. Habes Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Habes of Rochester. The future bride is the daughter also of the late Mr. Ambro

title: Harvests From a Sunny Windowsill For the Apartment Farmers
description: WHILE their country cousins are planning their spring vegetable garden, apartment dwellers need not feel left out. They can be vegetable gardeners, too! All the plants need is good sunlight, a container, soil and a touch of tender loving care. Many new garden products make indoor gardening much simpler than it was a few years ago.

title: Monitors'Day in Court
description: THE sixthfloor corridor of the County Courthouse is like no other in the building. Filled with couples who have fought, children who are truants, a college student perhaps charged with paternity, they wait alone, tense and unhappy, or with lawyers until the are called into one of the chambers of Family Court.

title: Carter Aide Assails Water Projects
description: WASHINGTON, March 26 (AP)The new chairman of President Carter's Council on Environmental Quality sharply attacked many politically popular water projects today as blatant boondoggles that subsidize private interests at public expense.

title: Byrd Persuasive as Senate Chief
description: WASHINGTON, March 26It was 9:15 in the morning, two hours after he had arrived at his office just off the Senate floor, and Robert Carlyle Byrd, the new Senate majority leader, was worried.

title: Pooling Talents for Mental Health
description: BILLY, abused by a father who did not know how to handle the anger he felt toward his wife, stuttered and had severe learning problems. At the age of 10 he began seeing Dr. Gerard C. Bomse, a psychoanalyst and codirector of the Island Center for Mental Health in Plainview.

title: What's Doing in TORONTO
description: NEW IMAGEToronto, the economic capital of Canada as well as the capital of Ontario, the most populous province and the country's industrial heartland, was once characterized as a stodgy place, the butt of countless jokes (The city incites sinning because it is better to be in hell than in Toronto on Sunday). In recent years, this rapidly growing metropolis of 2.6 millionCanada's second largest urban concentration after Montrealhas acquired an international reputation as the country's liveliest city. The opening of the St. Lawrence Seaway, bringing ocean traffic to this Lake Ontario port, massive mineral discoveries and a tidal wave of immigrationevery second Torontonian is foreign borncontributed to the metamorphosis from a staid citadel of Victorian conservatism to a center of the arts, entertainment and sports, as well as a commercial hub. The skyline expresses the innovative spirit of today's Canada. Newer buildings like the twin structures of the City Hall and the 72story Bank of Montreal Buildingthe city's tallestas well as the towers of Royal Bank Plaza have facades of reflecting glass that mirror the surroundings and the passing scene, giving the impression of huge tapestries suspended in the air. Following the latest eruption of skyscrapers, the municipal administration reined in the developers with a regulation that requires special dispensation to erect a new building more than 45 feet tallabout five stories. Thus quiet residential sections, with gracious old homes along streets lined with venerable shade trees, survive in the heart of the inner city. The sound of the jackhammer is far from stilled in the city's six boroughs, each under a separate government, that make up metropolitan Toronto, called Metro. Nonetheless, the overall impression is of a green city that, in the words of Toronto social scholar Marshall McLuhan, is not yet devastated by progress. In the 14,349 acres of park land that dot the metropolitan area, signs say Please Walk ON the Grass. Art galleries and live theaters keep springing There

title: In the End, Mrs. Gandhi Neglected Her Beginnings
description: NEW DELHIThe old and illustrious Congress Party of India, which led the nation to independence and then dominated its public life for three decades, was shattered last week as its members, their numbers badly shrunken, took an unaccustomed place on the Opposition benches in the ornate, greencarpeted Parliament. Indira Gandhi, the master politician and inheritor of the Nehru family tradition, who only a few months ago had been widely regarded as the world's most powerful woman, suddenly was out of the Government, with not even a house to live in. What went wrong?

description: ASK a crosssection of American sports fans about speed skating, and the typical response probably would not extend much beyond Olympics or Sheila Young.

title: The Kubiaks of Montclair Always  World of Music
description: AT THE mere mention of music, strains of Chopin. Bach and Bartok are likely to resound through the Kubiak household in Montclair.

title: Yeshiva ,in N.C.A.A. Meet, Loses Fencer to Sabbath
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., March 26 (AP)When the Sabbath began at 5 P.M. yesterday, David B. Wankin's competition for New York's Yeshiva University in the National Collegiate fencing championships ended. Wankin, an Orthodox Jew, said his religious beliefs left him no option.

title: You've Never Seen Mimes Like This
description: The show begins. A giant blob of matter bounces and rolls around onstage. Pathetically, It tries to jump up onto a platform above. Very soon, this amorphous mass acquires a lovable personality through its frustrated attempts to scale the seemingly unscalable. Robert the Bruce would approve.

title: Arms Control, for a Change
description: President Carter wants actual reductions, for a change in the nuclear arsenals of the United States and Soviet Union, and his disarmingly simple phrase defines a most delicate moment in the history of superpower diplomacy. Without such reductions and more severe limits than any ever written into armscontrol agreements, we face another ominous round of weapons deployment. Neither side can gain security by running yet another lap in the arms race. But if it is pin, both sides will find it even harder to end the competition.

description: 1BILL KING

title: $chool Vote and the Children
description: THERE is a danger that when New Jersey voters go to the polls on Tuesday to vote in the school board elections, a number of nonvoters, the state's schoolchildren, could end up with the short end of the stick.

title: Heningham Fulton George Is Fiancee Of Davis Kennedy, Newspaper Official
description: Heningham Fulton George, a Congressional aide in Washington and greatgranddaughter of Tazewell Ellett, who served in Congress as a Democratic Representative from Richmond, plans to be married April 30 to Davis Lee Kennedy of Alexandria, Va., general manager of The Alexandria Port Packet, a bimonthly newspaper.

title: Millions Of Strange Shadows
description: Anthony Hecht's first book of poetry, A Summoning of Stones, was published in 1954, his second, The Hard Hours, in 1967. In the meantime he has been bringing fastidiousness to bear upon the problem of translation. In 1973 he published, with Helen Bacon, a translation of Aesohylus's Seven Against Thebes. Thirty new poems make his third collection, Millions of Strange Shadows.

description: 1. Vote on unemployment compensation bill, to extend the Emergency Unemployment Compensation Act of 1974, which passed, 327 to 63, March 21.

description: Giorgio Chinaglia, soccer's noblest Roman made a triumphant return to Rome last week, but his heart was in New Jersey, where he may soon become soccer's noblest American.

title: Miss Bentz Wins Billiards
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., March 26 (AP)Julie Bentz, a University of WisconsinMadison junior, won the women's division of the national intercollegiate billiards championship yesterday by defeating Nancy Wanger, a senior from Queens College in New York City, 5016 and 5032. In the men's division, an Arizona State University senior, William (Jay) Hungerford, beat a Marshall University senior, Jack Austin, 10028, for the title.

title: Dance: Miss Farrell in Bolero
description: A woman in a spotlighton a table. Gyrating with pelvic thrusts and coltlike tosses of a ponytail hairdo. She is surrounded by 38 men sitting on highbacked Spanish chairs. It is a Spanish ballet. Sort of. Sensuality is everywhere, weak sangria on melting ice. The music is Ravel. It had to be, it was Bolero.

title: Imaginative Needlework Creates a Myriad of Shapes

The items are among 500 needle pieces being shown at the 20th biennial exhibition of Amateur Needlework of Today.

title: Visitors Offer Prisoners a Friendly Ear
description: AFTER Olivia Hart had been in the Bedford Correctional Facility for Women for about two years, a volunteer visitor came to spend some time with her.

title: Palmer, Ace of Orioles, Says, I Don't Fit In Here
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., March 26 As far as this spring of their discontent is concerned, they will be remembered more for what they said than for their pitching: Tome Seaver, who criticized the Mets for the way they handled him and his contract dispute Iast spring; Luis Tiant, who fought with the Boston Red Sox until recently over an extension of his contract, and Jim Palmer, who is still fighting with the Baltimore Orioles over his contract.

description: IN AN UNUSUAL display of labormanagement harmony, the teachers at the Joel Barlow High School in Redding have agreed to return part of their recently won pay increase to help ease the embarrassment of their Board of Education.

title: The Fabians
description: Of the many socialist sects that sprang up in Britain in the 1880's, the most nebulous of all must have seemed the Fabian Society. It had been founded by Thomas Davidson, the illegitimate son of a Scottish shepherd, who became a puritan romantic philosopher, wandering and elusive. You met him, talked to him, were inspired by him, said one of his disciples, and the next day you found he had fled. He would turn up in Paris, Rome or New York, in Boston or among the Italian Alps, searching for new tufts and threads of metaphysics, taking something from everywhere to assimilate into his patchwork idealism. In other times he might have been looked on merely as an eccentric. Certainly his philosophical system was intensely personal and incapable of being dressed up objectively and imparted to others. But as the Evangelical religious movement in Britain disintegrated before the advance of Darwinism, there arose a great need for such prophets, dedicated to plain living and high thinking, from whom those who still had the habit of belief, without its substance, could recharge their hopes.

title: I have no regrets
description: Recently a friend remarked that all the fight must be out of me after four grueling years as Special Prosecutor. Not at all, I replied. The fight's still there because I still believe in the need for reform. Further, I believe the public maintains a high interest in reform of our institutions, particularly the criminaljustice system, by which I mean the police, the district attorneys and the courts.

title: How to Choose The Seat That's Right for You
description: The Wright Brothers didn't have the problem. Nor did Charles Lindbergh. But in this age of 300passenger airplanes, finding the right seat can be a bewildering, frustrating and ultimately overwhelming experience.

title: Winter's Damage Has Been Horrendous
description: JUST before winter punched back last weekend with a sudden, soggy snowstorm, spring's first crocuses and daffodills had popped their blossoms and stems above ground. A lonely robin or two had returned. And Mark and Martha Pokra's winter guestsa house full of ailing and undernourished ducks and geesehad been nursed back to health and returned to the wild.

title: Dams Are an Endangered Species
description: DENVERIn April 1973, environmentalists published Disasters In Water Development, an assessment of 13 public works projects that they considered among the most economically wasteful and environmentally destructive to be built with Federal money. One project mentioned was the Teton Dam in Idaho, then in the initial stages of construction by the Bureau of Reclamation. Another was the Sprewell Bluff Dam in Georgia, planned by the Army Corps of Engineers.

description: Japanese Scotch

title: A Navajo TeenA ger Testifies on Gunfight At a Trial in Dakota
description: FARGO, N.D., March 26 (AP)A Navajo Indian teenager has testified that in a gunfight on South Dakota's Pine Ridge Reservation, in which an Indian and two agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation were killed, he was told, It is time to be a warrior.

title: Paperbacks
description: A MAN CALLED INTREPID, by William Stevenson. (Ballantine, $2.25) A report on the operations of a shadowierthanlife British superspy in the U.S. before and during World War II.

Although there probably have been examples of New Jerseyans getting quick action from Trentonfor big campaign contributors, say, or a business tycoonthe average citizen can expect to cool his heels when he becomes enmeshed with his state government.

title: Joy Baker, a Recovered Alcoholic, Rejoins the Washington Scene
description: WASHINGTONIt is all my fault, Joy Baker remembers thinking.

Koch and Richard Ravitch, who has just resigned as chairman of New York State's Urban Development Corporation, are emerging as the most likely mayoral nominees of the Liberal Party if the party turns to a Democrat rather than to State Senator Roy M. Goodman, a Republican.

title: Letters: Putting Teeth In the Customs Laws
description: Regarding Nancy Beth Jackson's article, Customs Change Slowly (Travel Section, March 6), a patient of mine recently mentioned that he was planning a summer vacation in Spain and while there intended to have extensive dental work performed, since the cost was approximately a third of that in the United States.

description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., March 26 (AP)Edwin Moses and Harvey Glance, both United States Olympians, were the pacesetters in the University Division as the Florida Relays endede today.

description: Lawrence H. Friedman, postmaster of Teaneck, N.J., and Mrs. Friedman have announced the engagement of their daughter, Karen Sue Friedman, to Robert Glaser, son of Mr. and Mrs. Max Glaser of Sharon, Mass. The wedding is planned for Aug. 14.

title: How Alban Berg Committed The Perfect Crime
description: Suppose that Berlioz had never divulged the program to his Symphonie Fantastique. Suppose that a longlost score had been found, containing, in the composer's own hand, descriptions of all the hallucinatory visions inspired by his infatuation with the English actress Henrietta Smithson and so graphically portrayed by the music. Such a major musicological disclosure would reveal new dimensions of a masterpiece and drastically revise our view of the composer's life.

title: POLITICS
description: SOME of the candidates for Governor of New Jersey are beginning to resemble the man on the television commercials who offers to buy a pair of dirty sweat socks or a Tshirt from a woman in a Laundromat for $100 to prove that he has the better washing product.

title: Trouble in the Herd: People Problems on An Animal Safari
description: The night was rich with the childhood smell of burning leaves in Zambia's dry season as the tour bus left the hotel for Lusaka International Airport. I stood in the darkened stairwell, my Nikons packed away at last, facing the 15 American tourists I had escorted as wildlife photography instructor on a twoweek walking safari in Zambia's bush, from one tented camp to another, tracking elephant and rhino in the primeval Luangwa Valley. They were all there in the bus, the ones I affectionately thought of as the Independents, the Early Birds, Good Sport, Simpatico, and the ones less tenderly regarded as the Grumblers, Braggart, KnowItAll and Worrier. My voice quavered slightly as I made my farewell speech to the group.

title: Brief Encounter: Mama and Jogging
description: Jogging is always the hardest the first time. Just ask my mother.

description: TALLADEGA, Ala. (AP)Officials of the Alabama International Motor Speedway have announced awards totaling 5310,070 for its April 30May racing weekend.

title: UNICEF Helping to Solve World Shortages of Water
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., March 26The plastic cylinders resemble children's playthings, but Martin G. Beyer, a leading hydrogeologist, sees the canisters as one of the more effective yet simple tools developed in recent years for purifying drinking water in rural communities.

description: Penelope Fox and Robert S. Barnett Jr., both of New York, plan to be married June 25 in Darien, Conn., where their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Anderson Fox of Darien, parents of the bridetobe.

When people talk about him at the centers he operated in Roslyn, Syosset and Glenwood Landing, tears of sadness are sometimes evident.

Silver of Reisterstown, Md., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Debra Lynn Silver to David Carl Lustig 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lustig Jr. of Walden, N. Y. It has to do above all with the belief, once almost universal but now much discounted, that Industrialization would bring us long life, happiness, prosperity and all the other good things which we wish for ourselves and for one another.

J., became the bride of Christopher Montgomery Pope. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Wilmot T. Pope of Brookline and Manchester, Mass.

title: MiddleAged, Jobless, Despairing
description: ATLANTATwo years ago, I read an anguished article by a man describing what it was like for him to be jobless at 52 and unable to find work. I felt total sympathy. Back then, I was starting a book about angry middleaged men, drawing on my own and others experience of joblessness.

description: Paranoia buffs will have a field day with this latest thriller by Robert Ludlum, author of The Rhinemann Exchange and The Scarlatti Inheritance. For here Ludlum's premise is that J. Edgar Hoover didn't die a natural death but was skillfully done in by a group of highminded and highplaced intellectuals calling themselves Inver Brass, who see a monstrous threat to the country in the Number One GMan's unethical use of his scandalridden private files.

I am distressed by rumors that the match between Harry Reasoner and Barbara Walters is not working out and may soon he on the rocks. Neither Harry nor Barbara has yet come in for a consultation. unfortunately, for I believe that proper counseling can still Save their relationship and assure them of a long, happy and meaningful life of reading t he news together.

title: ART

One thing is certain: The Civil Aeronautics Board is bound to have its wings clipped.

Job's early work was praised by Alfred Stieglitz, and one can see why.

However, as a freelance writer for 17 years, I request equal time with that editor of the fiction magazine who offered us his/her selections from unsolicited manuscripts. I request, too, the same anonymity. What follows are excerpts from letters of rejection sent to me by editors of literary journals.

On that triangular chunk of land, a disparate collection of superrich matrons, freakedout kids, artists and Audubonists share the notion that the Grove is differenta place of refuge from the plastic world all about.

title: Beaverbrook Losses Growing, Endangering Two Key Papers
description: LONDON, March 26 (Reuters)Beaverbrook Newspapers yesterday reported growing losses, arousing fears about the future of its Daily Express and London Evening Standard.

title: INTERVIEW
description: AT THE age of 82, most people could be forgiven for having their eyes fixed firmly on the past and their bottoms affixed firmly to the seat of a comfortable rocking chair. Walter G. Clerk of North Amityville is different. He's looking to the future and running hard.

title: NO HEALTH BENEFITS SEEN IN SACCHARIN
description: The public outcry against the Food and Drug Administration's proposed ban on saccharin is not a result of any true medical need for the chemical among dieters or diabetics but of the power of the American sweet tooth.

title: Delacroix the Draftsman
description: ONE OF the biases we have perpetuated concerning the art of Eugene Delacroix is that he was a great colorist and less than a great draftsman. That he was one of the greatest colorists of the 19th century cannot be denied but that he was not an accomplished draftsman should be challenged. Although Delacroix's line does not yield the elegant fineness nor prepossessing authority of Ingres, with whom Delacroix has too often been compared, he nonetheless revealed a particular mastery and genius at drawing and printmaking.

title: What's College All About?
description: WHAT is college for anyway? In various ways we had been asking ourselves that question for four years. Now we were at once bored and frightened by the answers and with the alternatives. The real world was just outside the door.

title: Carey, in Takeoff, Is Off to See the Wizard
description: ALBANY, March 26 (AP)Just by following the yellowbrick road and obeying a benevolent Wizard of Grits, Governor Carey almost managed to solve all his problems tonight.

description: CONROE, Tex., March 26 (UPI)Pancho Gonzales and Hugh Stewart advanced today to tomorrow's final of the Almaden world invitation senior tennis championship. Stewart defeated Australia's Rex Hartwig, 62, 62, and Gonzales beat No. 2seeded Sven Davidson, 64, 62. In doubles, Torben Ulrich and Davidson defeated Beppe Merlo and Luis Ayala, 63, 62, and Hartwig and Gonzales defeated Vic Eeixas and Stewart, 62, 64.

title: Open Letter to Turquoise Erving
description: One need only watch your husband play basketball to understand his total involvement, his consummate skill and his feeling for the game. From the vantage point of a New York fan who has played and coached basketball, there seems to be one thing Julius Erving cares about more than basketball: money.

title: TUITION RISE CHECKED AT PUBLIC COLLEGES
description: The battle to hold the line on soaring tuition has apparently been won, at least for next fall, by the nation's public colleges, but most private ones will again be raising their tuition.

title: BUSING ISSUE TESTS LOS ANGELES MAYOR
description: LOS ANGELES, March 26With voting on his first bid for reelection less than two weeks away, Mayor Thomas Bradley of Los Angeles is conducting an aloof, politically conservative and wellfinanced campaign that appears to reflect his confidence that he will easily defeat 11 challengers.

title: DINING OUT
description: IN the Hamptons, where the pace of activity gathers speed as the season approaches, the Sugarplum marches to a steadier beat. It remains open all year, catering to a regular clientele in the winter when the alternatives dwindle to a precious few. As of Memorial Day, there will be a couple of changes: the schedule will increase to seven days a week from five and bluefish will doubtless replace flounder as the fish of the day. Otherwise, in these whitewalled, darktimbered rooms the dining is dependably satisfactory.

title: Shortchanging Our Future
description: LAST YEAR, the state created the Commission on Connecticut's Future, which was charged with studying the future of the state, and by implication at least, policies that could help achieve the best future in the uncertain years ahead. In this context best means capturing opportunities and avoiding pitfalls. In other words, the commission was conceived to help discern the range of possibilities for the state so that government could become a little less haphazard and crises a little less frequent. The failure of the state legislature to support its prestigious commission with funding, staff, supplies, offices, or even a statement of expectations can cause a promising and forwardthinking activity to die aborning.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: FILM VIEW
description: As you're watching Greta Garbo in Camille does it ever occur to you to wonder how old the character is supposed to be? I doubt What age was Humphrey Bogart's Harry Morgan in To Have and Have Not? I havent any idea. If pressed I would say that in my mind Bogart went through his entire film career, which covered more than a quarter of a century, aging from a vague 30 to an equally vague 40. Until his last few films Clark Gable always represented a man who was in his midthirties. For a brief period in Hollywood history, time, though never completely stopped, was contained as much by the kind of movies these great actors appeared in as by their faces and personalities.

description: CLEVELAND, March 26Everyone thought John Naber would do it, and he did.

title: Vegetable Plantings Surveyed
description: WASHINGTON, March 26 (UPI)A survey by the Agriculture Department indicates that farmers may plan 1.63 million acres of vegetables for processing this year, down only slightly from last year's 1.64 million acres. The survey also shows intentions to increase plantings of vegetables for freezing by 8 per cent while plantings for canners may go down 3 percent, officials said.

title: Lynbrook, Bethpage Gain Girls'
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., March 26Lynbrook defeated Herricks, 4440, and Bethpage down Baldwin, 5044, today in the Nassau scholastic girls' basketball tournament semifinals at Bethpage High School. The winners will meet for the championship Tuesday night at Wantagh High.

title: INTERVIEW
description: NINA G. GARSOIAN, a distinguished scholar of ancient history at Columbia University, will soon shift most of her energies to the contemporary problems and challenges of being Dean of the Graduate School at Princeton University.

title: INTERVIEW
description: RALPH NADER, the consumer advocate, does not approve America, but his father a of many things produced inproves of several things produced in this country and one of them is Ralph Nader.

title: Elderly in Bronx Monitor The YouthOffender Cases
description: A group of elderly Bronx residents, convinced that youths charged with violent attacks on old people are getting lenient treatment in the city's courts, has organized a casewatch in Bronx courtrooms to determine whether any corrective measures can be taken in the criminaljustice system.

title: After the Last Waltz, The Band Plays On
description: Snow had been failing since early afternoon, and as midnight approached the countryside around Woodstock was quiet. Inside RCO, a huge, rambling barnlike structure which houses a recording studio, rehearsal hall, and bedrooms and sleeping lofts for resident rock musicians, the loudest sound was the sputtering of a fireplace. Levon Helm, the bearded, Arkansasborn drummer for the Band and a principal energizer behind RCOthe initials derive from ouR COmpany, he explains with a laughsat behind his drum set swigging from a bottle of brandy, watching with his small, bright hawk's eyes as a group of musicians filtered back in from a rehearsal break.

title: THOMAS B. GRAHAM, 60, PATENTLAW ATTORNEY
description: Thomas G. Graham, a partner in the law firm of Graham & Geoffrey who had specialized in patents, copyrights and trademarks for 30 years, died Friday of cancer at the White Plains Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 15 Circle Road, Scarsdale. N.Y.

title: Game, Set, Match
description: Tennis clothes this season are classic and comfortable. Separates are being emphasized both by designers who create tennis clothes as a sideline and by the sportswear specialists. Tops are loose and blousy, perfectly comfortable when one stretches for the farthest ball. Traditional white is back in favor, or white with only a touch of color, like sober brown or navy. The newest look of all is creamy offwhite, which hasn't been in fashion on the courts since the 30's. Fabrics are cottons or cotton blends. Nononsense warmups come in white or sweatshirt gray. Add some simple accessoriesa sweat band, a crew hat, a pair of sturdy sneakers and the game is on!

title: Indian Sovereignty Is Reborn in U.S.
description: It was in 1532 that Francisco de Victoria, a theologian who helped lay the foundations of modern international law, persuaded the king of Spain that land claims in the New World would not be legally and morally perfected without the consent of the resident sovereigns, the Indians.

title: Veteran Benefits Rule Opposed
description: CINCINNATI, March 26 (AP)Officials of the Disabled American Veterans have told the Department of Health Education and Welfare that the organization opposes inclusion of veterans' pensions and disability compensation in the department's jurisdiction.

title: West German Soccer
description: First Division

title: DINING OUT
description: YOU MAY HAVE a little trouble finding Chez Pierre the first time, if you're not a Westport habitu, but there'll be a second time, we're sure, and by then it'll be easy. If you get the impression we liked the place, you're right.

title: Veterans' Dividends Will Be Paid Early
description: WASHINGTON, March 27 (AP)The Veterans Administration is speeding up payment of insurance dividends to veterans to give the national economy a $180 million lift.

title: Life with father in China
description: In a swift disclaimer that appears on the last page of this novel the narrator says, without realizing it, throughout my childhood I was being educated in cruelty. I had been a voyeur of atrocity. . . . This, after 400 pages of hideous brutality which he calmly observed from the yamen (headquarters) of the French consulate in the remote city of Chengtu. His father, the consul, was a practitioner of the wheedling and threatening style that characterized the diplomacy of the foreign missions in the convulsed China of the 1920's. Apart from the standard servant and brothel episodes, the narrator says little about himself; his subject is China in general, and his father in particular. It is a record of considerable arrogance, vanity, selfdeception and almost unbelievable barbarism.

title: THEATER
description: GEORGE M! the new offering at An Evening Dinner Theater, Elmsford, N.Y., strikes me as better and brighter than the Broadway production nine years ago. I think the reason in part is that the book, which seemed too lightweight for the solidity of a Broadway theater, fits in just fine with the nearnightclub atmosphere of the dinner theater. Furthermore, the dinner theater can only take minimal sets, and in this case that too is an aid to a book that is more an outline of George M. Cohan's life than anything else. All of what can look like skimpiness with the wrong show at a dinner theater turns into valuable plusses this time.

title: DINING OUT
description: YOU MAY HAVE a little trouble finding Chez Pierre the first time, if you're not a Westport habitu, but there'll be a second time, we're sure, and by then it'll be easy. If you get the impression we liked the place, you're right.

title: Home Style
description: For the homeowner, spring usually means cleaning up the ravages of winter. And that can mean an encounter with the Terrible Williamsons, a clan of some 2,000 gyp artists who concentrate on homeowners.

title: Anne Sears Affianced to William C. Bennett 3d
description: Dr. Marvin L. Sears of New Haven and Mrs. Stuart Low of Darien, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Anne Bret Sears, to William Cletus Bennett 3d., son of Mr. Bennett Jr. of Chevy Chase, Md., and Mrs. Clinton Connolly Kemp of Bethesda, Md. Plans have been made for a wedding on June 19 in New Haven.

title: Springtime: Sounds From
description: WITH the first warm spring breezes, set a course to peaceful anchorages, offshore fishing grounds, or simply to nowhere and back. There is no surer way to ease the memories of winter's arctic cold than by getting an early start on summer. So roll back the tarpaulin and push up your sleeves.

title: Marquette Goes From MidCourt to Final
description: ATLANTA, March 26Three seconds before Jerome Whitehead's lastsecond basket today put Marquette into Monday night's championship game of the National College Athletic Association basketball tournament, Al McGuire was instructing his players during a timeout. But the coach was holding his huddle at halfcourt.

title: Rollers Can Simplify Many Painting Problems
description: Although paint rollers are almost universally used for painting walls and ceilings these days, doityourself painters often do not use them properlywhich means they are not getting as good a job as they shouldand many still do not realize that there are a number of different sizes and styles available which enable them to use rollers for many other jobs besides that of painting walls and ceilings.

title: Preseason Baseball
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Soviet and U.S. Win Twice In Wrestling
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, March 26 (AP)The defending champion Soviet Union and the United States were tied with 4 points apiece tonight after the first, two rounds of the 1977 World Cup of amateur freestyle wrestling.

title: Red Sox Drop Petrocelli
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla., March 26 (AP)Rico Petrocelli, who set an American League record for shortstops by hitting 40 home runs in 1969, was released by the Boston Red Sox today after 12 years with the club. The 33yearold Petrocelli was placed on irrevocable waivers with a reported $100.000ayear salary.

title: Shelter Island Area A Cruising Pleasure
description: For the last two years, I've had fun helping Halloween Yacht Club members in my home port of Stamford, Conn., lay out their annual club cruise. Last summer they went through Plum Gut to sail the area between the forks of Long Island, and had a marvelous time.

title: DR. RICHARD P. ADAMS, 59; AUTHORITY ON FAULKNER
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 26Dr. Richard P. Adams, professor and chairman of the English department at Tulane University, died here yesterday after a sixweek illness. He was 59 years old.

title: The Politicians Ponder the Stakes
description: THERE is a conviction gaining headway among officials in the state, including the Governor and the members of the Gaming Commission, that Connecticut may already have gone too deeply into legalized gambling.

title: Carla Zerfuss Betrothed
description: Fran M. Zerfuss, of Long Beach, L.I., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Carla Belle Zerfuss, to Jeffrey Alan Nager, an account executive with CBS Apparel. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Nager of Great Neck, L.I. The bridetobe, daughter also of the late Harold Zerfuss, and her fianc whose father is a vice president of Drexel, Burnham & Lambert, investment bankers, plan to be married in September.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Saturday, March 26. 71st day. Weather clear, track fast.

title: Questions/Answers
description: SALT DAMAGE

title: To These Collectors, Westchester Is Mining Country
description: YOU could call it the big rock event of the year in Westchester. After all, it's not every day the stones play Eastchester. But this event is no concert. It is really a very downtoearth affair at the Greenvale School today between 10 A.M. and 4 P.M.

title: Meadowlands Results
description: FIRST$9,500, pace, mile

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: A Westport Student States His View

title: Leading Prague Dissident Protests Lack of Support By Western Communists
description: VIENNA, March 26A leading member of the Czechoslovak human rights movewent complained in a telephone interview this week that Communist parties in Western Europe had failed so far to respond to a monthold for support.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Today  New York Region, Sports Car Club of America Spring racing preseason meeting for drivers and workers at Dragon Seed Restaurant, 9511 37th Avenue, Jackson Heights, Queens, 1 P.M.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: PROPERLY INSTALLED, goodquality gutters and downspouts should last for many years with little or no maintenance, except for occasional cleaning. However, the past winter's heavy accumulations of snow and ice in this area coupled with the fact that hi many cases gutters tend to get clogged with leaves and other debris, make it advisable for the prudent homeowner to inspect his gutters as soon as possible to see if cleaning and/or repairing is necessary.

title: Great bargains of Bordeaux
description: If you are giving a dinner party and wish to impress, by all means serve Chateau HautBrion. It is one of the most famous wines in the world. And one of the most expensive.

title: The Bowling Clinic
description: There being so many segments to the delivery of a bowling ball, it is rather difficultpossibly unfairto zero in on any aspect as being critical. There is one area, however, that too often is ignored, and some emphasis should be put on it.

title: Peru, Short of Farmland, Is Hoping To Find a Solution in Inca Terraces
description: MACHU PICCHU. PeruEven on a clear day it is impossible to make out the outlines of this lost Inca city when standing at the foot of the mountain that holds it several thousand feet above the boiling waters of the Urubamba River.

title: Horse Shows
description: AT NORTH SALEM, N.Y.

title: U.S. IS URGED TO RETURN HUNGARY'S ANCIENT CROWN
description: WASHINGTON, March 26The Carter Administration, under pressure from a group in Congress led by Representatives Charles A. Vanik, Democrat of Ohio, has begun studying ways to extend nondiscriminatory trade status to Hungary and to return the country's ancient Crown of St. Stephen.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Of Special Interest

title: Our Mims Wins at Oaklawn; Cauthen's Mount Runs Third
description: HOT SPRINGS. Ark., March 26 (AP) Calumet Farms, Our Mims caught the frontrunning Sweet Alliance in the middle of the stretch and scored a neck victory in the $139,850 Fantasy Stakes today at Oaklawn Park. Sweet Alliance was second, and Meteor Dancer, ridden by the country's leading jockey, Steve Cauthen, was third.

title: GARDENING
description: THE neighborhood is a credit to suburban Long Island. The attractive houses are well cared for and the spacious lawns well landscaped and manicured. Yet one property on the street stands out among the others. The evergreen planting is an unusual blend of colors, textures and forms with just a touch of contrasting brilliance from a redleafed weeping Japanese maple.

title: An issue that won't go away
description: Cyril Burt, the father of educational psychology and the first psychologist to be knighted, died in 1971 at the age of 88. His view that intelligence was largely predetermined at birth helped shape the rigid British school system that divides the children into tracks based on an T.Q. test given at the age of 11. Five years after his death, in an event compared with the disclosure that the Piltdown Man was a hoax, Burt was exposed as a falsifier of data.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: I WANT to be the first to announce that spring has come to Suburbia. Never mind the absence of flowers, preseason bathing suit sales, and Little League tryouts. A sure sign of spring is the arrival of the solicitor for lawn care, who promises to arrange a perfect lawn at less than I now pay for seed and fertilizer.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Fear Rules Rhodesian Blacks
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia  After an evening of barbecued venison and beer, followed by a noisy game of darts, the white soldiers turned in for the night. Outside, black guards patrolled the perimeter of the keep, a fenced compound set deep in the bushland of the southwest. Rhodesia's newest war zone.

title: The Mystery: of the Vanishing Light
description: LONG VALLEY For more than 50 years, a mystery has hovered over a lonely stretch of railroad track in this rural Morris County community. From time to time, a passerby traveling after dark encounters a strange ball of light dancing above the tracks. The light seems to pulsate, to change shape. Then it disappears.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ART

title: Swimmers Visit Pope Paul
description: VATICAN CITY, March 26 (AP)Pope Paul VI held an audience today for swimmers competing in the Latin Cup championships in Rome and told them to profit from their experience in sports. The Pope said such competition offered the opportunity for selfdenial, persistence, efforts to better oneself and respect for one's competitors.

title: Lunger Hopes to Bolster Confidence at Long Beach
description: Brett Lunger, an American race car driver, has a score to settle in the Long Beach (Calif.) Grand Prix next Sunday. His beef isn't with any individual: it's with the 2:02mile, 12turn circuit over which the Formula One cars will howl through the streets of downtown Long Beach. Last year, Lunger, who was driving for the John Surtees team, found the track very difficult and he couldn't get the necessary speed to earn a starting spot. It was a blow to my confidence, to say the least, said Lunger.

title: U.N. Water Conference Adjourns in Argentina Without Major Decisions
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 26The United Nations water conference after having surveyed global water problems has concluded its sessions without adopting significapt new remedies.

title: Busing Divides E. Brunswick
description: RESIDENTS of East Brunswick will be keeping a tense eye on the schoolboard balloting Tuesday to see if the candidates elected are those who would overturn a recently adopted school redistricting plan that has divided the township for the last few months.

title: Notre Dame Fencers Take N. C. A. A. Title
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., March 26 (AP)Mike Sullivan and Pat Gerard, individual title winners, triumphed in their specialties in a tiebreaking fenceoff today that gave Notre Dame the National Collegiate Athletic Association fencing championship. The host Irish were tied with New York University, the defending champion, 114114, at the end of regular competition.

title: Ghost Riders
description: THE MUSIC BUSINESSS, for Bethel's Claire Lane, is a term with several shades of meaning. At one time, she made records. Now, she sells them.

title: Introduction
description: At the age of 74, Jaya Prakash Narayan is one of the few remaining heroes of the Indian nationalist movement. He played a leading role m the civil  disobedience campaign against British rule, reached the highest levels of the Congress Party on the eve of independence, and was viewed by Jawaharlal Nehru in 1948 as the future Prime Minister of India. The spell of Mahatma Gandhi's teachings drew him away from active poli tics in 1954. But whatever he said and did continued to have political impact. In the minds of the people, J. P. remained a man to turn to in a time of national crisis.

title: STAMPS
description: For the sport it marks no special occasion, but for the millions who take part in it it is indeed a special occasiona philatelic tribute to their sport. The sport is golf, one of the most popular of all American sports, and the tribute is a commemorative stamped envelope being issued on April 7 during the Masters Golf Tournament at the Augusta National Golf Club, Augusta, Ga.

title: An Answer To Con Edison
description: THE thing to remember about Westchester's drive to remove Con Edison as the principal source of power for the county is that the effort is not motivated by any desire to get Con Edison or punish Charles Luce, the company's chairman. It's a matter of selfinterest, pure and simple.

title: A Special Number For Women Only
description: MANY women don't avail themselves of the opportunities for which they are eligible, said Patricia Q. Sheehan, Commissioner of the state's Department of Community Affairs.

title: New Courses for Old Schools
description: JASPER McLEVY had always been a thrifty Mayor. He used to say about snow removal, God put it there, let God remove it. But in the 24th arid final year of his incumbency, he got the grandiose idea of building a new Bridgeport Town Hall 13 stories high at a cost of $1 million per story.

title: CAMERA VIEW
description: The techniques used in making photographic portraits has changed in many ways since the early days of photography. Instead of posing subjects solemnly in awkward postures, today's photographers strive for a more casual rendition of features. character and personality while still attempting to add something that will flatter that person at least slightly by revealing whatever beauty, strength and character the subject possesses.

title: Bearne Finds A New Issue In Fiscal Crisis
description: Only a couple weeks ago, Mayor Beame was in the throes of a wrenching controversy over future outside control of New York City finances, an issue thrust upon him because of his strategy of trying to sell a municipal bond in the public credit market this year. The major commercial banks, which would act as middlemen in such a sale, insisted on an extremely stringent control mechanisni as the means to rekindle investor confidence and permit the city to reenter those markets for the first time since early 1975.

title: JOSEPH P. TUMULTY JR., EXWASHINGTON LAWYER
description: Joseph P. Tumulty Jr., a retired Washington lawyer, whose father, Joseph P. Sr., was secretary to President Woodrow Wilson, died Friday at the University of Pennsylvania Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 71 years old and lived at Ashwood Farm in Olney, Md.

title: TRIAL LAWYERS SCORE UNNEEDED SURGERY
description: Condemning as knife happy surgeons who perform 2.38 million unnecessary operations a year throughout the country, officials of a lawyer's association proposed yesterday that New York State require a hospital's chief of surgery or a special board of surgery to certify each nonemergency operation as necessary.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: A Footnote or Two On TermPaper Mills

title: A Reform Era For Antitrust
