description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)The House assassinations committee said today that it was investigating whether James Earl Ray collected a bounty from businessmen or other persons for killing the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Mr. Ray has been quoted as saying he intended to collect a bounty for the murder.

title: Taxes and Accounting A Change of Heart on New York City Audit
description: When last we left John C. (Sandy) Burton, New York's jovial Deputy Mayor for Finance, he was taking issue publicly with a political icon of sorts: Arthur Levitt, the State Comptroller, who isn't entirely accustomed to being contradicted in public.

title: Radio
description: 67 AM, WNCN. Coriolanus Overture, Beethoven; Two Minuets, Puccini; Divertimento in G minor (K.15), Mozart; ScherzoTarantella, Wieniawski; Trio for 2 Violins and Cello, Haydn; Sonata for Trumpet and Strings, Torelli.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Five subway passengers were robbed yesterday by four armed men on a Manhattanbound ?? train that was crossing the Williamsburg Bridge. The gunmen boarded the train about 1 P.M. at the Marcy Avenue station, the last Brooklyn stop before the bridge, and fled at Essex Street, the first station in Manhattan. No one was injured. The only rider who went to the police said he was robbed of $20 and a watch.

title: Memorial Services
description: KLEINERTPatricia Zollnor, of Greenwich in Orloans Convalescent and Retirement Center, Orloans, Mass. March 16, 1977. Wife of Harry Kleinert. Memorial service at the Stanwich Congregational Church. 237 Taconic Road. Greenwich, Conn., Sunday. April 3rd at 4 P.M. There will be an opportunity to meet with Mr. Kielnert after the service.

title: C. S. SHAUGHNESSY SR., 80, FORMER MACY'S OFFICER
description: Charles S. Shaughnessy Sr., who retired in 1972 as president of Drexel Enterprises and who was a former vice president of R. H. Macy & Company, died, Friday in Worcester, Mass.

title: Pornography Zoning Is Delayed as Compromise Fails
description: The Board of Estimate, wracked by dissension and unable to agree on a compromise antipornography zoning measure, voted last night to put the matter over for future consideration.

title: List of Dead and Survivors on Pan American Plane
description: Following is a list of passengers on the Pan American Boeing 747 airliner who were killed in the Canary Islands crash, as provided Monday to The Associated Press by Pan American officials:

title: Music to Travel by Under the Streets of Paris
description: PARIS, March 28Musicjazz, folk, classicalwent officially underground last week, and crowds of Paris subway riders delighted in the happy cacophony as the muted roar of the trains provided background for the sounds of singers, guitarists, violinists, clarinetists, drummers and accordionists.

title: Hart Schaffner Net Up 17% in Quarter; 15 New Stores Set
description: Hart Schaffner & Marx, a leading apparel manufacturer and retailer, yesterday reported a 17 percent gain in net income for the first quarter ended Feb. 28.

title: Reading Tests for 700,000 Pupils Put Off Because of Fear of Cheating
description: A citywide reading test scheduled to be given today to 700,000 New York City pupils in Grades 2 through 9 was indefinitely postponed yesterday by Chancellor Irving Anker and was haled also by a temporary restraining order signed by a State Supreme Court justice.

title: Insurance Aides Expect Awards In Jets' Crash to Reach New High
description: The collision of the two 747 jumbo jets will costinsurers more than any previous air disaster and is expected to lead to a vigorous legal struggle as claimants seek to push aside limits on liability net by international agreements.

title: Federal Scientists Will Assess Potential Hazards of DNA Studies
description: BETHESDA, Md., March 28Scientists at the National Institutes of Health said today that they would begin experiments. probably in June, to assess the risks of the controversial genetics research known popularly as gene splicing.

title: Housing Policy In a New Light
description: TRENTON, March 28Innercity dwellers who may have thought that the Mount Laurel zoning decision of two years ago would pave the way for them to move into the suburbs had their hopes dashed by the New Jersey Supreme Court last week. The state's highest court ruled in a case involving two Bergen County communities, Washington Township and Demarest, that bedroom towns in New Jersey were under no obligation to provide space for apartment houses for lowincome families.

title: Dance: Phoebe Neville Company
description: Dance, one would have perhaps naively thought, was the art of movement, or at the very least an art of movement. An art in which bodies moved through time and spacenormally to musicin an expressive and cohesive fashion that sometimes told a story and at other times merely expressed a mood, a feeling, even just a sense of balance

title: U.S: Charges 8 With a Plot to Loot Bankrupt Companies in New York
description: Two businessmen and six associates have been indicted in Manhattan and Newark on Federal charges involving alleged schemes to defraud the creditors and deplete the assets of several bankrupt companies.

title: Marquette Beats N Carolina, Wing Title for McGuire, 6759
description: ATLANTA, March 28Al McGuire went out of basketball tonight as the champion.

title: Paul Cardinal Is Dead at 73; Headed HoffmanLa Roche Unit
description: Paul J. Cardinal, a retired vice president of HoffmanLa Roche Inc., died yesterday in Naples, Fla., at the age of 73. He had retired in 1963 as vice president in charge of the bulkvitamin division of the pharmaceutical concern.

title: Going out
description: GASLIGHT Remember George Raft as Steve Brodiejumping off the Brooklyn Bridge, with crowds lining the East River's banks to watch? In the seldomrevived The Bowery (1933), costarring Wallace Beery, Fay Wray and Jackie Cooper, this raffishly pictorial yarn sacrifices fact for color

title: Consumer Group's 13City Survey Calls Some Bank Ads Misleading
description: Some advertising by commercial banks and savings institutions is deliberately uninformative and sometimes misleading, according to a survey of advertisements published in newspapers in 13 cities, including, New York, conducted by a California consumer organization.

title: BRONX DRUG PROGRAM UNDER INVESTIGATION
description: The Hispanic Association for a DrugFree Society, a Bronx addiction rehabilitation program known as S.E.R.A. that receives over $3.2 million a year in Federal, state and city grants, is being investigated by a Federal grand jury for wideranging abuses of poverty funds, according to law enforcement officials.

title: Deprogrammer Gets Jail Term
description: DENVER, March 28 (AP)A religious deprogrammer, Ted Patrick was sentenced to nearly five months in jail and fined $1,000 today for violating probation.

title: Judge to Decide if Women Can Sue On Synthetic EstrogenCancer Tie
description: DETROIT, March 28A group of drug companies was accused here today of failing to test the safety of a synthetic estrogen taken by as many as two million pregnant women and caused cancer in some of the daughters born to them and precancerous conditions in others.

title: Topics
description: There is no neat way out of the political and, bureaucratic morass that surrounds the hospitals of New York City. They are organized to do too much and too little; they are governed through a maze of arrangements from above and under constant pressure from often desperate patients and employees below.

title: U.S. and Cubans Discussed Links In Talks in 1975
description: WASHINGTON, March 28The United States and Cuba conducted highlevel talks on establishing normal relations from late 1974 until late 1975, covering the entire range of issues between the two countries, Administration officials said today.

title: TV Ads Are Called Danger to Children
description: A New York State Assembly staff report charged yesterday that television commercials were hazardous to the physical and educational health of young children and presented a disturbing public health problem. The report urged enactment of state and Federal legislation that would control the amount of advertising permitted on children's programming and regulate the content of commercials with regard to the portrayal of eating habits and nutritional claims.

title: GEORGE G. BOGERT, 92; AUTHORITY ON TRUSTS
description: George G. Bogert, dean of Cornell Law School from 1921 to 1925, died yesterday in Winter Park, Fla. He was 92 years old. After leaving Cornell, Mr. Bogert taught law at the University of Chicago until 1949 and at Hastings College of Law in San Francisco until 1959.

title: Wheat and Corn Futures Decline As Rains End Drought in Midwest
description: Heavy weekend rains broke the drought over the Midwest grain and soybean belts, sending wheat and corn futures trumbling yesterday. However, soybeans advanced in expectation of bullish export figures.

title: Elliott Jacoby, Led the Orchestra On Rudy Vallee Hour, 193241
description: Elliott Jacoby, conductor of the orchestra on the Rudy Vallee Hour on radio from 1932 to 1941, died yesterday at his home, 18 Tower Lane, New Haven. He was 75 years old.

title: Theater: Endgame in a Desert
description: Something is taking its course, says Clov, quizzically, in Endgame. Like the spring on Clov's alarm clock, the characters will reflexively repeat their movements. Will this never finish? cries Hamm, and then echoes Richardr III, My kingdom for a nightman. The Samuel Beckett play is a long, unceasing twilight.

title: U.S. Agrees to Transfer Of Used Atomic Fuels From Japan to Britain
description: TOKYO, March 28 (UPI)The United States has agreed to a resumption of Japan's transfer of used nuclear fuel to Britain for reprocessing, the Japan Atomic Power Company reported today.

title: Concert: Czech State Orchestra
description: The Czech Philharmonic cancelled its American tour, and in its place has come the Czech State Orchestra, which was heard last night in Carnegie Hall. This orchestra was founded 15 years ago to replace the Czech Radio, Orchestra. Jiri Belohlavek conducted a program of Smetana, Ravel and Dvorak.

title: Los Angeles Debates the Necessity for a Central Library
description: LOS ANGELESWhen this city was in its youth, meaning 50 years ago, it built itself a fine new library, right in the center of town like the libraries of most cities, and every bit intended to be the West Coast equivalent of the monumental public libraries of New York and Boston. Unlike New York and Boston, however, as Los Angeles grew it sprawled, and now its library, a 51yearold masterpiece by the architect Bertram Goodhue, sits aging in the business district of a 474squaremile city, far away from the bulk of the population it serves.

title: Britain's Curbs On Pay Shaken By Union Deals
description: LONDON, March 28A labor union leader rocked Britain's delicately balanced Pay Code today with his announcement that he had negotiated very substantial percentage increases for 30,000 members of his union.

title: Ethiopia Accused on Human Rights
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (Reuters)Amnesty International today accused Ethiopia of widespread violations of human rights and called for urgent international action to improve the situation. The Londonbased rights organization said in a report issued here that Ethiopia was guilty of largescale torture of political prisoners, secret killings of detainees and arbitrary arrests.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Widens To Record $1.87 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, March 28With foreign countries supplying nearly half of the nation's oil requirements and oil itself accounting for more than a quarter of total imports, the United States registered a record trade deficit last month of $1.87 billion, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Readjustment Program Is Set Up To Aid Released Mental Patients
description: TRENTON, March 28Former mental patients returning to the community will be provided with volunteer companions to help them find shelter and adjust to noninstitutional living, under the terms of a new program begun today by the State Department of Human Services.

title: Prison Terms in Armed Felonies Voted by State Senate in Albany
description: ALBANY, March 28The State Senate voted overwhelmingly today to require prison sentences for anyone convicted of using or displaying a gun while committing a felony.

title: Music: Mastery
description: Mstislav Rostropovich celebrated his 50th birthday in style Sunday night, making his New York conducting debut with the National Symphony Orchestra at Carnegie Hall, taking the solo part in Haydn's Cello Concerto in C and appearing at a gala birthday supper afterward at the St. Regis Hotel.

title: CARTER AUTHORIZES PENTAGON TO REVIEW 432,000 DISCHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, March 28President Carter has authorized the review and possible upgrading of the otherthanhonorable discharges of about 432,000 Vietnam war servicemen, the Defense Department announced today.

title: North Stars Gain in Bid For a Playoff Spot, 54
description: BLOOMINGTON. Minn., March 28 (AP)Alex Pirus and Glen Sharpley, both rookies, scored 49 seconds apart in the final minute of the second period to rally the Minnesota North Stars to a 54 victory over the St. Louis Blues at the Met Center tonight.

title: BRONX DRUG PROGRAM UNDER INVESTIGATION
description: The Hispanic Association for a DrugFree Society, a Bronx addiction rehabilitation program known as S.E.R.A. that receives over $3.2 million a year in Federal, state and city grants, is being investigated by a Federal grand jury for wideranging abuses of poverty funds, according to law enforcement officials.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, March 28In response to mounting protests against motorboat noise on New Jersey's lakes and rivers, the State Department of Environmental Protection proposed today regulations that would limit the noise level of all boats except those participating in approved racing events,

title: Natural History Museum Charged With Race Discrimination in Jobs
description: A complaint against the American Museum of Natural History alleging race discrimination in employment against blacks and those of Hispanic origin was issued yesterday by the New York City Commission on Human Rights.

title: N.C.A.A. Basketball
description: CHAMPIONSHIP GAME

title: The U.N. Today
description: March 29, 1977

title: Summary of Actions by the U.S. Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, March 28The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Willis M. Kimball, 74, Director Of Information for Gas Company
description: William M. Kimball, who was the director of information for the Columbia Gas Systems for 12 years, died Sunday at a nursing home in Sharon, Conn. He was 74 years old.

title: Public Broadcasting Serves as Incubator for Commercial Networks
description: On a typical evening, the audience for commercial television is to the audience for public television as New York City is to Sioux Falls, S.D.about 30 times larger.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: Yankees'Box Score
description: EFuentes, Randolph. DPYankees, Detroit 1. LOBYankees 8, Detroit 13. HRChambliss, White. SHealy.

title: Lacrosse
description: COACHES POLL

title: Israel's Delegate to U.N. Says All P.L.O. Factions Deny Its Right to Exist
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 28Israel declared in the Security Council today that it was a delusion to believe there were moderate factions in the Palestine Liberation Organization prepared for coexistence with Israel.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT ST. LOUIS

title: Books of The Times
description: THE GOLDEN EGG. The Personal Income Tax: Where It Came From, How It Grew. By Gerald Carson. 315 pages. Illustrated. $10.

title: Reed Finds a Crew of Applicants to Be His Assistant
description: Willis Reed sat in the Knick office yesterday, a stack of letters and applications for the team's assistant coaching job piled before him. There is either a lot of interest in the job, said Reed, who will reolace Red Holzman as Knick coach next season, or a lot of guys are looking for a job. Reed and Eddie Donovan, the general manager, have received more than 100 applications, well over the normal amount an assistant coaching job would attract. The applicants have been from the pro, college and high school ranks, and from almost every part of the country.

title: All Yank Games Count to Steinbrenner
description: TAMPA, Fla. March 28The motivating force on the Yankees eightgame swing through the western coast of Florida is not silly Martin or Reggie Jackson or Thurman Munson but George M. Steinbrenner, the team's princinal owner.

title: Roosevelt
description: ENTRIES

title: 7Run Rally by Dodgers Sinks Mets
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., March 28Hardly a day passes without another problem for the New York Mets' manager, Joe Frazier. Yesterday it was his infield that collapsed and gave the Atlanta Braves a victory. Today it was one of his secondline pitchers, along with his No. 1 relief pitcher, Skip Lockwood. The result was a 98 victory for the Los Angeles Dodgers, despite ninthinning home runs by Bruce Boisclair and Dave Kingman.

title: From Russia, With Love, a FairyTale Career
description: Move over, Lauren Hutton and Margaux Hemingway. There's a new face ready to be the image of a cosmetics line. It's the classicly beautiful face of Victoria Fyodorova, the young Russian actress whose reunion with her longlost American father, two years ago, read like the plot of a soap opera.

title: Civil Court Judge in Manhattan Censured for Abuse of Authority
description: Judge William Mertens of Manhattan Civil Court was severely censured yesterday by the State Supreme Court's Appellate Division for serious breaches of judicial temperament and decorum.

title: CBSTV Is Moving Two Groups To Headquarters in Los Angeles
description: The move from New York to Los Angeles of CBSTV's program and business news headquarters was announced yesterday.

title: Rumanian Building Design Criticized
description: BUCHAREST. Rumania, March 28 (AP) President Nicolae Ceausescu charged today that grave shortcomings and violations of design norms led to the collapse of new housing and public buildings in the March 4 earthquake. In a speech to a joint meeting of the Communist Party's Central Committee, the Parliament and the Council for Social and Economic Development, the Rumanian leader called for strict measures to improve planning and construction. He said the earthquake had killed 1,570 in Bucharest and injured more than 11,300.

title: Met Rugby
description: WEEKEND RESULTS

title: Not So Cunning
description: President Carter must have been flabbergasted when the Soviet Communists handed him the humanrights championship of the world without a struggle. One can only guess that the commissars have gone groggy in the brain lobes under the merciless batterings of Politburo prose to which they regularly submit, for they did not seem to realize that the contest counted for anything.

title: Carter's Voter Registration Plan Would Reform an Older Reform
description: WASHINGTON, March 28President Carter's proposal to eliminate advance registration as a prerequisite to voting in Federal elections demonstrates how one century's reform movement can become a reformer's target in the next.

title: $2 Billion in Arms Reportedly Approved For Sale by Carter
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)Administration sources said tonight that President Carter had approved $2 billion in military construction and arms sales, primarily for North Atlantic Treaty Organization allies.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON,March 28 (AP)Continued funding for the B1 bomber program barely survived a vote in the House Budget Committee today as the panel approved a resolution slashing $2.3 billion from President Carter's proposed Defense Department budget for the 1978 fiscal year.

title: Japanese Intervention
description: In New York, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company reported that Japanese foreign exchange market intervention to moderate the yen's rise in the first two months this year totaled about $200 million.

title: U.S. Dumping Is Feared
description: LONDON, March 28 (Reuters)The gold price drop today reflected fears that the United States might dump the metal on the market, bullion dealers said.

title: DEATH TOLL MOUNTS TO 577 IN COLLISION OF 747'S IN CANARIES
description: SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE, Spain, March 28With the airport here still littered with the charred remains of the two jetliners that collided on the runway yesterday in dense fog, the death toll rose today to 577, and investigators sought to determine how the crash had occurred.

title: Buchbinder Performs Schubert
description: For understandable reasons, the argument that certain keyboard masterworks are generally the domain of older pianists is not especially popular among younger pianists. Rudolf Buchbinder, a young pianist born in Czechoslovakia and trained in Vienna, opened his recital Sunday night at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. with just such a masterworkSchubert's Sonata in B flat (Op. Posth). And the result was just the sort of playing that keeps the argument plausible.

title: Events/Sports
description: 2:55 P.M., WKCR: Baseball, Fordham at Columbia.

title: Carolina Blacks Learn a Dialect  Their Own
description: BEAUFORT, S.C., March 19The late Fats Waller, the legendary jazz pianist, is reported to have once observed, One never knows, do one?

title: Deaths
description: ALBERTFannie. The Women's Campaign for the U.J.A. Fegeration Joint Campaign records with deep sorrow the passing of Fannie Alpert, a long time member of our Manhattan Organization's Board, and beloved mother of Rena Cohen, an esteemed past chairman of the Women's Campaign. We extend our heartfelt condolences to the family.

title: Ashley May Head House Energy Unit
description: WASHINGTON, March 28Representative Thomas L. Ashley, a liberal Democrat from Toledo, Ohio, is expected to be named chairman of a special committee to coordinate House action on President Carter's forthcoming legislation on energy.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, MARCH 29, 1977

title: In Memoriam
description: AVILANDFred B. Ho left without oven saying goodbye on March 29, 1932. A good friend who has been deeply missed.

title: Little Change Seen in Rates Today For Treasury Notes and Bell Issue
description: The credit markets made a few lastminute maneuvers yesterday as they got ready to handle the three key new issues of the week today$2 billion of fiveyear Treasury notes, $250 million of Bell Systern debentures and $120 million of California bonds. The three issues will provide the major tests of the Government, corporate and taxexempt sectors of the fixedincome markets this week, and they are not expected to produce any pronounced changes from recent interest rate levels.

title: The Cast
description: UNCLE VANYA, a filmed recording of the 1963 Chichester Festival theater production directed by Laurence Olivier; directed for the screen by Stuart Burge; written by Anton Chekhov and translated by Constance Garnett; a British Home Entertainment production, distributed by Arthur Cantor Productions. Running time: 120 Minutes, At the Thalia Theater, 95th, Street west of Broadway. This film has not been rated.

title: SIDNEY W. THAXTER
description: FALMOUTH, Me., March 28  Sidney W. Thaxter, a Portland lawyer and brother of Phyllis Thaxter, the actress, died in his home here last night after a long illness. He was 62 years old.

title: Artificial Turf Sells Fast
description: MINNEAPOLIS, March 28 (AP)The artificial turf at the University of Minnesota's Memorial Field went like the proverbial hotcakes today. Onethird of the field was sold out by noon. The university was recouping on its investment by selling 3by20foot strips for $15 each. The field will be replaced with natural turf.

title: Linguist Seeking to Legitimize Gullah Language
description: The world's foremost authority on Gullahits Doctor Johnson, if you will is neither black nor a product of the Carolina coastal delta where this melodious, lilting language is spoken.

title: Fed Opens Meetings Under Sunshine Act
description: WASHINGTON. March 28 (Reuters) The Federal Reserve Board this morning opened its ornate brass doors to the general public for the first time under the Sunshine Act of 1976, which requires Government agencies to open many of their proceedings to public scrutiny.

title: High Court to Hear Arguments on Ban Of a Nuclear Fuel
description: WASHINGTON. March 23 (AP)The Supreme Court agreed today to review a lower court's ruling barring the Nuclear Regulatory Commission from considering industry applications for use of a controversial type of nuclear fuel.

title: Olefsky, Cellist, Offers a Tribute To Piatigorsky
description: If Paul Olefsky's cello recital in Alice Tully Hall Sunday night seemed slanted toward the kind of repertory Gregor Piatigorsky used to play, the intention was deliberate. In a sense the concert was dedicated to the late cellist, who had been one of Mr. Olefsky's techers.

title: Indian Government Says Its Most Urgent Task Is to Restore Liberties
description: NEW DELHI, March 28The new Indian Government, in its first detailed policy statement, promised today that it would immediately begin reversing the authoritarian course that Prime Minister Indira Gandhi had set for the country in the last year and a half.

title: The Standings
description: LAST NIGHTS GAME

title: Reporters With Vance Resist Soviet Curbs
description: MOSCOW, March 28The Foreign Ministry, for reasons not completely clear, insisted today that only seven American reporters would be admitted to the opening of the talks in the Kremlin. The first few minutes are usually open to the press.

title: Age of Universe Now Estimated as 20 Billion Years
description: Scientists at the University of Chicago have determined that the universe may be as much as 20 billion years old, considerably older than most current estimates.

title: Maryland Gets No. 1 Rating In Lacrosse
description: Cornell, the 1976 national lacrosse champion, was ranked No 2 yesterday for the second time in a row in the weekly coaches poll.

title: Sunshine Law Opens Closed Door
description: An attempt by the New York City Board of estimate to hold an executive session on its pornographyzoning issue, with reporters barred from attending, was brought to a halt after a reporter from The New York Times refused to leave the room on the ground that such sessions were illegal under the state's new Sunshine Law.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: British Football
description: By The Associated Press

title: GOLD PRICE FALLS $4 TO CLOSE AT $149.70
description: LONDON, March 28 (AP) The price of gold dropped nearly $4 an ounce here today to close at $149.70 an ounce after hitting an 18month high last Friday of $153.62. On Europe's foreignexchange markets, meanwhile, trading was described as quiet, with the dollar easing against most major currencies.

title: R. H. Stearns in Chapter XI Move
description: BOSTON, March 28 (UPI)The R. H. Stearns Company, which has six stores in Massachusetts, including a 130yearold department store in downtown Boston, today petitioned a Federal court for reorganization under Chapter XI of the bankruptcy laws. It listed assets of $6 million and liabilities of $5.8 million, according to a clerk in the bankruptcy division of the Federal District Court.

title: CARTER HAS NO PLAN TO SCOLD GEN. BROWN
description: WASHINGTON, March 28President Carter declined today to address himself to controversial remarks by Gen. George S. Brown, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who described Congress as irresponsible and said that in certain circumstances the Government had a right to read mail of private citizens.

title: At Lagerfeld's Paris Show, the 18th Century Goes Modern
description: PARIS, March 28What do you make of a designer who puts fur borders on chiffon dresses, lace appliqus on wool suits and cavalier hats on models in knee pants or britches?

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Monday, Marth 2?? 1977

title: LEBANON ARMY HEAD APPOINTED BY SARKIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, March 28President Elias Sarkis, overruling opposition from rightwing Christian leaders, named a new commander for the divided Lebanese Army today.

title: Jets Gain in Court
description: The legal maneuvering between the Jets and the city continued yesterday with a gain by the football team, which is seeking to have the case tried in what it believes is the more neutral surrounding of a Federal court.

title: Advertising
description: For the last two weekends Toyota dealers across the nation have been staging Toyotathonssales promotions intended to make consumers think something exciting and different was happening when it really wasn't.

title: G.A.O. INQUIRY FINDS WHITE COLLAR CRIME EVADES ENFORCING
description: One of the Government's most effective weapons in combating organized and white collar crime has been almost ignored by the Federal agencies charged with enforcing it, a team of investigators from the General Accounting Office has alleged. As a result, their report indicates, Mafia figures, narcotics dealers, gambling bigwigs and couriers carrying corporate payoffs can ferry money in and out of the country with impunity, knowing that even if they are detected, they face the prospect of no more than a slap on the wrist.

title: Weiss & Geller Wins Champale Account
description: Weiss & Geller has landed the Champale Iroquois Brands account that has been at Richard K. Manoff, Inc.

title: D. S. GARDINER, ANNOUNCER ON RADIO NEWS PROGRAMS
description: Donald S. Gardiner, for many years anchorman on the Sunday evening radio news programs for the American Broadcasting Company, died Sunday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in Quogue, L.I. He was 61 years old.

title: FRANCE WILL REORGANIZE GOVERNMENT UNDER BARRE
description: PARIS, March 28 (UPI)Prime Minister Raymond Barre formally resigned today but President Valry Giscard d'Estaing said he would ask Mr. Barre to form a new government.

title: Andrei D. Sakharov, on This Frightful Situation
description: MOSCOWIn the article published in The New York Times [OpEd page, Feb. 23] Sergei Gusev, Deputy Prosecutor General of the Soviet Union, stated the official position of the Soviet Union's repressive organs in regard to me personally and, indirectly, to other dissidents, and he strove in particular to emphasize the independence of this position from interference of Western protectors.

title: Market Place
description: The shares of the American Motors Corporation sprang to life yesterday as traders speculated that the Carter Administration's energy conservation plans might benefit the troubled No. 4 auto maker.

title: 27 Residents of California Retirement Community Thought Dead
description: LOS ANGELES, March 28It is quiet every day in Leisure World, an affluent retirement community 60 miles south of Los Angeles.

title: Tennis
description: AT CONROE, TEX.

title: Kansai Electric Co. Terminates A.D.R. Agreement With Citibank
description: The Kansai Electric Company, a Japanese electric utility, said that it had exercised its right to terminate its agreement for American depository receipts with Citibank effective April 30. After that date, individuals will no longer be able to transfer Kansai A.D.R.'s in the United States.

title: Meadowlands Results
description: Time2:03 3/5 ScratchedDon't Ask Me.

title: Visit by Podgorny Divides Africans
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, March 28The trip of President Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union has sharpened rivalries among contending Rhodesian black leaders, leading to a war of words that threatens once again to divide Africa.

title: VANCE AND BREZHNEV OPEN MOSCOW TALKS
description: MOSCOW, March 28Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance was confronted today by criticism of President Carter's hiiman rights policies and by a reserved attitude toward his arms  reduction proposals as the United States and the Soviet Union began highlevel talks.

title: Wife of Bolles, Slain Reporter, Says Others Profit by His Name
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., March 28 (AP)Rosalie Bolles, the widow of Don Bolles, the slain Arizona Republic reporter, said today that she was tired of her late husband's name being used by a lot of people to further their own endeavors or to give credibility to their work.

title: Contradictions Veiling Crash
description: Critical unknowns, confusion and contradictions faced investigators yesterday as they set out to reconstruct the events that led to the collision of two jumbo jets on a Canary Islands runway. There seemed to be good prospects that the cause of the catastrophe would emerge from electronic recording devices interviews with crew memhers and other survivors from the Par American World Airways plane, and interrogation of traffic controllers.

title: Dr. John J. Morton, 90; Led Surgery Department At Rochester University
description: Dr. John J. Morton, who established the surgery department at the University of Rochester School of Medicine in 1924 and led it until his retirement in 1953, died Thursday in a Rochester nursing home. He was 90 years old.

title: Laos Says Its Former King Is Being ReEducated
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, March 28The former King of Laos, 69yearold Savang Vatthana, is growing vegetables and learning the rudiments of MarxismLeninism in the remote mountains of northeast Laos. according to Government officials here.

title: MONROE BANK TAKEN OVER AFTER CONNECTICUT ACTS
description: WASHINGTON, March 28 (AP)The troubled Monroe Bank and Trust Company of Monroe, Conn., was closed today and its 3,460 accounts transferred to the North American Bank and Trust Company of Wolcott, Conn., the Federal DeposInsurance Corporation announced.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Film: Vanya Taken From Stage
description: The Uncle Vanya now in its New York premiere engagement at the Thalia Theater is a noteworthy movie cur??c??ity. It's the filmed recording of the production staged in 1963 at the Chichester (England) Festival by Laurence Olivier with a cast that included Michel Redgrave (Vanya), Joan Plowright (Sonya), Rosemary Harris (Illyena), Max Adrian (the Professor) and Mr. Olivier (Astroy)

title: Great Western to Try To Upset TakeOver Laws
description: The Great Western United Corporation of Denver said that it would sue to upset state laws that seek to enforce socalled takeover statutes in connection with its bid for the Sunshine Mining Company.

title: ENERGY GROUP BACKED FOR NEW YORK STATE
description: A step toward the formation of a New York State Alliance to Save Energy was taken yesterday at a meeting of Senators Jacob K. Javits and Daniel Patrick Moynihen with business and governmental officials.

title: Cathy Rush Quits Immaculata Five
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 28 (AP)Cathy Rush, who won three ntaional titles during her seven years as Immaculate College women's basketball coach, announced her resignation today.

title: STEEL OUTPUT CLIMBED 2.6 MILLION TONS IN WEEK
description: Steel production continued its upward climb for the seventh consecutive week in the week ended March 26, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. As a result, the week's output of 2.6 million tons was the highest for any week this year and ran 3.5 percent higher than in the preceding week when 2.5 million tons were poured.

title: Thailand Says Five Rebel Leaders Will Stand Trial
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, March 28A leading figure in Thailand's ruling military junta said today that the five leaders of the abortive coup last Saturday would stand trial in a military court. The charges, according to other military officials, could include treason, which under the martial law now in force carries the death penalty.

title: Dave Anderson
description: ATLANTA, March 28Bigtime college basketball is not pure. It is not innocent. Its players are hired hands. As on any assembly line, the quicker the hands the better. But bigtime college basketball is fun. And most of all, it's enthusiasm. In the moments before Al McGuire's last hurrah tonight, Marquette's 6759 victory for the National College Athletic Association championship, the bands were playing and the cheerleaders were jumping and the students were yelling and the players were clapping in the huddles near each bench. All the players. Bigtime college basketball players are not that cool that they can't clap their hands. And perhaps that's the beauty of bigtime college sports. That's what the pros can't quite match. And in time, that's why the pendulum could swing back to bigtime college sports. With all that big money in pro sports now, economics has created egonomics. Especially in the team sports such as baseball, basketball, football and hockey. In team sports, one player is seldom that much more important than several others and yet that one player may be making much more money. In the pros, money is the root of all ego. But in bigtime college sports, players cannot renegotiate a grantinaid. Without the same economics, the same egonomics do not exist.

title: Beame Proposes the Use Of $150 Million U.S. Aid For 150 Service Projects
description: The Beame administration proposed yesterday that more than 150 programs and projectscovering a wide number of community improvements and services be financed with the $150 million that New York City expects to receive later this year under the Federal communitydevelopment program.

title: Al McGuire, Thinking Back, Can't Suppress the Tears
description: ATLANTA, March 28When the final buzzer assured Marquette's 6759 victory tonight for the basketball championship of the National Collegiate Athletic Association, Al McGuire remained sitting on the orange chair from which he had almost toppled backward during the first half. The coach sat there for several moments

title: Manager Hospitalized By Player's Punches
description: ORLANDO, Fla., March 28 (AP)Lenny Randle, frustrated and angered after. losing his regular secondbase position to a rookie, sent the Texas, Rangers' manager, Frank Lucchesi, to the hospital today after hitting him three times.

title: Pornography Zoning Is Delayed as Compromise Fails
description: The Board of Estimate, wracked by dissension and unable to agree on a compromise antipornography zoning measure, voted last night to put the matter over for future consideration.

title: 90% HOTEL INTEREST IS SOUGHT BY BALLY
description: The Bally Manufacturing Company of Chicago, a large manufacturer of slot machines, has agreed to acquire a 90 percent interest in the MarlboroughBlenheim Hotel in Atlantic City for which a casino is planned, pending approval by the New Jersey. Legislature for gambling in Atlantic City. The project is to cost more than $50 million and be equipped with Bally coinoperated game machines, according to W. T. O'Donnell, president of Bally.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMSCharles Clark, age 71, of 287A Heritage Village, Southbury. ConnBeloved husband of Helen (nee Brown) Adams and father of John F. Adams of Long Beach, Calif. and Henry C. Adams of Stamford, Conn., seven grandchildren. Memorial services Friday. 2 P.M., First Congregational Church, Main St., Woodbury. Conn1 Private burial Forest Hills Cemetery, Boston, Mass. Omit flowers, contribute American Cancer Society.

title: Roundball and Pregnant Flamingos
description: MIAMI, March 29The beauty and chivalry of livery stable society were on display in the Hialeah paddock, looking on as the field for the Flamingto Stakes paraded and uttering small, animal sounds of admiration whenever Seattle Slew walked by. They spoke knowingly of the colt's dark, intelligent head, the sinewy forearm and straight pasterns, the deer chest and the long muscle that seems to flow from hip to.back. John Galbreath, who owns Darby Dan Farm and the Pittsburgh Pirates and is on Hialeah's board of directors, was listening so attentively to a tall young man that it was obvious the tall young man was imparting more than ordinary wisdom. The temptation to eavesdrop was irresistible. And then, the young man was saying, Butch Lee fired an inbounds pass the length of the floor to this kid Whitehead. who dunked one just at the buzzer, so Marquette goes into the final round. The young man was Digger Phelps, roundball coach at Notre Dame. Through the early races, when others were at the mutuel windows trying to make two and two equal $28.60, he had been off somewhere in front of a television set watching the semifinals of the National Collegiate Athletic Association championships from Atlanta.

title: RESPONSE FAVORABLE IN SALE OF NEW ISSUES
description: The United States Treasury, the Bell System and the State of California sold large new issues of notes and bonds yesterday in financing that tested the three major sectors of the credit markets Governments, corporates and taxexempts.

title: M.J. Musser, V.A. ExMedical Chief
description: WASHINGTON, March 29Dr. Marc J. Musser Jr., chief medical director of the Veterans Administration from 1970 to 1974, died today at the Veterans Administration Hospital here after a long illness. He was 66 years old.

title: Paris: One of the Best Living Painters
description: PARIS

title: Article 4  No Title
description: IT would be far easier to extricate a lure from the mouth of a game fish than eradicate the sights and flavors of certain dishes from my mind. These would include the first taste of charlotte russe as a child; a breakfast of that utterly delectable fish listed on menus in Hawaii as mahimahi; a first platter of couscous with its mutton and vegetable stew one longago supper in Morocco: the spaghettilike baby angulas or eels served sizzling from the stove in a bath of olive oil and garlic and hot pepper.

title: Payments Admitted By Ogilvy & Mather
description: WASHIGTON, March 29Ogilvy & Mather International Inc., the highly regarded advertising agency,has found some unwanted creativity in its business office. The company admitted making some $789,000 in questionable or unrecorded overseas payments since 1969 and took a sizable loss when it invested slushfund money in its own stock

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An 18yearold high school student was shot to death as a result of an argument during a lunchtime basketball game on the playground opposite Grover Cleveland High School in Queens, according to the police.

title: It's Circus Time Again
description: WELL, IT'S BACK AGAIN, all those flying bodies and twirling torsos, animals standing up like people and people hanging by toes and teeth like some exotic species with no feet on the ground at all.

title: ZeroBased Stupidity
description: WASHINGTON, March 29Even giving birth to children on purpose is going out of style in this country, there are still enough kids around who need to be protected from communicable diseases, but vaccination seems to be going out of style, too.

title: Scientists View Rubber Source In Desert Bush
description: WASHINGTON, March 29An unprepossessing little shrub that thrives in deserts and is a distant relative of the sunflower could and should become major domestic source of natural rubber for this country, the National Academy of Sciences said today.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: About 6,000 New Jersey supermarket clerks who did not work during the recent Philadelphiaarea meatcutters strike have been made eligible for unemployment compensation benefit's. Acting Commissioner John C. Horn of the State DepartMerit of Labor and Industry said the clerks had been locked out of Pantry Pride; A.&P. and Acme stores and would be allowed to apply for benefits for the term of the threeweek strike.

title: Carter Aides Concede to Senators That $50 Tax Rebate Is in Trouble
description: WASHINGTON, March 29High officials of the Carter Administration privately expressed fear today that the $50 tax rebate proposal was in jeopardy in the Senate because of both ideological differences and political resentments.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Yesterday was active in the data processing industry as the International Business Machines Corporation announced price cuts in its small computer systems products and the Control Data Corporation introduced two new computers, one of which it described as being in the class of the world's largest commercially available equipment.

title: United to Babcock: Say I Do Fast
description: These days, the giant corporations make loveor warwith words. Typically their wordsmiths are an elite of the securities bar, a corps of legal specialists skilled in using the securities laws to facilitate, or fend off, one corporation's overtures for another's shares.

title: Job Fight Is Down to Precious Few
description: ST.PETERSBURG, Fla., March 29With the baseball season only one week away, the scramble for jobs was growing urgent in Florida's training camps todayfrom the Texas Rangers base, where Lenny Randle threw some punches at Manager Frank Lucchesi, to the New York Mets base, where 10 players were fighting for the final three openings.

title: Times Names Assistant Controller
description: Frank R. Gatti has been named assistant corporate controller of The New York Times Company, effective April 1. Presently director of financial reporting. Mr. Gatti, 30 years old, came to The Times in 1974 from the accounting firm of Haskins & Sells.

title: Notes on People
description: THE SECRETARY of Health, Education and Welfare, Joseph A. Califano Jr., yesterday named Robert. A. Derzon, a career hospital administrator, to oversee the Carter Administration's campaign to cut fraud and abuse and limit healthcare costs. Mr. Derzon will head the new Health Care Financing Administration in H.E.W. Now 46 years old, he has been a hospital administrator 22 years, having started with the Rhode Island Hospital in Providence and having most recently been director of hospitals and clinics for the University of California at San Francisco. He has also been as sociate administrator of. University Hospital in New York and a first deputy commissioner of hospitals in the city.

title: Crime Victims Bureau May Be Victim of Lack of Funds
description: A brightblue button affixed to the blotter on Lorna Renner's desk in the Manhattan Criminal Court Building bears a simple message that tells why she has been working at a job she fears will have no future.

title: Slugger to Be Fined $500 a Day
description: DUNEDIN, Fla., March 29Graig Nettles, the Yankees starting third baseman and last year's American League home run champion, left the team suddenly and without explanation this morning,

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT BLOOMINGTON, MINN.

title: Woolco Opens 5 Stores in Suffolk
description: In an unusual plunge into a single market, the Woolco discountstore division of the F. W. Woolworth Company is opening five stores simultaneously this morning in Suffolk County, New York, in properties vacated by the deunct W. T. Grant Company.

title: Opera: A New Musetta
description: Josephine Barstow, an English soprano, made her Metropolitan Opera debut Monday night as Musetta in Puccini's La Boheme. She appeared with a strong cast that included Ileana Cotrubas as Mimi, Jose Carreras as Rodolfo, Ingvar Wixell as Marcell. Justino Diaz as Colline and Allan Monk as Schaunard, all of whom assumed their roles earlier this season. James Levin conducted.

title: Senate Delays to 79 Imposition of Its Curb On Outside Earnings
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (UPI)Thei Senate voted today to wait an extra year, until the start of 1979, to impose a $8,625 yearly limit on outside earningsthe most controversial feature of its prospective ethics code.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: THERE ARE very few dishes that inspire as much controversy as those that combine meat or poultry with fruits. In a recent article in this.. newspaper, Marcia Davenport, the author, placed herself solidly in the league of naysayers, stoutly and eloquently defending her notion that, there is a place for all things and the place for fruits and/or berries is at the end of a meal or at the beginning of breakfast.

title: About Education
description: Most public schools have never been quite sure what to do with gifted children. They are often ignored, sometimes acknowledged and once in a while given the advantage of special programs designed to nurture their ability.

title: Packing It In: Make It Light
description: Dishes unacceptable at home can he delicacies after a grueling day on the trail. Take those light, freezedried dinners that require only boiling waterbeef stroganoff, chili with beans, beef stew. shrimp creole, lasagna with meatballs, or chicken chop suey.

title: Housing Speculation Heats Soaring California Market
description: LOS ANGELES, March 29Southern California's sizzling realestate market has produced a new kind of commodities speculator who deals in new homes. Investment syndicates are buying homes as fast as they are built in some communities and selling them a year or so later at prices that often double their money.

title: . . . Dyed Oysters
description: In his sometimes solemn, sometimes hilarious, book Between Meals, published some 15 years ago by Simon & Schuster, A. J. Liebling, the great journalist and fin bec, properly proposed that eating by the rich restaurants, as well as at home, is highly subjective.

title: LOCKHEED CHIEF COUNSEL IS ORDERED TO TESTIFY
description: WASHINGTON, March 29John H. Martin, chief counsel of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, was ordered today to respond to questions from the Securities and Exchange Commission about his role in the company's alleged foreign payoffs.

title: Rider Banned Since 74, Claims Foul Treatment
description: Sandino Hernandez can't answer his 4yearold son's question, Daddy, why can't I have that bicycle?

title: SUPREME COURTCURBS STATES WEIGHT RULES
description: WASHINGTON, March 29The Su preme Court ruled today that states may not override certain Federal rood labeling requirements under which foods are sometimes permitted to weigh less than their labels say they weigh.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 30, 1977

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: Right at the outset, Martin Panzer of East End Avenue wants it known that he has nothing against taxi drivers. Most of my education is the result of discussions with cabbies. What I enjoy most is having a taxi driver teach me new things with his head turned, toward me as he drives through traffic by the grace of instinct.

title: REORGANIZATION PLAN PASSES HOUSE, 39522
description: WASHINGTON. March 29The House voted today to give President Carter the authority he sought to reorganize the executive branch of the Federal Government. but only after an unexpectedly spirited constitutional debate.

title: Rich Eat Low on The Hog
description: TRUMAN CAPOTE has come forth to say that the rich have a wonderful way with fresh vegetablescooking them to just the right degree of underdoneness. Diana Vreeland, with her customary flourish, has publicly hailed this view as a stunning piece of social observation. But much as I respect these great authorities. I must demur. It has long been my impression that the rich, while they may eat well enough (at least they don't starve), do not necessarily eat too wisely. Why, for instance, has gout always been known as the rich man's ailment?

title: Ecologists Stall Bonn's Atom Power Plans
description: BONN, Barch. 29A surge of popular support for ecology groups in West Germany has brought Chancellor Helmut Schmidt's nuclearpower program to standstill, raised the threat of an energy crisis by 1985 and left the country's political parties wondering how they could lose touch with the voters barely six months after a national election.

title: Dinner at 6? A Long Night Ahead
description: When I was growing up in Flushing every evening at 5:30 or 6 I ate a meal called supper. The content varied, but not the form. The cry supper's on the table, coming from half dozen mothers standing in half a dozen back doors, was the evensong of Roosevelt Avenue, summoning about 18 children to meals set on a half a dozen formica kitchenette sets. These early suppers left us endless nightsalmost a second whole day, or so it seemed to a child caught in the throes of the play ethic. In summer, we could be out again by 7, planning complicated lightning bug hunts.

title: In Memoriam
description: BESOINESophia. Passed away on March 30, 1970. Another year has flown by and it is seven Years since you left us. Your memory Is dear and we all REMEMBER MAMA. Dad. Henry, Jerome, Rita and Marcia.

title: Califano Style Encounters NoFrills Milieu
description: WASHINGTON. March 29  Back during his middleclass Brooklyn boyhood. Joseph Anthony Califano Jr. probably never dreamed that some day he would have his own cook, on the public payroll or otherwise.

title: Around the Nation
description: HOUSTON, March 29 (AP)The City Council voted today to abolish Houston's official position of women's advocate despite an allnight protest rally in support of continuing the job.

title: Suffolk Officials Wish Sex Film Case Would Go Away
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., March 29While I Mayor Beame is trying to prosecute pornography in New York City, Suffolk County prosecutors are laboring over an obscenity case they wish would just no away.

title: Music: Innovative Scores Marred by Theatricality
description: IT WAS A LITTLE HARD to tell Monday night, at the American Place Theater, whether the angels of creativity or the demons of eccentricity were on the loose. What was going on was the first of three evenings of innovative theater music presented by the American Composers Alliance and sponsored by two public and two private foundations.

title: Liability Questions Complex
description: The apportioning of blame for the crash, according to aviation lawyers, could determine the payment of several hundred million dollars in insurance claims.

title: Bridge:
description: Interruptions of play by announcements are a constant source of irritation to tournament players. Intense declarers attempting to make three notrump where God has only created two have been known to go berserk when their concentration is shattered by a staccato microphone announcement about a lost fur coat or a found fur dog.

title: Fidrych Hurts Left Knee, Exam Is Scheduled Today
description: LAKELAND, Fla., March 29 (AP)Mark (The Bird) Fidrych, ace pitcher of the Detroit Tigers, was scheduled to be examined tomorrow at Ford Hospital in Detroit for possible cartilage damage in his left knee. The injury hadn't appeared serious until an examination today in Lakeland. Dr. Glen Barden reported Fidrych had experienced severe disturbing symptoms in the knee.

title: DUTCH ADMIT TOWER HAD NOT AUTHORIZED KLM JET TO TAKE OFF
description: SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE, Canary Islands, March 29A Dutch official conceded tonight that a KLM Royal Dutch Airlines jetliner had not been cleared for takeoff Sunday when it roared down the runway here in dense fog and crashed into a Pan American World Airways jet.

title: Penney Raises Dividend
description: The J. C. Penney Company, the departpartment store and catalogue chain, announced an increase in its regullar quarterly dividend on its common stock to 37 cents from 32 cents, payable May 1 to holders of record April 11. The new indicated annual rate is $1.48.

title: Cancellation of the Mandated Test On Reading Confuses Many Pupils
description: There were 24 extra No. 2 pencils ready for use yesterday in Class 3209 at Public School 28 in Upper Manhattan. But the specially sharpened pencils went unused. and in a auditorium that would have been empty on a special testing day, second graders were meeting in a regular Tuesday assembly at 9:27 A.M.

title: The U. N. Today
description: March 30, 1977

title: Cambodia Again Spurns U.S. Overture for Relations
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 29Cambodia, following a recent American request for a renewal of contact, has reiterated vigorously its unconditional rejection of any relationship with the United States.

title: DISSIDENT TEAMSTER EXPELLED IN DETROIT
description: The only dissident to speak up against the leadership of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters at the teamsters convention last June has been thrown out of the union.

title: ExChampion International Aide Held in $1 Million Embezzlement
description: A former attorney for the the Champion International Corporation was arrested Manhattan yesterday on a charge of embezzling more than $1 million by falsifying claims against the forest products company.

title: Careers
description: Three policemen, Lieut. John McDonnell, Detective Jack Des Gaines and former Police Officer Richard L. Arroyo, range in age from 23 to 54, but they currently have one aimdesire for a job in private industry with reasonably good pay. In today's labor market in New York they are having a tough time, the reason they go from time to time to the job referral desk at Police Headquarters.

title: World News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, March 29Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia interrupted a twoweek vacation in South Africa today for a meeting withPrime Minister John B. Vorster of South Africa, who is acting as an intermediary between the Rhodesian and British governments on moves for a transfer of power to Rhodesia's 6.3 million blacks.

title: Advertising
description: In the laborintensive agency business management discussions frequently turn to the subject of peoplethe finding, feeding and nurturing thereof. Why, sometimes they even talk about training them, but more often of stealing them.

title: TV: It's Instant Stardom for 3 Girls 3
description: 3 GIRLS 3 is the rather uninspired title of a new NBC mini series that gets oil to an absolutely smashing start this evening at 9. Swiping several major cues from Broadway's A Chorus Line and a British television series called Rock Follies, the variety format takes three women unknown to the massive primetime audience. surrounds them with seasoned production talent, and thrusts them, whole and dazzling, into instant stardom. This is easily the freshest, liveliest and most exciting premiere of a series that television has concocted in years.

title: Another Fighter Named Sharkey (Remember?) Moves Up Ladder
description: Bill Sharkey of Howard Beach, Queens, does not look like a fighter. He has long, dark. curly hair and a walrus mustache. He has been a hairdresser, welder and mason, but the rewards did not suit him.

title: Kennedy Inquiry Witness Is an Apparent Suicide In a Mansion in Florida
description: PALM BEACH, Fla. Wednesday, March 30 (UPI)A language professor described as intimately involved with Lee Harvey Oswald and a crucial witness in the Congressional investigation of President Kennedy's assasnation was found dead yesterday, an apparent suicide.

title: Government Weighs A Proposal to Make Food Stamps Free
description: WASHINGTON, March 29Secretary of Agriculture Bob Bergland said today that the Carter Administration was considering a proposal to eliminate cash purchase requirements for food stamps.

title: Marcos Seeks to Ease Fears Over a Pact With Rebels
description: MANILA, March 29President Ferdinand E. Marcos souught today to dissipate the worries of Christians in the southern Philippines over the concessions he announced over the weekend to rebellious Moslemi in the area.

title: JAPANESE EXTENDING NATIONAL SEA LIMITS
description: TOKYO, March 29The Japanese Government, long a staunch opponent of unilateral extensions of national fishing and territorial boundaries farther into the oceans, announced today that it would expand its own territorial limits to 12 nautical miles.

title: State's High Court Won't Switch New York Bar Exam This Year
description: ALBANY, March 29 (AP)The state's highest court, the Court of Appeals, striving to end speculation, has announced that there will be no change in New York's bar examination this year.

title: Dance: Accent's on Wit
description: Ze'eva Cohen is not only a splendid dancer but also an enterprising patron of contemporary choreographers with a broad repertory of dances, half of which she has commissioned herself. Among these is the late James Waring's 32 Variations in C Minor, which received a loving performance Monday evening at the American Theater Laboratory.

title: Wine Talk
description: Here we go again. The first prices for the regularas opposed to the nouveau'beaujolais of the 1976 vintage are in. Some of them are going to cost as much as $6 and $7 a bottle. Soon after the harvest last fall It was evident that prices would be high for the 1976 beaujolais and burgundies, but it is not until the prices appear in the shops that the full impact is felt.

title: Burn Victims in Critical Phase
description: McGUIRE AIR FORCE BASE, NJ., Wednesday, March 30The head of a team of burn specialists who this morning met the arriving planeload of injured survivors from the disastrous airport collision in the Canary Islands Sunday says that the eight critically burned patients among the survivors had entered the most critical phase of their recovery.

title: Gottfried, Hottest Plays Down 4
description: CARLSBAD, Calif., March 29All of a sudden Brian Gottfried is the man everybody has to beat.

title: A Cage for McGuire
description: ATLANTA, March 29 (AP)Al McGuire, whose team won the National Collegiate basketball championship, has a namesake at the Atlanta Zoo. It is an East African eland, which looks a bit lobe a cow. The new arrival was named McGuire, said Marty Hartman, secretary of the Atlanta Zoological Society, which selected the name in honor of Marquette's victory over North Carolina here last night.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT CLEVELAND

title: EDGAR SMITH ADMITS 57 JERSEY SLAYING
description: SAN DIEGO, March 29 (AP)Edgar Smith, who spent 14 years on Death Row and wrote three books and filed 19 appeals proclaiming his innocence of the murder of a New Jersey teenager, has confessed again to the 20yearold crime.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: House Votes to Extend Job Training
description: WASHINGTON, March 29(UPI)The House today approved a oneyear extension of the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act to allow time to study President Carter's plans to change the Federal role in the program. The approval by voice vote sent the measure to the Senate.

title: JERSEY AND BANKS ACT TO CURB REDLINING
description: NEWARK,March 29A neighborhood loan program designed to end redlining in the state and to make mortgage money more readily available in urban areas, was made public today by state officials, who sold $100 million in taxexempt bonds to start the program.

title: Flyers Thwart Islander Bid And Retain First Place, 31
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 29Wasps and spiders, mongooses and snakes. Islanders and Flyers. Natural enemies, all of them.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place
description: In a series of debtrestructuring transactions of wide interest to investors in real estate investment trusts, the deeply troubled Chase Manhattan Mortgage and Realty Trust is attempting to reestablish itself as a viable business.

title: Bread for Cxevettes, or Just Good Eating
description: 7 cups flour, approximately

title: PART OF SCHOOL DAY CUT IN NEW YORK CITY WILL BE RESTORED
description: ALBANY, March 29Part of the school day in New York City that was cut out in the settlement of a teachers strike in 1975 will be restored under an agreement among the Legislature, the city and the teachers union about how to spend a $26 million windfall that the city school system is to receive under revised formulas in the state's new budget'.

title: BRITISH GET TAX CUT AND CHANCE OF MORE
description: LONDON, March 29The British Government announced modest cuts in personal income taxes today and promised more if the trade unions agree to a third round of voluntary pay restraints in an effort to curb inflation.

title: DOUGLAS A. FARMER, 60, SURGEON IN NEW HAVEN
description: Dr. Douglas A. Farmer, a general surgeon and chairman of the department of surgery at the Hospital of St. Raphael in New Haven, died yesterday at that hospital at the age of 60. He was a resident of Madison, Conn.

title: Harassed Billy Carters to Move
description: NASHVILLE, March 29 (UPI)Billy Carter and his wife are tired of tourists beating on their front door, and fearful someone will kidnap one of their children, so they are moving out of Plains.

title: Summertime Shows Up Early
description: It was a glorious day in New York City yesterdaya day for bicycle riders, for lovers, sunbathers and joggers, a day when a female elephant named Konga stood on her head in the middle of West 33d Street.

title: HouseSitters Guard Even Pets in Suburbs
description: Sometimes it means waking up in a strange bed and wondering, Where am I? or haying a cold war with a ,suspicious pet or groping in the dark for an unfamiliar fuse box. But despite these moments of uncertainty, housesitting is growing in popularity in the New York suburbs.

title: Summertime Shows Up Early
description: It was a glorious day in New York City yesterdaya day for bicycle riders, for lovers, sunbathers and joggers, a day when a female elephant named Konga stood on her head in the middle of West 33d Street.

title: U.S. and Soviet ToForrnPanels OnMajor Issues
description: MOSCOW, March 29Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said here today after the second day of wideranging talks that the United States and the Soviet Union had agreed to establish working groups to discuss issues that could be only initially explored during his visit.

title: Stockton Ascent Recalls A Skinny Kid of the Past
description: New Yorkers may remember Dick Stockton as a skinny little kid who seemed hardly taller than the racquet he carried. He came from a family of tennis players and was winning tournaments around here at the age of 7. Now he has zoomed to the top of the World Championship Tennis ranking, sharing the No. 1 spot with Jimmy Connors.

title: People in Sports
description: Phil Esposito, John Davidson and Dave Maloney will enjoy a consolation prize of sorts as a result of the Rangers failure to qualify for the Stanley Cup hockey playoffs. The three are going to Vienna to play for Team Canada against seven other teams, including the United States, Czechoslovakia and Soviet Union, in the annual world tournament.

title: GiscardFormally Asks Barre to Form New Cabinet
description: PARIS, March 29  President Valery Giscard d'Estaing formally asked Prime Minister Raymond Barre today to form a new cabinet that would devote'. itself to two major taskseconomic recovery and a program to defeat the SocialistCommunist opposition alliance in elections a vear from now.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Babcock Past Linked to Coal; Future Tied to Energy Crisis
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Company is more admired for its future than its past. The past was simply coalfired, steamproducing boilers; the future is tied to the energy crisis.

title: All About: Life On the Trails
description: SO YOU HAVE a mind to join the millions of Americans who are into backpacking. Whether it's just an overnight trip in a nearby state park, a long weeknd in the Adirondacks or White Mountains, hiking the entire Appalachian Trail from Maine to Georgia or a fortnight exploring the back country in one of the national parks. you will need the same basic equipment. Longer trips will merely necessitate extra weight in food and fuel.

title: A Woman Directing in Hollywood  Isn't It About Time?
description: HOLLYWOOD

title: WALDO DE LOS RIOS
description: MADRID,March 29 (AP)The Argentine composer Waldo de los Rios, whose pop versio' of Mozart's Symphony No. 40 was a hit in the United States and other countries, died in a hospital here today of gunshot wounds, the news agency Europa Press reported.

title: CAPITAL APPROPRIATIONS BY UTILITIES ARE CUT 14%
description: Capital appropriations by the nation's investorowned gas and electric utilities fell 14 percent in the fourth quarter of last year, reflecting a slowdown in development of nuclear power, the Conference Board reported yesterday.

title: 3 ELIZABETH BOYS ILL WITH TYPHOID FEVER
description: ELIZABETH, March 29Three young brothers have come down with typhoid fever, and local and state health officials said today that they were attempting to isolate the person who transmitted the disease to the youngsters.

title: UNITED TECHNOLOGIES WILL BID $510 MILLION FOR BABCOCK'S STOCK
description: The United Technologies Corporation, the highly diversified aerospace manufacturing company, said yesterday it planned to offer more than half a billion dollars in cash for the 12.2 million outstanding shares of the Babcock & Wilcox Company, a maker of coaland nuclearfired boilers and one of America's oldest and largest producers of steamgenerating equipment.

title: Justice Proceeds Undampened As U.S. Court House Is Flooded
description: A broken water main flooded the basement of the United States Court House in lower Manhattan early yesterday, knocking out telephones, elevators and most activities in the busy 30story building.

title: Pop: Bonnie Raitt's Soul Bares Festival of Blues
description: BONNIE RAITT'S Monday evening show at Avery Fisher Hall was a kind of small festival of the blues, featuring .more than three hours of music with only one brief intermission. Little Brother Montgomery, the blues pianist and vocalist who opened the show, played a full set, not the usual truncated warmup, and sippie Wallace sang with Mr. Montgomery, with Miss Raitt and band, and with her own piano accompaniment.

title: In Pursuit of the Breeding Atom
description: Brazil asks, rather angrily, why it cannot be trusted with the nuclear technology that promises to make its dynamic economy selfsufficient in energy. The United States replies, rather urgently, that the ability to enrich and reprocess nuclear fuels is also the ability to manufacture nuclear explosives and that the safety of the world depends upon keeping that skill in the fewest possible hands until safer international arrangements can be made.

title: Government Export News Spurs Soybean Advance; Grain Contracts Mixed
description: CHICAGO, March 29 (AP)Soybean futures advanced by as much as 19 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today as four oldcrop contracts moved to new season highs.

title: REORGANIZATION PLAN PASSES HOUSE, 39522
description: WASHINGTON, March 29The House voted today to give President Carter the authority he sought to reorganize the executive branch of the Federal Government, but only after an unexpectedly spirited constitutional debate.

title: NEW AUDITS CHARGE ABUSES OF MEDICAID
description: ALBANY, March 29Auditors for the New York State Health Department have uncovered millions of dollars of alleged overbilling to Medicaid by voluntary nursing homes and healthrelated facilitiesprivate, technically nonprofit organizations, often connected to religious or charitable institutionsthat until now have remained largely unnoticed in the state's nursinghome scandals.

title: Song Pushes Song In She Loves Me
description: A PLAY READING, as against a fullscale performance, concentrates the material enormously. The material needs to be especially strong to survive, and the performance must shine.

description: BASEBALL

title: Women's Golf Event Aglow With Celebs
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., March 29James Garner was there and had a speeding ticket to show for it; Lawrence Welk was there, even though senior citizens were remonstrating over a rent rise in a trailer park he owns; Robert Stack was there to make a fool of myself.

description: Article 3  No Title

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, March 29A number of State Legislators and other officials are keeping on the move in gathering data about casino gamblingessential, it is said, for preparing regulations to control the future gambling palaces of Atlantic. At least seven more legislators are planning official factfinding visits to the world's gambling centers.

title: Voluntary Nursing Homes Said to Overbill Medicaid
description: ALBANY,'March 29Auditors for the New York State Health Department have uncovered millions of dollars of alleged overbilling to Medicaid by voluntary nursing homes and healthrelated facilitiesprivate, technically nonprofit organizations, often connected to religious or charitable institutionsthat until now have remained largely unnoticed in the state's nursinghome scandals.

title: Treasury Weighs Charges That Japanese Producers Are Dumping Steel in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 (AP)The Treasury announced today it was investigating whether some $180 million worth of Japanese steel was being dumped in the United States by selling it at prices below those charged in Japan.

title: Municipal Workers Union Opens National Attack on Atlanta Mayor
description: ATLANTA, March 29In a move that has important implications for the organization of public employees throughout the South. the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees has begun an unprecedented and virulent nationwide advertising campaign aimed at discrediting Maynard Jackson, this city's black Mayor.

title: Murphy Named Presiding Judge Of Appellate Division by Governor
description: Justice Francis T. Murphy Jr. was named yesterday by Governor Carey as presiding justice of the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in the First Departmentone of the highest judicial posts in the state.

title: SaccharinProduct Plant Going Full Tilt Under Load of Orders
description: When the Food and Drug Administration first announced its proposal for a saccharin ban more than two weeks ago, the Cumberland Packing Corporation, makers of Sweet n Low, planned to shut its Brooklyn factory and lay off 500 workers.

description: Front Page 1  No Title

title: British Reject American's Plea
description: LONDON, March 29The Court of Appeal today turned down a plea by Mark Hosenball, an American newspaperman, to cancel a deportation order against him. The Government has charged that his presence is a threat to Britain's security. The appeal was his last legal resort.

title: Egypt Fails to Win U .N . Endorsement Of Role for P. L. O.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 29The Security Council adjourned its current Middle East debate tonight without fulfilling Egyptian hopes for a statement favoring participation of the Palestine Liberation Organization In peace negotiations in Geneva.

title: Goheen Is Reported Choice of President For Envoy to India
description: WASHINGTON, March 29 The White House plans to appoint Robert F. Goheen, the former president of Princeton University, as Ambassador to India, representing the United States during a period of internal change in India that could lead to closer relations between the two nations.

title: In Paris, a Fashion Balloon
description: AT KENZO: bubbles, balloons and hobble skirts. At Saint Laurent: smocks, pantaloons and bloused pants. It will be difficult after this for a woman to wear a tradition ball gown to a ball. And the standard tailored suit? Forget it.

title: Spring Buds: WalltoWall People and Tea with Grace
description: Even the people who had never met themand their numbers were legion thought that Lynn Redgrave and John Clark looked like pleasant types, which was rather nice because it was, after all, the Clarks 10th wedding anniversary party and it's always a plus to like the hosts.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, MARCH 30, 1977

title: Soviet Nuclear Test Reported
description: OSLO, Norway, March 29(AP)Scientists said here today that the Soviet Union apparently set off an underground nuclear explosion this morning at its Central Asian testing grounds in the Semipalatinsk area

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In an article about young people in Seattle and an accompanying photograph that appeared in The Times on Monday, the family name of a couple was given incorrectly. The correct names are David and Christine Williams.

title: Film: Last of the Hippies Flies 'Off the Wall'
description: OFF THE WALL," which opened a week's run yesterday at the Whitney Museum, looks very much like a movie made by film-school graduates before they had anything of interest to make a movie about.It pretends to be the footage shot by a television crew studyingfor reasons never explainedthe life of a young, middle-class drifter named John Little (Harvey Waldman), a fellow who describes himself as "the last of the hippies" but who looks and behaves more like a bearded actor improvising aimlessness on film. About halfway through the movie, John holds up a bank in California and steals $5,000 as well as the television crew's camera and sound equipment, thus to continue photographing his story himself.In its preoccupation with the movie camera and with the notion that the camera must be able to capture truth, "Off the Wall" recalls Jim McBride's classic send-up of cinma vrit, "David Holzman's Diary," about a young man who became so obsessed with photographing his life he could no longer live it."Off the Wall" is neither satiric nor funny. It's as earnest and unsurprising as a term paper. As John wanders from California to New York and back again, he keeps attempting to get a fix on where his head is at.When he fails, he gets mad and kicks television sets, refrigerator doors and Coke machines. Looking at a naked light bulb, he lunges at a poetic truth, wondering if he could stare at the bulb until it goes out. "It'slikethe opposite of enlightenment," he muses. "Instead of waiting for the light, you wait for the dark."Rick King directed and wrote the film, although Mr. Waldman receives screen credit for additional dialogue.

title: DOW UP 5.90 POINTS AS A MARKET RALLY ENDS 8DAY DECLINE.
description: Stock prices rebounded yesterday after falling for eight straight sessions in the longest losing streak since the bleak bear market in the autumn of 1974.

title: Kenyon & Eckhardt Wins Talyor Account
description: In a competition involving several other ad agencies Kenyon & Eckhardt has won the Taylor Wine Company account.

title: About Real Estate
description: Some people speak of 1166 Avenue of the Americas as the biggest single realestate disaster in the country. The cumulative losses on this stilluntenanted office building on the east side of the avenue between 45th and 46th Streets probably come to $70 million to $80 million.

title: Child's World
description: WALK DOWN the supermarket aisle under the sign that says baby food and you're likely to be as dismayed as ever. Despite conspicuous attempts by baby food companies to reduce the nonessential ingredients, salt is still on the list of ingredi ents of some vegetables. Some naturally sweet fruits are further sweetened with corn syrup. And there's still starch aplenty in many baby food jars. Moreover, sometimes you can't tell what the labels Mean. One label, with strange redundancy, describes its contents as Chicken, water, cooked chicken . . .
